They are customers from the month of November, and are in the first cycle of the program of the foundation’s women entrepreneurs. They are hardworking and enterprising women fighting to keep their families prosperous because they want to give them a better future.

One of the members is Ramona who works every day and has made many sacrifices to push forward and help her family. She tells us that she works selling all types of clothing, and she is not doing badly, she always makes sales, and she wants to be able to continue growing her business, and this is why she is asking for a loan to buy all types of clothing in order to stock up and in this way to have more variety to offer her clients.

She is just like her friends in the group; all of them are grateful for the help that the foundation and Kiva gives them.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell later

loans.name: Fabiola Vanessa

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fabiola, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 2 años  de edad. Su esposo es ayudante en un bus de transporte.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días de la semana más que todo en las mañanas, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Lleva dos años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren  a pesar de que hay mucha competencia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos  y  le gusta por la ayuda y los beneficios que recibe de la institución. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Los  Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great variety of local products, such as the Panama hat, renowned in and outside of the country. Here, the members of the communal bank “Mi Banquito” meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Fabiola who is 20 and married. She and her husband have a 2-year-old. Her husband is an assistant on a transport bus. 

She goes door to door selling all kinds of clothing. She also sells out of a small location in her home. She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs. She has been doing this work for 2 years, and it has gone really well since many clients prefer her in spite of all the competition. 

She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothes. She has been part of the communal bank for three loan cycles. She likes it for the help and benefits it gives her. 

Her dreams are to advance in life and to continue with her sales.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juan Antenor

texts.es:
Juan, de 33 años de edad, es comerciante vive en Granada, es casado tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad respectivamente. El trabajo junto con su esposa en una distribuidora de alimentos varios el vende productos pero además de eso el tiene un equipo de disco móvil que se encarga de amenizar eventos como bodas, quince años, cumpleaños, bautizos, promoción de productos. Este negocio lo empezó hace 5 años con un primo, Juan fue comprando de pieza en pieza  hasta lograr conformar su disco móvil.  
El realizo el crédito para comprar de  2 poder (power) para levantar el audio de su disco móvil. Esto le será de mucha ayuda ya que necesita equipos en buen estado de funcionamiento para brindar un servicio de calidad y atraer más clientes. Una  de sus metas es  hacerle mejoras como pintar y comprar llantas a su camioneta que utiliza para transportar su disco móvil además que desea compra una casa para darle un techo propio a sus hijos  y no tengan que andar rodando.
texts.en:
Juan, age 33, is a merchant who lives in Granada. He is married and has two children, ages 9 and 11 respectively. Juan and his wife work together in a food distribution center where they sell different products, but he also owns sound equipment that he uses as a mobile disk jockey for events such as weddings, quinceañeras, birthdays, baptisms, and product marketing promotions. He started this business with his cousin five years ago. Juan bought his equipment piece by piece until he was fully equipped to become a mobile disk jockey.

This loan will be used to buy two amplifiers for increasing the volume of the sound output from his mobile disk jockey equipment. This will be of great help because he needs his equipment to function well so that he can provide quality service and attract more clients. One of his goals is to make improvements, such as paint and new tires, to the truck that he uses to transport his mobile disk jockey equipment. Juan wants to buy a house so that his children can have a roof of their own and not have to move around.

loans.use: to buy two sound amplifiers.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Iman is a divorced woman has a lot of will power can overcome all the obstacles in her life, and she lives with her parents ‎in Salt.‎
She decided to do her best and working hard to be able help her family and to be productive woman.‎
Iman is 35 years old divorced woman, she opened her small business which selling traditional dress for clothes which ‎called “Abaya”, she rented a shop in busy area in Salt and she is working hard to provide a living for her parents.‎
She is very ambitious and patient woman, now she wants to buy more “Abaya” and new kinds of clothes to sell but she ‎does not has enough money therefore she decided to apply for a loan to increase her incomes and to be able to cover the ‎treatment expenses for her parents also to improve the standards of living for her and her parents, Iman needs your ‎support.‎

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Basile

texts.en:
Mr. Basile S. is a teacher by profession. After 2 years, he abandoned his job for the bakery, as teaching provided him practically no income. A married father of three (3) children, Mr. S. is marrying his second wife after the death of his first. Blessed with a spirit of creativity and a good sense of management, he offers quality service to his clientele. Demand is now very high, and he is researching ways to strengthen his business.

He is asking for a loan in the amount of $850 to install a second oven and expand his sales to other markets in the region. The profits will allow him to care for the health, nourishment and education of his children; in short, to lead a better life.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Basile est enseignant de profession. Depuis 2 ans, il a abandonné son travail au profit de la boulangerie car l’enseignement ne lui rapportait pratiquement rien. Marié et père de trois (3) enfants, Monsieur S. va épouser une seconde femme après le décès de la première. Doté d’un esprit de créativité et d’un sens élevé de gestion, il offre un service de qualité à sa clientèle. Aujourd’hui, la demande est très forte et il recherche des moyens pour renforcer son activité.

Il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $850 pour installer un second four et étendre la vente sur les autres marchés de la région. Les bénéfices serviront à s’occuper de la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants, bref à mener une vie meilleure.

loans.use: Install a second oven

loans.name: Gabino

texts.en:
Gabino is married and has four children, ages 30, 28, 25 and 14. He started his convenience store in 1990. He worked for the defense department and for his job had to be away from the city for long periods. His wife and kids ran the business while he was away to help settle family and school expenses. In 1997, Gabino dedicated himself full-time to his store and purchased a copier, a refrigerator for drinks and milk products, and a counter in order to offer a better-quality service to his customers, and now the business is growing.

With the new acquisitions he has made to improve the store, Gabino doesn't have the capital to invest in merchandise, and he is asking for a $925 loan to meet this objective and help his business grow. He needs your help and appreciates whatever support you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Gabino es casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 30, 28, 25 y el menor de 14 años de edad. Inició su negocio de abarrotes en 1990, él trabajaba en la Secretaria de la Defensa Nacional y por su empleo tenia que estar fuera de la ciudad por largos periodos, por lo que su esposa y sus hijos emprendieron este negocio para solventar los gastos del hogar y la escuela, en 1997 Don Gabino se dedicó por completo a su abarrote y compraron una copiadora, un refrigerador para refrescos y lácteos, y un mostrador, con los que pudieron ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes, y ahora su negocio ha estado creciendo.

Con las nuevas adquisiciones que han hecho para mejorar el negocio, Don Gabino se ha quedado sin capital para invertir en mercancía, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará con este fin, para hacer crecer su negocio. Don Gabino necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece cualquier apoyo que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for convenience store

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina is 39 years old. She is married and has 9 children. Her husband works in the fields. She buys fruits and vegetables from farmers and sells them, in small baskets, from her home, where people from the community come to buy from her. She belongs to the “Mezte Group 4”. The other member of the group is Jesús Olivia Gómez Gómez, who also sells fruits and vegetables. With the loan they want to set up a business where they can sell their products to the general public. They also want to be able to take their products to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ALBERTINA TIENE 39 AÑOS, CASADA 9 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO. ELLA COMPRA FRUTAS Y VERDURAS A LOS AGRICULTORES Y LOS VENDE EN SU CASA EN PEQUEÑOS CANASTOS DONDE LA GENTE DE LA COMUNIDAD VA A COMPRAR. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO MEZTE 4 , LA OTRA COMPONENTE DEL GRUPO ES DOÑA JESUS OLIVIA G. G. QUIEN TAMBIEN TRABAJA VENDIENDO FRUTAS Y VERDURAS .ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INSTALAR UN NEGOCIO EN DONDE PUEDAN VENDER A PUBLICO GENERAL SU MERCADERIA Y TAMBIEN PODER LLEVAR SUS PRODUCTOS AL MERCADO.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar M. is 70 years old, married, and lives with his 5 children in the Khoshchobanli village, situated in Imishli in the sothern part of Azerbaijan. Eldar has been running his small business since 1990 when he bought his first cow which started bringing him considerable income in less than six months. Eldar used his first income to buy a calf which has now grown up and produces milk. Supporting a family of six is not easy, and, because over the years the price of a lot of goods has increased, raising catle has become more difficult. To be able to better provide for his family's needs, Eldar has applied for a loan of US$1,200 to buy another cow and a calf. Their estimated prices are US$800 and US$400, respectively.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a calf

loans.name: María Eusebia

texts.en:
María is the kind of person who thinks that getting older is not synonymous for sluggishness but an opportunity to keep working and positively impacting society. Mother of 2 children (boy and girl), this woman of 48 years old is happily selling second-hand clothes and cosmetic products. She started the business when she was 40 and is still working to improve it day by day.

María has been selling the products in her house and sometimes delivering the goods to the customers’ houses, but now, she plans to do business in another way. She will buy used clothes in bulk, wholesale, and resell them in smaller quantities (retail wholesale) to other women of the community who will then retail the clothes. However, she’ll keep on selling the cosmetic products retail.

Furthermore, María wants to rent a small place to store the merchandise purchased. She believes that her new business ideas will be successful since the holiday season is when people buy a lot of clothes in her community. Earning extra money will help her cover the university expenses of her children.

loans.use: To buy in bulk used clothes to resell to other women in the community who will then sell them retail

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
In the midst of the busy Nery García Market, Dolores H. O. D. Jota can be found sitting at her stand behind a mountain of bananas. For the past 2 years, this friendly businesswoman has been selling fruit from her permanent stand. The bananas she sells arrive directly and daily from the forests outsiD. her city of Ayacucho, Perú. These she is able to sell all year round, Dolores explains, and she sells some seven different varieties from extremely small bananas to very large and round and even red bananas. Dolores also sells whatever type of fruit happens to be in season, for example, today one can find a wiD. variety of pineapples, mangos, and papayas.

Year before, Dolores was an “ambulante,” which means she sold in the markets, but without a fixed stand, having to cart her fruits around with her all day long. She was also only able to stock smaller amounts of fruits which came from the capital city of Lima, instead of fresh from the forests and harvesters in the countrysiD.. It was only through very hard work that Dolores was eventually able to earn her own stand within the market, and it is with that same diligence that she continues to work everyday from 3 am to 6 pm, doing everything within her power to continue growing her business and her clientele. Her goal she says is to open a second stand next door, from which she would expand her market and sell spices.

With the help of loans from her village bank, Dolores has been able to grow her business and support her family of a husband and seven children. She says she is infinitely grateful to have received the economic help through miroloans, something that has taught her how to manage her business in a responsible and punctual fashion. Dolores is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy and sell even larger quantities of bananas, facilitating greater profits.

loans.use: Buy and sell larger quantities of bananas.

loans.name: Makhmadrozik

texts.en: Makhmadrozik B. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 3 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004, and loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and  an income increase. He recommends himself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He is engaged in commercial services and trade. He works in the bazaar where his meat-selling shop is located. Makhmadrozik B. has an assortment of goods and is a straight supplier, which allows him to work with clients of different income levels. He also has permanent clients. But he wants to widen the size of his shop to allows him to increase the turnover and assortment. He requests a loan for 2,500 TJS (US$725) to widen the existing shop and assortment and to develop the business.

loans.use: to increase the turnover and assortment

loans.name: Kapemba's Ngura Moja Group

texts.en:
Kapemba, age 37, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 12). She owns a beauty salon which she started in 2007. She works there as a hairdresser from 7am to 9pm daily and her services bring her a profit of about $60 each month.

In the past, Kapemba took out a loan to buy more necessities for her salon. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in fish and general items sales.

loans.use: To expand salon's services

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a 50-year-old woman who struggles to improve her six children’s living conditions. To earn a living, she sells fried vegetables and fried chicken in her community. Santa has been running her business for more than ten years.

With her loan, Santa will buy a large amount of raw materials and other goods in order to expand her inventory and attract new clients. Santa hopes that someday she will have sufficient money to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and other goods to expand a small business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Jacqueline L., who is married with two children, aged 7 and 9.
In 2007, Jacqueline established a liquor store business, and now requests a loan of $225 in order to purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Ruth Amalia

texts.es:
Ruth Amalia is a young mother from Somotillo. She makes a living by selling clothing with the unique purpose of finishing reconstruction on her house, which was damaged a long time ago by natural phenomenons. For her, her priority is her young daughter, and that is why she is looking for the way to offer her better living conditions so she can have a decent roof over her head where she can develop and at the same time improve the conditions for her clothing business.

It's necessary to point out that upon starting her reconstruction, she didn't manage to finish because of economic reasons. Nevertheless, she is now willing to continue until she finishes, and this is her main motive for turning to Ceprodel: to obtain credits that will allow her to acquire the construction materials for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ruth Amalia es una joven madre originaria del municipio de Somotillo el cual se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa con el único propósito de terminar de reconstruir su casa de habitación que ha sido lastimada desde hace mucho tiempo por los fenómenos naturales. Para ella su prioridad es su pequeña hija y es por esto que busca la manera de proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida para que su pequeña posea un techo digno donde desarrollarse y a la vez para mejorar las condiciones del negocio de la venta de ropa.

Es necesario destacar que al haber iniciado su reconstrucción no logró terminar por el factor económico, sin embargo hoy en día está dispuesta a continuar hasta terminar la obra siendo este el motivo principal por el cual acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for her home

loans.name: Francisco Jorge

texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old and originally from Beira, in the Sofala Province. Francisco is married and has 5 children. All children are currently attending school.

In 1971, Francisco moved to Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo, with his family. He studied until 8th grade and stopped because of financial and transportation difficulties. The secondary school was located in Maputo and public buses or mini-buses were almost inexistent and very expensive. Francisco started to work with his father, a goldsmith. Francisco and his father used to buy raw materials in Maputo, but with the Mozambican civil war, they started buying in the north of the country instead, which increased their production costs.

Today Francisco has a small store in Boane where he sells his jewellery as well as clothes. Francisco makes earrings, rings and necklace with red gold, the local available raw material. Francisco buys the gold in Maputo at MTn 600 per gram. Earrings are his most popular products and are sold for MTn 250 to MTn 2,500. Francisco’s wife works at the store and they make between MTn 3,000 to MTn 6,000 per day. The other products that Francisco sells he buys in Maputo 3 times per week, going with public transportation.

This will be Francisco’s third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The first MTn 10,000 was used to buy raw materials to work as a goldsmith. The second loan of MTn 30,000 was used to start a wood business that didn’t work out. Francisco planned to buy wood in the north of the country and sell in Maputo, but as he was new to the business he didn’t forecast all the difficulties and failed. This third loan of MTn 12,000 will again be used to buy raw material (mainly gold), so that Francisco can produce many products to sell. He would like to increase his store’s inventory to attract more clients and increase his monthly income.

In the future Francisco would like to have a gold manufacturing company, producing earrings and rings in large quantities and selling to all jewellers in Maputo.

loans.use: Buy raw material to work as a goldsmith

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi T., 48 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. She has 2 children, one of which is living with her and the other is working, earning approximately 120 USD/month. Living in rural area, she used her borrowed money in breeding animals. At first, she used 120 USD borrowed from the Fund to invest in breeding animals. She now is able to furnish her house and improve her family living conditions. This time, Mrs. T. wants to borrow 550 USD to breed chickens and pigs. Her average income is approximately 225 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, chị Bùi Thị T. 48 tuôi, chị có 2 con, 1 con đã trưởng thành, 1 con đang sống cùng chị và cũng đã có công việc ổn định T. nhâp bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Là một vùng sống chủ yếu vào nông nghiệp, nên việc vay vốn của gia đình chị đều được anh chị lựa chọn vào đầu tư chăn nuôi. Số vốn vay đầu tiên là 2.000.000đ, các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị cũng đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, với việc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình, mọi sinh hoạt trong gia đình đã được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay mức vốn 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. T. nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: breeding chickens and pigs

loans.name: Adugbe

texts.en:
Adugbe A. is a fishmonger. She is a widow with 4 children. Demand for her fish is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Mr. Moustapha D. is a trained upholsterer with more than 30 years' experience. He is married and the father of three children. He was granted a Kiva loan that he repaid without difficulty. He is asking for this loan with a view to buying raw materials for his upholstery business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

mr moustapha D. est un tapissier de profession de plus de trente années d'expérience .il est marié et père de trois enfants .il a eu à bénéficier d'un pret kiva qu'il a soldé sans difficulté .il demande ce pret dans le but de s'approvisionner en matières premières pour la tapisserie.

loans.use:
purchase of materials for upholstering furniture

achat de matériels de tapisserie

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta is a married mom. She effectively manages her small business selling men's and women's clothing in a market of Pereschepino. She has been in this trade for nine years and presently her income is about $1200 a month.

Sveta is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivna ($US550). She is hoping to purchase additional merchandise and meet the needs of her customers.

Sveta is an entrepreneur of integrity and consistency. She has proven to be a reliable client working with Nadiya Ukraine. Her outstanding credit history secures prompt repayment of the current loan as well.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra M. is a woman with many strengths. She has a business selling clothing, which she has managed to expand. She is also very proud of being a grandmother; she already has a grandson who is her responsibility. She is dedicated to caring for him at all times. It is for this reason that she works everyday. She wants to support her young daughter as her daughter cares for her small son.

Zuhra has worked in her business for 14 long years. She used to acquire clothes sporadically, but at very high prices. For this reason she came to Dushanbe; she wanted to receive loans so she could acquire merchandise in bulk to then market and sell it. She has received 6 loans, all repaid on time and in the correct manner. These loans have been used to buy stock and to improve the quality of life for her, her daughter and her grandson.

Now Zuhra is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1025 USD) for the term of 7 months. She wants to increase the selection of her autumn clothing she has for sale. You could become an important part in Zuhra's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase children’s clothing in order to increase the selection of goods for sale

loans.name: Bde Amistad Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five people hoping to receive another loan. Each person in this group has received loans in the past and have all paid back all the loan payments. Each member has had some success with their business and is now at the point where they want to expand and start generating more income.

Juana G. is the group representative and is a very dedicated mother to three children. She works as hard as she does because she wants a better life for her children. She says that her main goal is to get her children educated so they can get out of their poverty and live a better life. She has a small business selling used clothing in her area and hopes to one day have her own clothing store. She dreams of traveling and having her own house. This loan could be the start of getting her to those dreams and getting her children to college!

On behalf of Juana, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Purchase clothing at low prices

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara A. is a 33-year-old married woman with three kids. They are currently in school. For the past two years, she has worked as a trader: she trades in jeans, clothes, blouses, skirts, women's underwear, bags, and plastic materials. Sara says her husband had provided the working capital for her business, but that such capital is inadequate to sustain her business because she is unable to purchase high-quality products. 

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into her trade to enable her purchase high-quality products in large quantities, which she believe will scale up sales. She is a member of a community group known as the "Abrabopa" (Translated, Good Life) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. Sara had joined her group at a meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To  purchase more jeans, ladies' clothing, and slippers

loans.name: Olga Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 31 años de edad, es separada y madre de 2 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 500 compró combustibles para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta de cigarrillos al por mayor y hace tejidos para vender.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de cigarrillos para vender en las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo. 
Ella desea continuar trabajando para llegar a tener su tienda propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Sofía C. is a member of the “Dante Nava” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 31 years old, separated and has 2 children.

With her first 500.00 PEN loan, she purchased fuel to sell at her stand. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year now, and she states that she is also a cigarette wholesaler and sells handwoven knitwear.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of cigarettes to sell during the Christmas and year-end festivities.

Ms. C. wishes to continue working so that she can one day open up her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cigarettes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She sells snacks, drinks and poultry. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and snacks as well as more birds for her poultry business to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more snacks, drinks and poultry birds

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es: Lauro tiene 38 años de edad, está separado desde hace dos años, vive solo en una casa alquilada, mientras que sus 3 hijos viven con su ex esposa. El labrado de la tierra y el cuidado de la plantas es parte de su vida, desde su niñez ha realizado estos trabajos, pero el año pasado no logró sembrar como anhelaba debido a la alza de los abonos que llegaron a costar 215 soles por saco de lo que costaba 60 soles, debido a este obstáculo el dinero que tenía para esa inversión no le alcanzó; desde entonces se siente un poco mortificado. Pero ahora que ha bajado los precios de los fertilizantes a 95 soles nuevamente la alegría toca a su corazón y sus anhelos regresaron, se está proyectando para sembrar dos hectáreas de plántanos. Sus problemas conyugales a un inicio le habían afectado mucho y en ocasiones no realizaba sus trabajo como era bebido, pero ahora ya se siente más motivado, y con el tiempo espera convertirse en un gran agricultor. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha colaborado en todas las actividades que realiza su banco comunal, y más aun en sus compromisos de pagos siempre cumplió de acuerdo a sus cronogramas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantitas de plátanos, ya que sembrará 2 hectáreas y para ello necesita dos mil plantas.
texts.en:
Lauro is 38 years old and has been separated for two years. He lives alone in a rental house. His three children live with his ex-wife. Working the soil and caring for plants is part of his life. Since his childhood he has carried out these jobs, but last year he wasn't able to do the planting he wanted because of an increase in fertilizer prices. The price rose to 215 soles per sack where it had been 60 soles. Because of this difficulty, the money he had for that investment was not enough to cover the cost. Since then he has felt a little distressed. But now that the fertilizer prices are at 95 soles he his happy again, and his desire to farm has returned. He plans to plant two hectares of bananas. His marital problems affected him a lot in the beginning, and he occasionally missed work because of his drinking, but now he is feeling more motivated. In time, he hopes to become a great farmer. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he has always collaborated in all of the activities that his communal bank offered. He has always been responsible about making his payments on time. He is requesting money to buy banana seedlings. Since he is planting two hectares, he will need two thousand plants.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana plants

loans.name: Saoly

texts.en: Mrs. Saoly M. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Hort Sal, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In their vegetable growing, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to buy corn seed, pesticide or to plow and hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, Mrs. Saoly M. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes. She is 29 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy corn seed and pesticide, to plow the field, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Ivania Patricia

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Ivania G. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana atendiendo a todos sus clientes muy amablemente.

La circunstancia que hoy en día ella atraviesa es que requiere del capital financiero para la compra de los productos y es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito y así mejorar su condición económica que hoy en día atraviesa.
texts.en:
Every day, in the market “La Terminal” in the city of León, Mrs. Ivania G. works at her grocery store business with much energy and dedication. Beginning in the early hours of the morning, she amiably attends to all her clients. Right now, her circumstances are such that she needs capital to finance the purchase of merchandise. For that reason she is turning to Ceprodel to obtain a loan so that she can improve her economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy N. is single with no children, and has a junior high school education. She works as a trader and baker selling goods such as bread, eggs, and rice at Eguase near Cape Coast. She has worked in this trade since 2000. Lucy uses her income to pay for rent and utility bills. She will use the loan to help further expand her business in the bakery. With the new profits from her business, Lucy plans to buy land which she will eventually build a home on.

loans.use: To further expand her business in the bakery.

loans.name: Ahmad Zuvdiun

texts.en:
Ahmad Zuvdiun is the son of M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married, has two children and he needs a small loan for his business. He wants to expand the shop where he sells clothes. 

He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani ($1025 US) for the term of 12 months. He wants to expand and increase his business and to complete the necessary materials for his shop. 

He is very happy with this small loan effort in Afghanistan that helps poor people. He thanks all lenders of AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: For business expansion and progress: clothes shop.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel L. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and married. To make a living, Liezel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Liezel is just starting this business.

In 2008, Liezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Liezel is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liezel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Josefina es casada, tiene 73 años y 4 hijos, Josefina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, en el ultimo mes alquilo un kiosco en un lugar mas transitado en donde venderá golosinas, frutas y comida. Además Josefina vende quesos a los trabajadores de diferentes instituciones.
Josefina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Josefina son ahorrar para su vejez y descansar.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the Estrella Communal Bank.
Josefina is 73 years old, married and has 4 children. Josefina runs a store from her home selling general groceries. Last month she rented a kiosk in a busier location where she will sell sweets, fruit and food. Josefina also sells cheese to the workers of various organisations.
Josefina needs an 800 PEN loan to purchase cheese.
Josefina dreams of saving up so that she can relax in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Angela del Rosario J. F., Paula del Socorro C. y Julia Margarita M...

 Este grupo tiene su domicilio en  la ciudad de Masaya en comarca San Blass, estas tres mujeres tienen actividades comerciales diferentes, se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra. 

Doña Angela vende perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene dos hijos de edad adolescentes  que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado y es agricultor, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Doña Paula del Socorro es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene un puesto de perecederos en el mercado donde ofrece productos como: chayotes,  ayotes , sandías etc., sueña con terminar la casa que está construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.
Tiene un hijo pequeño, no tiene esposo, ella vive con su mamá y se propone hacer crecer el negocio para salir adelante.

Doña Julia Margarita al igual que las otras dos se dedica a la misma actividad, ella es una mujer joven y tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive con su esposo y están terminando de comprar un terreno para un día construir su casa.
Ella invierte el crédito en comprar verduras que vienen de la zona norte del país.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Angela del Rosario J. F., Paula del Socorro C. y Julia Margarita M..
This group resides in the city of Masaya, in the San Blass district. These three women run separate businesses, have known each other for many years and have a great deal of confidence in each other.
Angela sells perishable goods at the Masaya market. She purchases fruit wholesale and sells it retail during the day. She has two teenaged children who attend school. Her husband is a farmer and works in the same market; she helps him with household expenses. She has been in this trade since she was very young and plans to grow her business in order to improve her home.
Paula del Socorro coordinates the group. She has a perishable goods stall in the market where she offers products like: chayotes, squash, watermelons, etc. She hopes to finish building a house on the land she owns and move in very soon. She has one small child, she isn’t married and lives with her mother. She plans to make her business grow in order to succeed.
Julia Margarita is in the same business as the other two. She is a young woman who lives with her husband and two small children. They have almost finished purchasing land to one day build their home. She is using the loan to purchase vegetables from the northern part of the country.
They say that Adim’s training has taught them to better manage their businesses, as well as helped them grow personally.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale to sell retail

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elizabeth O. G. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria.
Maria Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como talco, cremas, perfumes, labiales, etc, los cuales vende a sus amistades y familiares.
Con su primer crédito compró productos de belleza para tener en stock y vender con mayor facilidad.
Este crédito de S/. 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de conejos, los que criara para posteriormente venderlos.
Maria Elizabeth tiene como sueño tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elizabeth O. G. is 30 years old and lives in Moche district, Trujillo province, in the departament of La Libertad, Perú. She has studied up to fifth grade of high school. Maria Elizabeth sells beauty products such as talc, lotions, perfumes, and lipsticks to friends and relatives. She used her first loan to buy these products so she would have them in stock ready for sale. This new loan of S/.800 soles will be used to buy rabbits which she will then sell. Her dream is to open her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery purchase

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 41 años, vive con sus 3 hijos menores en su casa propia. Tiene 21 años de experiencia en la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino, diariamente sale a pastear a sus animales a campos lejanos que requiere de hasta 3 horas de caminata. En algunas ocasiones sale con sus hijos cuando tiene tiempo libre de la escuela. Los animales que cría los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad y la rentabilidad que le producen le permite sostener con éxito los gastos familiares. Para más adelante, Bernardo comprará más animales para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él considera que pertenecer a un banco comunal ha sido muy enriquecedor, debido a que ha crecido como persona y se ha fortalecido en el valor de la responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita será para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y semilla para sembrar pastos que servirán también de alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 41 years old and lives with his three young children in his own home. He has 21 years' experience in raising cattle and sheep. He leaves daily to graze his animals in distant fields, some a three-hour's walk away. Sometimes he takes his children when they have free time from school. Once they are grown, he sells the animals at his town's livestock market, and the profitability has allowed him to have sustained success with household expenses. In the future, Bernardo plans to buy more animals to increase his working capital. This is the fourth time he has requested a loan from Kiva partner MFP, and he considers belonging to a community bank to be very enriching, and he credits it with helping him grow as a person and strengthening his value of responsibility. The money he is currently requesting will be used to purchase balanced nutrition for his animals as well as seeds to plant pastures that will also feed his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his livestock

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en: Yoeung M., a 39-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province, earns a living by raising pigs in a stall next to her house. She raises two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months, earning an income of approximately $2 a day since 1990.  She is married with four children who attend school and are dependent on her income. Her husband is currently contributing to the family's living expenses by constructing the neighbor's fishing boat. Due to the need for more income to support the family, Yoeung M. is requesting a loan to buy a cow which she will use to transport carving wood from the forest for sale.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Pahaj Group

texts.es: Las Mujeres del grupo Pahaj han llegado a la ASOCIACION ASDIR para pedir ayuda por incrementar sus capitales y asi poder vender y obtener màs ganancias para el sostenimiento de sus familia ya que ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica  y estas ventas que relizan en otros pueblos con el fin de obtener otro nivel de vida ya que ellas caminan  mucho para llegar a vender sus mercaderia y asi poder ayudar a sus hijos tanto en los gastos escolares como en la comida y ropa de ellos por lo tanto acuden para darle ese apoyo ya que en el Municipio de Nahualà hay mucha pobreza. Ya que los hombre ganan muy poco y ellas tienen que ir a vender las ropas tipicas muy lejanas a la localidad para luego traer el sustento.

loans.use: Aplicacion de Capital

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya A. is a single mother who lives with her 2-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Enkhtuya operates a used-clothing business in the Narantuul Market, one of the largest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2003 with the help of her supportive aunt, and now she owns her own stall at the market and is getting more customers every day. 

This successful business has allowed Enkhtuya to buy her own ger where she and her daughter can live comfortably.  She lost both of her parents when she was a young child, and because of that, she wants her daughter to have everything that she never had.  This is why Enkhtuya works hard every day and is making the most out of her clothing business. She would like to learn how to drive and purchase a car so that she can pick up items for her business instead of having to rely on delivery drivers. 

Enkhtuya is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 tugtug (~1200 USD) to purchase clothing, such as socks and jeans from China.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, such as socks and jeans, from China

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch P., 57, is married and has five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. She is engaged in the agriculture business of growing rice and raising pigs on her own plot of farmland, earning approximately an income of US $2.5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family is also assisted by Peav’s husband. He works with his wife at the rice field. Four of their children are employed at different workplaces in the town as a gardener and housekeeper, and the other two are construction workers. They are able to earn a reasonable income to help cover the family’s household expenses. The members of P.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cows and pigs to help them at the field and raise more pigs for resale. By doing so, P. hopes that her agricultural business will go well so that she is able to generate extra income for the future household use.

loans.use: To buy more cows and pigs.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Samoeun T., age 39, and his wife, Mrs. Pisethy Kosal, age 25, have been married for five years. They have one son and one daughter. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samoeun has been an electrician for one year, while his wife has been selling roast beef in front of her house for one year as well. Samoeun is requesting his first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Juralyn

texts.en:
Juralyn A. is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Juralyn is widowed and has 1 small child. To make a living, Juralyn owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Juralyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase a fishing boat. Juralyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Juralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha K. has a drug store with a class C License which enables him to sell essential drugs.  He started this business eleven years ago as a drug peddler. He has constructed a small store along the main road to provide convenient storage facility for the drugs. Mustapha is married and has two children. His store is open for seventeen hours every day and his wife provides the necessary support to run the store. Now ideally located, he wants to increase his stock and hire a druggist on a part-time basis so that he can be qualified to include controlled but essential drugs to his stock items.  Mustapha is intelligent and determined, he wants to construct a small house for his family in the future.

loans.use: Buy drugs to sell

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita L. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Rolita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolita owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Rolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Albertina Cleotilde

texts.es:
la señora Albertina Cleotide Z. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en en union libre y su compañero de hogar trabaja en infop una institucion que se dedica a capacitar a personas en todos las areas, es una institucion gubernamental.
tienen una hija que depende de ellos al 100%.
Albertina se dedica a la comercializacion de ropa como ser: pantalones, faldas, vestidos, blumers, bikinis etc. Albertna realiza esta actividad desde hace varios años, es su unica fuente de ingresos. 
 
esta solicitando este crédito para comprar mercaderia al por mayor, ya que en estos momentos tiene poca mercaderia y al comprarla al por mayor obtiene mayores ganancias, las cuales las utiliza para compartir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina Cleotide Z. is 42 years old and in a common law marriage. Her husband works at INFOP, a government organization that works to train people. They have a daughter who is 100% dependent upon them. Albertina works selling clothing, such as pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, swimsuits, etc. She has done this for many years, and it is her only source of income.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise in bulk, since she now has a small quantity of merchandise and buying in bulk provides higher income, which she will then use for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts, blouses, jeans, socks, and underwear

loans.name: Alejandrina Nelly

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandrina Nelly C. P. de 59 años de edad, es viuda con 4 hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Tiene casa propia de material de adobe ubicada en el Distrito de Ocucaje. Trabaja en su propio negocio de ropa desde hace 3 años. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró sacar adelante a sus hijos y adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para cápital de trabajo. Su sueño es lograr tener su negocio grande en su propio domicilio. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Senora Alejandrina, 59, is a widow with 4 children, all independent. She has her own home built of adobe in the Ocucaje district. She has worked in her own clothing business for 3 years. She is an enterprising person who, thanks to her own effort, has successfully gotten her children ahead and has acquired her own possessions. She needs this loan for working capital. Her dream is to have a large business in her own home. She is very grateful for the help we are able to give her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 41-year-old business lady who operates a printing business in Nairobi. She has been in this business for 10 years and was a housewife previously. She also trades in shares and supplies stationery to earn extra income. She has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy a printing machine. She says that since joining Faulu, she bought a printing machine which attracted more customers due to improved output. She hopes to own a bigger company with more employees and own a home. She describes herself as saved, hard-working and reliable.

loans.use: To buy a printing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and rice flour.

loans.name: Marissa's Group

texts.en:
Marissa B. is from the village of Sonquil, Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 35 years old and is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marissa B. Group.

Marissa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a butcher shop in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the market. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marissa is now requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar L. A.  is a very talented lady. She makes artificial jewelry sets and goes to the jewelry shops to sell them. She has given birth to four daughters. Her elder daughter helps her in her business and the others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 
Anwar's husband, L. A., is involved in a dairy business. Presently, he has one buffalo and from her he gets milk which he sells to the milk shops. Anwar is requesting a loan to purchase another buffalo for the expansion of her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Edis

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para la compra de cemento, bloques y laminas de zinc, ya que tendrá todos los materiales y asi su familia vivirá dignamente en su casita.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para la compra de cemento, bloques y laminas de zinc, ya que tendrá todos los materiales y asi su familia vivirá dignamente en su casita.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de materialez, talez como bloques, cemento, arena

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn V., 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She grows vegetables and produces clay pots for sale for an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is employed at a non-government organization of demining (landmine clearance), earning an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy vegetable seeds and a water pump to expand her agricultural products. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. V. is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: buy vegetable seeds and a water pump

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en: Liberato C. is from the village of Bantug. He is 51 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Liberato owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month. In 2008, Liberato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Liberato is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his fifth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing seeds for farming

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph D. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Joseph is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joseph joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joseph from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacanga, un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Chepén en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace doce años a labores asociadas al reciclaje de plástico, el compra botellas de plástico a los recicladores de la zona para luego trasladarlo hacia un local de la ciudad de Pacasmayo en donde muele los envases de este material para venderlos en polvo a la ciudad de Lima, donde vuelven a ser utilizados. Vicente se vale de esta actividad para percibir ingresos económicos que le permitan mantener la economía de su familia.

Vicente desea realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda de modo que la calidad de vida de su familia mejore, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. El es una persona bastante trabajadora y responsable, sus vecinos y conocidos le estiman mucho por su modo honrado de trabajo y por que siempre se esfuerza para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente, 41, is a father living with his wife and children in Pacanga district, Chepén province, La Libertad region, located about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last twelve years he has been a plastics recycler. He buys plastic bottles from local recyclers and then takes them to the city of Pacasmayo where they are ground up into powder that he then sells in the city of Lima to be reused. This activity generates income with which Vicente is able to support his family. Vicente would like to make some home improvements so that his family’s quality of life will improve. To reach this goal, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa asking for a 2000 new sol loan. He is quite a hard working person and his neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem thanks to his honest way of working and because he always strives to provide his family with the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Lp/13962 Group

texts.en:
Thompson S., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. Thompson is 56, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 10 and 30 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulty. He cares for one sibling.

For eight years, Thompson has been selling rice, cooking oil, soap, milk, candles, mosquito spray and sugar in the Gbengba Town Community, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more of those products to sell.

Describing himself as a devoted family man, his dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, soap, milk, candles, mosquito spray and sugar

loans.name: Ma.ruth

texts.en:
Ma.ruth A. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Ma.ruth is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Ma.ruth owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice and corn in the local community. Ma.ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma.ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma.ruth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma.ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya is single. She runs a small business selling jeans at Ilona Market in Mukachevo town. She has been in this business for five years. In the beginning she had to work as a sales person. Later she began to like and enjoy selling jeans. Nelya's business is quite successful because as fashion changes, women buy new jeans.

Nelya is very enthusiastic and positive about her life and her business. She wants to develop it further and increase turnover. Nelya needs a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of winter jeans. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of jeans for sale.

loans.name: Bettielyne

texts.en:
Bettielyne R. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Bettielyne is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Bettielyne owns & operates a bakeshop, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Bettielyne is just starting this business.

In 2008, Bettielyne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bettielyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Bettielyne is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Bettielyne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying chicken feed

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is widowed. She owns a retail business selling various agricultural products like seeds, fertilizers, bug killers, etc. Tatyana has a large assortment of products, affordable prices and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Tatyana has been in this business for 17 years. The business is seasonal, with items selling mostly in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Tatyana's goods are in demand. She hopes to develop her business further and have more clients who would use her services. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories - seeds and fertilizers – that her clients will start buying soon. Tatyana hopes to receive additional income and improve her business conditions by fixing the store where she works.

Note: the picture shows Tatyana with her worker.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie C. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Merlie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merlie owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Merlie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly, de 20 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que vive con su mamá Nely, de 52 y su papá Ángel, de 56 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Está emprendedora joven, hace tan solo 2 años que comenzó con la elaboración de diferentes prendas de vestir a base de lana como: chompas, gorras, mantas, sacos y tapices. Pero para poder obtener mejores ganancias, ella invirtió en el alquiler e implementación de un espacio en la galería del artesano, que queda en la plaza del pueblo, donde cada día festivo, los turistas de todo el país visitan el lugar. Pero el mayor sueño de Nataly, es acabar de estudiar la carrera de Farmacia, donde todas las mañanas estudia con ahínco y empeño. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como integrante joven de su banco comunal, asegura que no defraudará la confianza depositada en ella, asegurando el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de tapices y cerámicas para surtir su negocio, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará lana de diferentes colores para tejer sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Nataly is 20 years old.  She is a single and hard-working woman who lives with her mom Nely, 52, and her dad Ángel, 56.  They live in their own home which is in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  Only two years ago, this enterprising young woman began making garments from wool such as: sweaters, caps, ponchos, jackets and tapestries.  In order to make more profits, she invested in renting and setting up a space in the artisan gallery, which is located in her town square, where tourists from all over the country come to visit every market day.  However, Nataly's biggest dream is to finish her pharmacy degree course.  She studies hard and with determination on this every morning.

This is Nataly's second loan with MFP and, as a young member of her community bank, she assures us that she will not let down those who have placed their trust in her and will make her repayments punctually.  She will use her loan to invest in buying tapestries and ceramics to stock her business and, if the money reaches far enough, she will also buy wool in different colors to make her handicrafts with.

loans.use: To buy tapestries and ceramics to stock her business as well as buying wool

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Julia; ella tiene 47 años. La socia es conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos  la socia se dedica a vender auto partes de vehículos, la socia tiene su pequeña tienda y vende auto partes, ella viaja a la ciudad de Lima y  Puno a comprar repuestos, accesorios, cobertores de autos, luces entre otros. La socia desea a futuro alquilar una tienda más grande para albergar su negocio y también hacer un espacio para su segunda actividad;  La socia también trabaja de forma ambulatoria en casa vendiendo ropa, ella tiene ropa para vender de mujeres y niños, la socia trae también de la ciudad de Lima, La socia desea el préstamo para poder viajar y traer ropa de invierno desde la ciudad de Lima, porque allá están entrando a la estación de verano. La socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer ropa de Lima, junto a alguna mercadería para su tienda de repuestos de autos. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the 'Qorichuspa' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Julia is 47 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She works selling vehicle spare parts.  She has a small store where she sells spare parts.  She travels to the cities of Lima and Puno to buy spare parts, accessories, car covers, lights, etc.

In the future, Julia would like to rent a larger store for her business and would also like to make space for her second business activity.  As well as selling spare parts, Julia works as an itinerant street vendor, working door to door, selling clothes.  She sells women's and children's clothes.  She also buys her clothes in the city of Lima.

Julia would like this loan so that she can travel to Lima and bring back winter clothes because they are entering the summer season there.  Julia is requesting her loan to travel to Lima to buy clothes and also some merchandise for her auto spare parts store.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To travel to Lima to buy clothes as well as some merchandise for her auto spare parts store

loans.name: Alfredy

texts.en:
Alfredy has been practicing mixed farming for the last eighteen years.  He employs 6 farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces tea, milk, maize and beans.  These are sold both locally and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also owns a posho mill in the same area. 

Alfredy is 34 years old.  He is married and has 7 children between the ages of 2 and 16.  Six of the children attend school.

Alfredy has requested this loan for 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this investment, his milk production will increase and he will earn more income. 

In this business, he faces the challenges of diseases, bad debtors and lack of proper market for his products. In five years' time, he plans to acquire more land and expand his farming from small-scale to large-scale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sugeyda Agustina

texts.es: Sugeyda Agustina tiene 28 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella se levanta temprano ya que todos los días tiene que buscar los alimentos necesarios para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos como gallo pinto, queso frito, tajadas, empanadas de maduro y pollo frito. Actualmente todos los días saca una mesa en la que ofrece cada uno de sus platillos, por lo que sus clientes disfrutan mucho de su comida, ya que poco a poco fue estableciendo su propia fama. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, pollos, azúcar y ciertos utensilios de cocina. Su deseo es establecer un restaurante.
texts.en:
Sugeyda Agustina is 28 years old.  For more than 6 years she has been in the business of selling food.  She gets up early because every day she has to look for the foods necessary to make her delicious dishes like gallo pinto (rice and beans), fried cheese, fried plantain chips, plantain empanadas, and fried chicken.  Currently, she takes out a table every day on which she offers each of her platters.  Because of this, her customers really enjoy her food, and little by little she is making a name for herself.  

The loan is for business capital, including the purchase of basic grains, oil, chickens, sugar and cooking utensils.  She hopes to establish a restaurant.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Altangadas

texts.en: Altangadas, 35, is married and lives with his wife and 10-year-old daughter in Mongolia's Uvurhangai province. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.
