His daughter attends a local primary school, while he works at a taxi service he started in 2005. For the last two years, his wife has made a living selling cosmetics at a stall she rents in the local market. In addition to driving his taxi, Altangadas also helps his wife at her stall. As an experienced salesperson, his wife operates her cosmetic trading business successfully. They are planning to expand this business and build a winter house where they can live a more comfortable life. He is applying for a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to buy more cosmetics to sell in their stall.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell in a local market.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca lives in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops, and then sells it to the market. Francisca said she and her husband work hard to earn more so that they could support their children's education. Francisca also does her best to keep her family happy.

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene tiene una imprenta, en la cual trabaja con su esposa; el crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos, como ser papel bond, placas negativas y tinta para las máquinas offset que posee en el negocio. Vive  en casa en Alquiler ubicada en la zona de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, es casado y  no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en: Rene has a print shop where he and his wife work.  He needs the money from this loan to buy supplies, such as bond paper, printing plates, and ink for his offset machines that he has for his business.  He lives in a rented home located in Villa Exaltación in the city of El Alto.  He is married with no children.  He is very happy about the loans he has gotten.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business.

loans.name: Restauration De Mon Repos Group

texts.fr:
Francisque est le coordinateur de son groupe Restauration.

Francisque habite dans la région de Mon Repos d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Francisque a dirigé son commerce de Charbon pendant les 7 dernières années.

Francisque voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de Bois pour faire le charbon

Des autres membres de Restauration ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et du charbon.

Francisque dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause de chômage.

Francisque dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il achète un moto pour le taxi et aussi un camion pour faciliter le commerce.
texts.en:
Francisque is the coordinator of his group, Restoration.
Francisque lives in the Mon Repos region in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.
Francisque has been in the business of selling coal for the last 7 years. 
Francisque would like to use this loan to invest in more wood to make coal.
Other members of Restoration need a loan for businesses including selling food products and coal.
Francisque says that his main challenge is the lack of regular customers because of unemployment.
Francisque says that his dream is to expand his business to be able to buy a motorcycle taxi and also a truck to facilitate sales.

loans.use: to buy wood to make coal

loans.name: Rosa De Castilla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama rosa D. castilla, los integrantes del grupo decidieron  ponerle este nombre ya que en su comunidad la mayoría D. las personas siembran esta flor, la historia es acerca D. la señora mariana García D. Jesús, ya que es la representante del grupo, ella es viuda, cuenta con 45 años D. edad, tiene dos hijos, Agripina y Emiliano, D. los cuales solo el menor estudia, está cursando el sexto año D. primaria, ya que la mayor está casada, ella tiene una tienda D. ropa, con la cual lleva más D. 10 años.

Doña mariana se decidió por ese negocio, ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, y le genera muy buenas ganancias, además D. que quería buscar la manera D. sacar a sus hijos adelante, para darles una muy buena calidad D. vida, invirtió su crédito en la compra D. mas ropa como son: blusa, playeras, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, shorts, camisas y ropa interior, para así tener un mejor surtido.

El sueño que tiene doña mariana y espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el D. ampliar  un poco mas su local y para así tenerlo muy bien surtido, ya que es su anhelo mas granD., también para poder mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a sus hijo con sus estudios y asegurar su futuro.

Nos dice que los integrantes D. su grupo, son personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y puntuales, ya que tienen tiempo D. conocerse y se llevan muy bien, puesto que viven en la misma comunidad.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron, ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.

Otros D. los compañeros D. doña mariana son: teresa, Maribel, mariana, Claudia, Marisol, Eugenia, Guillermina, Irma, Paula y viene, quienes realizan variadas actividades como: venta D. frutas, comida, ropa, dulces, tamales y algunos abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Rosa D. Castilla” (Rose of Castille).  The members of the group decided to name it that because most of the people in the community grow this flower.

This story is about Mrs. Mariana García D. Jesús since she’s the group representative.  She’s a widow, is 45 years old and has two children: Agripina and Emiliano.  Only the youngest is in school; he’s in 6th graD..  The oldest is married.  Mariana has had a clothing store for over ten years.

Mariana decided on this business because she says it has a lot of demand and it generates good profits.  Besides, she needed to find a way to move her children forward, to proviD. a good quality of life for them.  She invested her loan in the purchase of more clothing like: blouses, t-shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, shirts and underwear to have a better selection.

Mariana’s dream, which she hopes to fulfill one day, is to enlarge the locale a bit more in order to have it better stocked because that’s her greatest wish.  Also in order to be able to improve and increase income to continue supporting her son’s education and assure his future.

She tells us that the group members are very responsible, hard working, punctual people since they’ve known each other for a long time and they get along well together since they live in the same community.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support the loan that was granted is because thanks to it her business is improving much.

Mariana’s companions in the group are:  Teresa, Maribel, Mariana, Claudia, Marisol, Eugenia, Guillermina, Irma, Paula and Viene who carry out various activities like: sale of fruit, food, clothes, candy, tamales and some groceries.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Rosarah

texts.en:
Rosarah is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosarah is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her vegetable farming.

Rosarah has been farming vegetables for nine years and also earns additional income from being an Avon dealer, selling Ready-To-Wear and livestock raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for her vegetable farming.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. (pictured) is a married woman, living with her family in a village along National Road number 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school.

To earn a living, she used to sell grocery items at her home. Now, she is a garment factory worker. Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction contractor.

Sophal is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike so that her husband can drive to work

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda es una señora D. 50 años D.  edad, es viuda y mantiene a un solo hijo pues los demás ya son independientes. Ella vive en una comunidad rural ubicada a 8km del distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Su casa es D. material rústico (adobe) y no cuenta con los servicios básicos D. luz, agua y desagüe.

Teolinda tiene un terreno agrícola en el que cultiva mango y limón semanalmente y esto le genera algunos ingresos. Sin embargo su actividad principal es la crianza D. aves D. corral (pavos y  gallinas) que luego comercializa a los pobladores D. su comunidad.

Teolinda solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus aves y para mejorar el corral donD. las cría. 

Teolinda tiene muchos deseos D. superarse para tener una mejor calidad D. vida y por lo pronto contar con los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Teolinda is a 50 year-old widow who supports just one of her children as the others already live independently.  Teolinda lives in a rural community which is located 8km from TambogranD. district - Piura.  Her home is maD. from coarse building materials (adobe) and doesn't have the basic services of piped water, electricity and sewerage.

Teolinda owns a plot of farmland where she grows mangos and lemons every week.  This makes her some income.  However, her main business activity is raising poultry (turkeys and hens) which she then sells to the residents of her community.

Teolinda is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy balanced feed for her birds and improve the pen where she raises them.

Teolinda has a great desire to improve herself so that she can enjoy a better quality of life and have access to basic services.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her poultry

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa en la parte rural del distrito de Catacaos – Piura. Este distrito es conocido por su deliciosa gastronomía y por ser zona de orfebres.

José se dedica desde hace 5 años a brindar el servicio de mototaxi, este es un servicio de transporte público donde la moto cuenta con una cabina en la parte posterior para los pasajeros. La moto con la que José labora es propia y él cubre las rutas dentro de la ciudad de Piura, donde cuenta con clientela establecida.

La esposa de José lo ayuda con los gastos del hogar con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de productos comestibles. Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su propio domicilio desde donde vende productos de primera necesidad.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en algunas reparaciones de  su moto pero principalmente en  comprar productos comestibles para surtir el negocio de su esposa. 

Esta pareja tiene muchos deseos de superación y existe una buena relación entre ellos.
texts.en:
José tiene 24 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa en la parte rural del distrito de Catacaos – Piura. Este distrito es conocido por su deliciosa gastronomía y por ser zona de orfebres.

José se dedica desde hace 5 años a brindar el servicio de mototaxi, este es un servicio de transporte público donde la moto cuenta con una cabina en la parte posterior para los pasajeros. La moto con la que José labora es propia y él cubre las rutas dentro de la ciudad de Piura, donde cuenta con clientela establecida.

La esposa de José lo ayuda con los gastos del hogar con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de productos comestibles. Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su propio domicilio desde donde vende productos de primera necesidad.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en algunas reparaciones de  su moto pero principalmente en  comprar productos comestibles para surtir el negocio de su esposa. 

Esta pareja tiene muchos deseos de superación y existe una buena relación entre ellos.

loans.use: Reparar moto y surtir negocio de esposa.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She owns and manages a sari-sari store. Virgie sells items like toothpaste, shampoo and biscuits to the people in her community. She earns about 3000 PHP per month from the store.

Virgie plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, detergent soap and canned goods. Virgie hopes  this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, detergent soap and canned goods

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 28-year-old, single lady. Sally owns a cosmetics shop in Kisauni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last 3 years. 


Sally has been a KADET LTD client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of beauty products into her business. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan. Sally’s dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to add more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Valentine Ablawa

texts.fr:
Valentine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend des condiments, des céréales sur mesure, de la boisson traditionnelle communément appelée SODABI, des sacs de charbon et des produits alimentaires. Tous ses articles sont exposés à son domicile. Parallèlement, la cliente exerce l'activité de restauration, ce qui lui permet d'accroître le niveau de son chiffre d'affaire. 

L'approvisionnement est fait au marché international du Bénin et au marché de Cococodji, un marché situé à l'Ouest de Cotonou, la capitale économique. En vue de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Valentine a décidé d'augmenter son fonds de roulement,raison pour laquelle, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV. 

Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit pourrait l'aider à augmenter sa participation aux charges du foyer et améliorer ainsi la vie quotidienne de sa famille. Elle est a son 1er crédit à FINADEV. Elle souhaiterait faire la vente en gros et aussi avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Valentine is married and has three children. She sells condiments, mixed cereals, traditional beverages commonly known as "Sodabi", bags of charcoal, and food products. All of these items are displayed at her house. At the same time, she also runs a food preparation business, which allows her to raise the level of her sales.

She gets her supplies at the international market in Benin and at the Cococodji market, which is situated west of Cotonou, the economic capital. In order to better satisfy her customers, Valentine decided to increase her working capital, which is why she sought and obtained a micro-loan through FINADEV.

The additional income generated by this micro-loan would help her play a bigger role in providing for her household and thus improve her family's day-to-day life. She is on her first loan with FINADEV. She would like to sell in bulk and also have her own house.

loans.use: To obtain supplies in bulk: 10 bags of cereals and 2 cases of "Sodabi" (a local beverage).

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, 42, is a married woman with a 12-year-old child. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice to sell. Emelia also opened a sari sari store to help in her family's daily needs.

Emelia has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of seeds and two sacks of fertilizer. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of seeds and two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Shadai Nuevo Group

texts.en: The Shadai Nuevo solidarity group is made up of Celina, Jose, and Gregoria, all of whom live in San Lorenzo, Honduras. The group leader, Celina, makes a living by selling shrimp. She purchases bulk quantities of shrimp in her hometown and travels twice each week to Tegucigalpa to sell her wares. Celina is requesting a loan of HNL 5,000 to purchase a bulk quantity of shrimp. She would like to continue working with Prisma in the future in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk supply of shrimp.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
Richard, who is in his early 20s, is single. He takes care of his younger sister and younger brother who go to school.  He has been running a clothing shop since 2006.  He works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to buy more clothes for his shop. His dream is to one day be able to go for further studies. He is a primary seven leaver, so he wants to go for secondary education.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Paradise" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Glenda Maria

texts.es:
Glenda, vive con su madre y dos hijos, es comerciante D. especias, platos, velas, carteras y golosinas, ha este negocio sus padres le dieron inicio hace mucho tiempo, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal.
Actualmente está nuevamente solicitando préstamo, para compra más especias, platos y boquitas, es su segunda inversión al negocio que le permite variar el negocio y ofrecer mayor cantidad a los clientes.
El objetivo D. ella es tener surtido el negocio, realizar buenas inversiones que le ayuden a crecer más competente, y proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Glenda lives with her mother and two children.  She sells spices, plates, candles, billfolds and sweets.  Her parents started the business, which is located in the municipal market, a long time ago.

She is requesting a new loan to buy more spices, plates and snacks. This will be her second investment in the business aimed at offering wider variety and more goods to customers.

Her goal is to continue investing to build her inventory so her business will grow and become more competitive.  This will allow her to proviD. her children with everything they need to grow.

loans.use: To buy more spices, plates and snacks for her business.

loans.name: Violett

texts.en: Violett is a 40-year-old young woman who is married with two sons. She is employed as a secretary and her husband is a construction worker with a low salary. Violett wants to pay the university tuition fees for her son but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Violett gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will easily pay her son's university tuition fees so he can complete his university studies and improve the family life positively. Violett is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: 2182 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Callitex is 48 years old and is married, with two children between the ages of 4 and 18 years. He owns a business for selling clothes.

Callitex is the leader of this group, which is called "Abizeranye" in the local language. He is the first person on the right side. Callitex has been in this business for about two years and his business is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day.

Callitex and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their stock of clothes. Callixte and his team will reinvest their profits in their businesses and save for their families' future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 42-year-old illiterate, married lady. Her husband is a contractor and builds houses and buildings on contract. She is an embroidery expert and does decorative embroidery for her neighborhood clients on order. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.  She is the mother of two sons. The eldest one has the skills of an electrician but he doesn’t do it as a profession. He is interested in the driving profession. Her youngest one is a driver.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who will buy a rickshaw to fulfill his interest and start a driving business. Through the rickshaw, he will be able to provide transport services to the passengers and become the earning resource for the family. Gulzar is very confident about her son’s hard-working nature and she is very sure that an investment will help him make good profits from his business. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw to start a driving business

loans.name: Nancy Alilian

texts.es:
Nancy Alilian tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de veintiuno años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Nancy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir y ser dueño de una finca.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boly, compartir con la familia.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Nancy Alilian is 49 years old.  She is married and has one son.  She lives with her husband and her son, who is twenty-five years old, in Ventanas Canton, De Los Ríos Province.

The VRC NUEVA UNIÓN is located in Guamayacu Precinct, which belongs to Echeandía Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work, like growing corn, rice and pigeon peas. 
Nancy makes her living in agriculture, planting corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She makes her purchases and sales in Echeandia. 

With the money from the previous loan, Nancy was able to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison, to maintain a healthy crop.
The family dynamic has improved because now she can contribute a little more to the family's well-being.  Work has been going much better because she has increased production, and her income has improved a lot because now she earns more from her sales.  The previous loan helped her to better herself, and she had no trouble making her payments to the communal bank on time.

This new loan will help her to purchase seeds, cacao plants and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison so she can maintain a healthy crop.

The challenges that Nancy Alilian frequently faces are: competition and plagues.  Her dream is to continue working and to acquire and become the owner of a farm.

In her free time, Nancy Alilian likes to play sports, in particular volley ball, and to spend time with her family.
"She is very grateful for the assistance she has been offered."

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison, so she can maintain a healthy crop.

loans.name: Sop  Serigne  Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Bara est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et vivent en parfaite harmonie.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Maguette est âgée de 49 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants, et a quatre orphelins de père et de mère en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de fruits de saison. Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de douze ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou orange-vert avec un châle vert et a levé la main droite.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché et revend sur place où elle a une table.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des fruits, en grande quantité afin de se faire plus de revenus à la vente.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et assurer l'habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Bara was created on August 28, 2009. It consists of fifteen women from the same neighborhood who live in perfect harmony. Their main activity is small trade.

The leader of the group is Mrs. Maguette, seen standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, and wearing a green and orange dress with a green scarf. She is 49 years old and married with five children. She also takes care of four orphans. 

Mrs. Maguette sells seasonal fruit and has over twelve years of experience in this activity. She buys her stock at the market for resale on site where she has a booth.

She will use her loan to stock up on large quantities of fruit in order to increase her sales and revenue.

The profits will be used to help her husband to support the family and provide for the children’s clothing needs.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit for resale

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra vive en el barrio Juancho en vivienda familiar vive junto a su hijo pequeño y su esposo el cual trabaja en una empresa petrolera y se encuentra constantemente D. viaje, la cliente se dedica a la venta D. empanadas D. gigote, asaditos, pancitas, dicha actividad la realiza en una avenida muy concurrida, el crédito esta destinado para la comprar D. material D. construcción para la  refacción D. su vivienda, ya que la vivienda requiere D. colocado D. piso, gracias al esfuerzo D. la cliente y el apoyo D. su esposo ambos pudieron adquirir su lote D. terreno, el cual se encuentra en proceso D. saneamiento, el deseo D. la Sra. Sandra es el ver terminada su casita.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in the Juancho neighborhood in a family house with her young son and her husband, who works at a petroleum company and is always traveling. She sells meat stew empanadas, grilled meats, and breads. She sells on an avenue that has a lot of traffic. 

The loan will be used to buy construction materials for her house, because the house needs to have the floor installed. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her husband, they were able to buy their own piece of land, which is currently in the process of being hooked up to water services. Sandra’s wish is to see her house finished.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Mairamhon's Group

texts.en:
Mairamhon is the treasurer of this three-person loan group. She is 44 and married to a driver, who works in Russia. She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons work in Russia and her daughter studies at school while she works as a midwife in a local hospital. She has saved some money from her salary to buy a washing machine, but needs this loan to complete the purchase. This machine will mean a big improvement in her living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about our organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Don Tomas, de 66 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, es originario de Miraflor municipio de Estelí conocido por sus áreas protegidas y una imponente flora y fauna, clima fresco  donde la mayoría de los finqueros se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos, hortalizas y crianza de ganado que al final llegan aportar de manera positiva a la diversidad de la zona. Donde la mayoría de su población se levanta con el alba y el canto del gallo, las aves. En medio de estas actividades es que se desarrolla  don Tomas quien nos cuenta que se dedico al cultivo de papas a la edad de 41 años ,el no fue ala escuela pero fue alfabetizado , tiene 7 hijos. El empezó sembrando una manzana de papas con la ayuda de una cooperativa llamada PROPA . Ahora cuenta con 24 manzanas de tierra las cuales obtuvo mediante la reforma agraria y las ocupa para siembra de papas cuando no esta sembrando, se dedica al cultivo de repollo, café  y crianza de ganado. El vende su producto en Managua y cooperativas comercializadora de papas. 
El realizo el préstamo para compra de semilla, insumos y pago de mano de obra para siembra de 2.5 manzanas de papas. Pues tiene terreno sin utilizar debido a que para sembrar se necesita mas financiamiento y es lo que hace falta, el desea que sea una cosecha de buena calidad y rentabilidad. Entre sus expectativa es sembrar repollo una ves finalizada la cosecha de papas.
texts.en:
Tomas, 66, is a farmer from the town of Miraflor in Estelí Municipality known for its protected areas and an important flora and fauna, cool weather where most farmers grow basic grains, vegetables and raise livestock which in the end contributes to the area's diversity.  Most of the population rises at dawn with the crowing of the roosters and the birds.  In the midst of this activity Tomas carries out his activity which for the last 41 years has been potato farming.  He never went to school but he is literate.  He has seven children.  He started growing potatoes on just one manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] with help from a cooperative called PROPA.  Now, he owns 24 manzanas of farmland that he acquired thanks to agrarian reform and he uses them to grow potatoes.  When he’s not planting he grows cabbage, coffee and raises livestock.  He sells his products in Managua and to potato cooperatives.

He took out the loan to buy seeds, supplies and to pay labor costs to plant 2.5 manzanas of potatoes because he has fallow land that he needs more financing to be able to plant in.  He hopes harvests will be good quality and profitable.  Among his expectations is planting cabbage once he finishes harvesting potatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a food café business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Ezekiel dreams of expanding his business to meet the client demand.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase a stock of food, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and rice. He decided to join Yehu because of the flexible products offered.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of food, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María  cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años para apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar. Rosa vende ropa, juguetes para niño y más a un precio cómodo para el público de acuerdo a su economía. La señora desea invertir en su negocio para que sus ventas sean incrementadas ya que es temporada navideña es cuando es más solicitada
texts.en: Rosa María has had a business selling used clothes for 5 years to help her husband with the family expenses. Rosa sells clothes, toys and more at a price that is comfortable for the public in this economy. She wants to invest in her business so that her sales will increase since it is the Christmas season when demand is the highest.

loans.use: to buy clothes for cold weather.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La socia Teodora continua con la agricultura y ganadería, la socia continua con su sastrería, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la refacción de su vivienda ahora que se viene las lluvias desea comprar materiales para revestir la fachada de su vivienda y el techo.
texts.en: Teodora continues farming and raising livestock.  She also continues with her dressmaking business.  On this occasion, she would like to invest her loan in refurbishing her home.  Now that the rains are coming, she wants to buy materials with which to cover the front of her house and her roof.

loans.use: to refurbish her house

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de León, La señora Cruz, se Desempeña como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 18 años, es Soltera con 2 hijo a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Cruz  atraviesa, es la necesidad de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda ya que quiere seguirla mejorando, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Perlin Cemento y Mano de Obra para realizar las mejora en la casa,  y crearles mejores condiciones y nivel de vida a su familia
texts.en:
In the municipality of Quezalguaque, department of León, Ms. Cruz labors as an elementary school teacher in a small school of the municipality. She has devoted herself to this labor for 18 years. She is single with two children to whom she must provide the conditions necessary to their development. 

One of the needs Ms. Cruz is facing is the need to improve her housing conditions since she wants to continue making improvements. Thus she has decided to turn to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as purlins [roof beams], cement and labor costs, in order to make the improvements to her home, and create better conditions and a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to purchase roof beams, cement and labor costs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 23-year-old farmer from a remote village in Ainamoi in the Kericho area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 5 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Daisy passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. 

Daisy is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. 

In addition to profits, Daisy will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer. 

Thanks to your support, Daisy will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 57 years old. She is a widowed mother, blessed with 2 children of 25 years of 23 years.

 She has had a retail business for 7 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. She has borrowed KES. 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her fourth loan, after paying the previous loan successful. 

And she will be using the loan to purchase retail goods. Therefore she hopes that the anticipated profit, will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her kids, cater for medical care expand livestock and crop farming as her secondary business and repay her loan too. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established farming business enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods

loans.name: Togbossi

texts.en:
Ms. Togbossi A. has been a widow for five years. Her husband’s farming business did not enable him to leave any money for his family when he died. Today, Ms. Togbossi A. struggles daily with all her energy to be able to meet the needs of her children. Her principal activity is rope weaving. A clever woman, she works hard to shelter her children from hunger and poverty. But today she is being crushed by her expenses and is calling out for help. She has already obtained a first loan, which she paid off faithfully and without incident. She is now requesting a second loan of $600 to equip herself with materials in order to increase her production of rope. The profits she will earn from this business will be used to improve her family’s living conditions. Financing this project will mean giving back hope to children who have lost their father.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Togbossi est une femme veuve depuis 5 ans. L’activité agricole de son mari ne lui a pas permis de laisser un héritage à la famille avant sa mort. Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Togbossi se bat quotidiennement avec toute son énergie pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Son activité principale est le tissage des cordes. Femme ingénieuse, elle travaille durement pour mettre ses enfants à l’abri de la faim et la misère. Mais aujourd’hui, elle est écrasée par les charges et crie au secours. Elle a déjà obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a pu solder fidèlement sans incident. Elle demande donc un second crédit d’un montant de $600 pour se doter de matériel afin d’accroître sa production en tissage de corde. Les bénéfices qui seront issus de cette activité seront destinés à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Financer ce projet, c’est redonner l’espoir de vivre à des orphelins.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for rope weaving

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Richard is married with 5 children; his children are 27, 25, 14, 8, and 5 years of age. When he was 15 years old, Ricardo began been selling ice cream and tostadas outside of his house. Later he sold toys and was successful in that business. His natural affinity for sales, his desire to overcome obstacles, and the need to move his family ahead have allowed Ricardo to set himself up in the sales of various items. He now works selling paper products and accessories wholesale, to businesses.

The hard sales work Ricardo does in order to improve his family's quality of life requires a considerable investment. For that reason he is applying for a loan of 925 dollars for the purchase of merchandise. He commits to repaying the loan in a period of 5 to 10 months. You can help Ricardo. Your collaboration will be of great service to this family, and they appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo es casado y tiene cinco hijos de 27, 25, 14, 8 y 5 años de edad, desde hace quince años empezó vendiendo afuera de su casa tostadas y helados, y después vendió juguetes y obtuvo buenos resultados. El gusto por las ventas, los deseos de superación y la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, le ha permitido a Ricardo incursionar en la venta de varios artículos, pero ahora se dedica a la venta de papelería y mercería en mayoreo para empresas.

El arduo trabajo de ventas que realiza Ricardo, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, requiere de mayor inversión por lo que solicita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares para la compra de mercancía, que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Ricardo, tu colaboración será de gran utilidad para esta familia, y agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en:
Romelia is 28 years old and has five children. Her husband works as a mason’s assistant. She has sells foodstuffs to her neighbors. With the loan, she would like to build a small grocery store. She belongs to the “María del Carmen Group 2”, along with Hanne Isabel Pérez Gutierrez, who sells cosmetic products from her home. With her portion of the loan, Hanne wants to buy more cosmetics, perfumes, and creams that she can sell from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ROMELIA TIENE CINCO HIJOS Y 28 AÑOS DE EDAD SU ESPOSO SE DESEMPEÑA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL, ELLA ACTUALMENTE TIENE EN SU CASA ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS PARA VENDER ENTRE SUS VECINOS CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INSTALARSE CON UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 2 JUNTO A DOÑA HANNE ISABEL PEREZ GUTIERREZ QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COSMETICOS EN SU CASA.HANNE QUIERE CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS COSMETICOS, PERFUMES Y CREMAS PARA COLOCAR UNA TIENDITA EN SU CASA.

loans.use: To add a small grocery store on to a house; To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Ngwa Odilia

texts.en:
Forty-one year old Odilia is a single mother of three and a hairdresser by profession. After she joined GHAPE she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.  She subsequently  received a loan of $40 which she invested in her hairdressing business. 

However, the business did not generate enough money to meet all of the basic needs of her children. She decided to ask for this loan of $300 to sell food items, firewood and basic commodities.  She plans to earn money so she can rent a workshop for her daughter who has just finished her apprentice course.

She plans to repay her loan in 15 months.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as corn, rice, cocoyam, garri, fowl etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan is a young man who decided to make the land he was born in grow. After several years of working outside his native land, he nostalgically returned to it and dedicated himself to planting corn, potato, and alfalfa. He accomplishes this through the cultivation of his own land and others that he has rented. He sells his harvest in a local market, and with a great deal of effort has managed to increase his production little by little. Thanks to his investment, he has seen his earnings increase month by month, and these bring him his daily wages and the full satisfaction of his needs. With his constant hard work, he has decided to continue expanding his labor in order to diversify his crops and bring employment to more farmers in his community. Bringing about his goal requires a loan of $375, which will permit him to purchase better seeds and optimize his yearly planting. He requests your generous support in his goal of quickly making his plans a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juan es un joven que se decidió a progresar en la tierra que lo vió nacer y tras varios años de laborar fuera de su tierra natal, regreso a ella con nostalgia y se dedicó a la siembra de maíz, papa y alfalfa.Esta actividad la realiza a través del cultivo de sus propias tierras y otras que ha arrendado; la cosecha que obtiene la lleva para comercializarla en el mercado local, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar poco a poco su producción y también gracias a la inversión que hizo ha visto aumentar sus ganancias mes a mes, estas a su vez le permiten el sustento diario y la satisfacción plena de sus necesidades.Con su constante forma de trabajo ha tomado la decisión de seguir ampliando su campo de acción con el propósito de masificar sus productos de cultivo y otorgarle empleo a más campesinos de su comunidad.Para llevar a cabo este anhelo requiere un préstamo por 375 dólares, esta cantidad le permitirá adquirir mejor calidad de semillas para optimizar su siembra anual. Solicita tu generoso apoyo con el objetivo de concretar sus planes en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds.

loans.name: Ilza

texts.es:
Ilza is 41 years, and only studied up to the 4th year of high school. She has three children and currently two of them depend on her. She lives in the District of Florence de Mora, Province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad, Peru and belongs to the Communal Bank "God guides Our Steps II. " She had previously been engaged to sell beauty products and compile portfolios, but then with limited time because she had to meet her family's duties, she decided to devote herself solely to the sale of beauty products. Ilza has been engaged in this business for over 3 years, and has been gradually increasing the number of her customers. Because of this reason, she accepted to join her mother-in-law's invitation to join her Communal Bank "God Guide Our Steps". With her first loan, S/.300.00 ($ 100), she increased her inventory of cosmetics to meet her customers' needs. She did the same with the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of S/.500.00 ($ 167), which she repaid in 4 months. Ilza wants to continue to increase her sales to fulfill her great dream "Being director of beauty industry products" - this is her passion. She feels great to be able to teach women today how to take care of themselves and how to feel good about themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ilza tiene 41 años, solo estudió hasta 4º grado de secundaria, tiene tres hijos y actualmente 2 dependen de ella, vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú, pertenece al banco comunal “Dios guía nuestros Pasos II”. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a vender productos de belleza y a confeccionar carteras pero con el tiempo limitado que tenia para atender a su familia decidió dedicarse solo a la venta de productos de belleza. La señora se dedica a este negocio hace más de 3 años; poco a poco fue aumentando la cantidad de sus clientes y muchos le solicitaban que les vendiera a crédito por lo que tenía necesidad de mayor capital por eso aceptó la invitación de su suegra de integrarse al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” Con su primer préstamo, de S/.300.00 ($100) aumentó su stock de cosméticos para poder atender a todos sus clientes. Lo mismo hizo el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.500.00 ($167) que obtuvo para pagarlo en 4 meses. La señora Ilza quiere seguir incrementando sus ventas para que se cumpla su gran sueño “Ser directora de su sector en los productos de Belleza”, es su pasión, y se siente muy bien proponiendo, a la mujer actual, cómo debe arreglarse y cómo sentirse bien con ella misma.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics. (Compra de cosméticos.)

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun is an Internally Displaced Person from Jabrail region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan. She and her family was relocated to Baku as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She now lives in unfinished first aid building in Binagadi settlement in the suburbs of Baku with her husband and three children. She trades fruit and vegetables nearby. She has been in this business since 1999 when she applied to Normicro Baku branch and took out a total of five loans all of which she has paid back successfully. She buys goods from wholesalers that bring goods from other regions. Now she needs 1200$ to invest in her business and increase her working capital thus increasing the volume of sales.

loans.use: To invest is business and increase volume of sales

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 16, 12, 10, and 5). She owns a shop where she sells general items. She started this business in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales. She works from 7am to 6pm daily.

In the past, Lydia took a loan to buy more inventory for her shop. She now hopes to do the same thing. She is a member of a loan group called Twiga (Swahili for "giraffe").

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es:
Dolibe adds taste and color to her homemaD. sweets, which she makes at home with much effort and love. She then sells her baked goods in different parts of town. She is the mother of 3 children, 2 who now have their own families and the youngest daughter, Paola, with whom she lives. Her daughter supports her and helps out with the business as she herself prepares to go to university. Dolibe wants her daughter to be a successful professional and that's why she works hard at this job and in addition, provides a service to her community by having a small food store which she wants to expand. In order to implement and expand this store, she needs a loan. She awaits the generous help of your noble heart.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabor y color es lo que le da a sus productos D. dulces la señora Dolibe, quien con mucho esfuerzo y amor los prepara y hornea para luego llevarlos a vender a los diferentes lugares D. su zona. Ella es madre D. tres hijos D. las cuales dos D. ellos ya han cinstruido sus propias familias, quedando sola con la compañía D. la última D. sus hijas D. nombre Paola, quien también la apoya mucho en la preparación D. sus dulces y quien también se prepara para postular a la universidad. La señora Dolibe quiere que su hija Paola se convierta en una profesional D. éxito, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho en este trabajo y adicionalmente también presta servicios a su comunidad a través D. su pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes(bodega) el cual falta implementar, para lograr el objetivo D. su implementación requiere D. un capital D. inversión.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada D. tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To start her business and buy food products.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Located in Cotonour for over 15 years to do business, Mrs. Francoise K. is originally from Port Novo, where she was born March 8th, 1960. Married to Norbert SINGBO, a Beninese police officer, she is the mother of two children and also cares for two nieces and a cousin who help her with certain tasks. She is a retailer of products such as trays of eggs, tomatoes, onions, oil, etc. For the last few months her customers have faced supply shortages of some products such as bags of rice, corn, wheat flour, and others because their distance from Cotonou’s main market. She is therefore seeking a loan to stock these products in order to be closer to her customers and to gain new types of customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 15ans pour cause de son commerce, dame K. Françoise est originaire de la ville de PORTO NOVO où elle est née le 08 mars 1960. Mariée à SINGBO Norbert, agent de la Police béninoise, elle est mère de 2 enfants mais a aussi à sa charge 2 nièces et une cousine qui l’aident dans l’accomplissement de certaines tâches. Elle est revendeuse de produits divers tels que des plateaux d’œufs, de la tomate, l’oignon, l’huile et autres. Depuis quelques mois ces clients éprouvent quelques difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de certains produits tels que : les sacs de riz, de maïs, de farine de blé et autres à cause de la distance qui les sépare du grand marché de COTONOU. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour l’approvisionnent de ces divers produits afin d’être plus proche de sa clientèle et de gagner d’autres catégories de clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 140 trays of eggs, 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 5 baskets of onions

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio, who belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Enterprising Women") lending group, sells groceries and fresh vegetables. Her shop is located in the central market of her town in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.300 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and pasta for her shop.

Rocio, 26, is separated from her husband. She has a 5-year old daughter. With her business and her parent's help, she is making a better life for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rocio, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Emprendedoras, se a la venta de abarrotes y verduras ,su esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará: un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, 18 litros de aceite 10 filos de fideos balde de aceite y bolsa de fideos para su bodega.

Ella tienen 26 años de edad, es separada de su esposo tiene una hija de 5 años con su negocio y la ayuda de sus padres esta sacando adelante a su hija.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Faalogoifo

texts.en: Faalogoifo S., 42, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the retail shop business. Her retail shop maintains a week's stock of  common needs of the village like rice, tinned meat, tinned fish, sugar, flour, salt, lollies, etc. She sells to the local villagers and passers-by 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 220 Tala (about $US91).  SPBD loans are Faalogoifo’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her children's education fees.

loans.use: Purchase resupply of stock for the shop

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 32-year-old woman from the village of Banovici, near the town that is also called Banovici.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband works as a coal miner in the town, while Edina works in agriculture and raises chickens.  This is her second loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 1200KM.  She will use this money to buy chickens and fatten them.  Then she will be able to sell the chickens at a profit.  Her main goal is to expand her business and increase her income, and thus improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a soldier is not sufficient for Ama and her 1 child. Demand for her processed fish is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Ama is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocio is 38 years old and has 3 children who study and support her very much. She lives with her husband Claudio who supports her too in her business.
She works selling books on different places in her city, for the past 25 years, she sells them cash or on layaway, her husband is one in charge of taking the books to the clients, while she takes care of collecting the money. She works all day, including Sundays and holidays. What she likes the most is that she knows several places, people and generates good income.
Rocio works to cover her family expenses and to provide education to her children.
The loan she is asking is to rent a place to sell her books.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Rocio, de 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos quienes estudian y la apoyan mucho. Ella vive junto con su esposo Claudio quien la apoya mucho en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedades de libros, los vende por los diferentes lugares de su ciudad, esto ya hace 25 años; dejándolos al crédito o al contado, su esposo es el encargado de llevar los pedidos a los clientes, mientras que ella se dedica a la cobranza de los mismos. Trabaja todo el día, incluido domingos y feriados. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares, personas y le genera buenos ingresos. Rocío trabaja para solventar sus gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos. El monto que solicita en préstamo es para alquilar un local para vender sus libros cómodamente.

loans.use: To rent a space to sell her books / Alquiler de un local para la venta de sus libros.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi F. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est propriétaire d’un dépôt de planches à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il aimerait, avec ce crédit, faire d’avantage de stocks en bois afin de répondre aux besoins de la population qui ne cesse d’augmenter. Avec cette chance de Kiva, Koffi espère augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et par là ses profits afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi F. is 45 years old, married, and the father of four. He is the owner of a lumber warehouse in Adeta, a village located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He would like to use this loan to have more inventory of wood in order to respond to the needs of the population, which is continuously growing. With this Kiva opportunity, Koffi hopes to increase his sales figures and thus his profits, so that he may provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards for resale

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 67 años, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado de su localidad.  Se encuentra sola, quedó viuda, y su único pasatiempo es su negocio, el mismo que la incentiva a seguir adelante.  Trabaja arduamente para ver crecer su negocio, aumentar su sustento económico y tener una vida tranquila.  Consuelo desea la prosperidad de su negocio, quiere comprar otro puesto en el mercado, es por eso que necesita de un capital que hará posible su objetivo.  Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo trabaja para prosperar.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 67 years old and the mother of five children who are now on their own and have their own families. Almost her whole life, she has dedicated herself to the sale of seafood at a stand in her local market. She finds herself alone, having been widowed, and her only pastime is her business which is her incentive to keep going. She works arduously to grow her business, increase her financial status, and live a tranquil life. Consuelo wishes for a prosperous business, and wants to buy another stand at the market. This is the reason she seeks a loan, which will made her objective possible. Let us support this mother who, with talent and effort, works to prosper.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an additional stand at the local market to sell seafood.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Téné de la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali), les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes ayant en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles se connaissent parfaitement car pratiquant la même activité économique, à savoir l’achat et la vente d’un condiment alimentaire appelé le fakoye et la fabrication d’une boisson alcoolisée locale appelée le Tchapalo.  Le fakoye est une feuille sauvage de couleur verte très appréciée par la population malienne et entrant dans la préparation des sauces surtout des régions nord du Mali. Le Tchapalo est fait à base de mil fermenté. 
Obtenant des commandes de toutes les régions du Mali, les membres du groupe ont décidé de chercher des ressources financières supplémentaires auprès de l’institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après trois prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de fakoye et de mil auprès de producteurs dans villages environnants de Téné. Tandis que les sacs de Fakoye sont envoyés à Gao(septième région administrative du Mali) pour la vente, le mil est transformé en Tchapalo et vendu dans les cabarets et sous des hangars aménagés dans les maisons. La vente se fait en gros et au comptant aux ménagères et aux restaurateurs.
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 125 000 CFA. de bénéfice le long du prêt qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Living in traditional extended families in the village of Téné (San Prefecture, the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), the members of the group Benkadi are women who average 42 years of age and four children. The women know each other quite well because they do the same work, namely buying and selling a condiment called fakoye and making a local alcoholic beverage called tchapalo. Fakoye is a wild leaf, green in color and highly valued by the people in Mali. It is used in making sauces, especially in northern Mali. Tchapalo is made from fermented millet. Obtaining orders from all regions of Mali, the group members decided to look for additional financial resources from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans, all correctly repaid, they are on their fourth loan. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of fakoye and millet from producers in villages surrounding Téné. While the sacks of fakoye are sent to Gao (7th administrative region of Mali) to be sold, millet is transformed into tchapalo and sold in cabarets or out of covered stalls that are set up in homes. These are wholesale transactions made in cash to homemakers and restauranteurs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and millet

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. runs a grocery store and is requesting a loan to buy more stock. Mary is 32 years old and married. Her husband also runs the grocery store. She has two children who do not go to school. With the extra profits generated by this loan, she hopes to be able to send the children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Imaña U. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Villa Fátima, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Gueysi Vásquez.
El señor Jorge se dedica a la elaboración de pan casero que vende diariamente a los vecinos de su zona y adyacentes.
El crédito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar más harina, ya que se están presentando la oportunidad de elaborar otras masitas que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Jorge Imaña U. lives with his wife, Gueysi Vásquez, in their own home in the Villa Fatima neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Jorge bakes homemade bread, which he sells each day to the people in his area and in surrounding neighborhoods. He plans to use this loan as working capital and to buy more flour so that he can start making different kinds of baked goods and earn more.

This is the third time that Jorge has requested a loan from IMPRO. After a socioeconomic analysis, he has received a good credit score, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – three boys and three girls. She says that, currently, some of her children have completed junior high school and have yet to continue. The rest are still in the basic school.

Florence’s husband is a cocoa farmer. She lives with her family in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of the town are in official professions.

Florence is a trader. She trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy it. She also sells in the local market. Florence has been in business for over eight years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito” (or Women United with Purpose) is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a third loan for further business expansion. Eladia is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago.

Eladia is the mother of three married children aged 19, 28, and 31. Her business is selling undergarments. Daily she travels the streets of Santiago with her garments to sell to local women. She declares business is good and she is able to sell inventory daily.

Eladia's past two loans have been used to purchase additional undergarment pieces to sell; because of the success of her business and the customer base she has developed, she plans to start food sales from her home. Her third loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, oil, and other needed Dominican food and cooking staples. Because of her loyal customer base she is able to sell her products on credit, something that local grocery stores cannot offer.

Other member’s of Eladia’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial operations, including small grocery stands, beauty salons, and vegetable and clothing sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, oil, and other cooking staples

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mr. Vann U. lives in Chi Chreab village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. He is a 60 year old widower with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Mr. Vann U. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Vicky Alejandrina,

texts.es:
En la actualidad, Vicky se encuentra en el séptimo mes de gestación de su tercer hijo. Sus dos hijos mayores ya tienen diecisiete y doce años. Debido a su estado, y también a la reciente construcción de su casa. Solo se dedica a un negocio de los dos que maneja por lo general.

Desde hace dos años tiene una bodega que por ahora no funciona ya que la construcción de su casa provocó que todas las cosas y productos de la bodega se guardaran en un lugar donde no pudieran dañarse. Una vez que haya dado a luz, Vicky piensa reinstalar las cosas de su bodega para retomar su rutina diaria.

Hoy en día solo se dedica a la venta de frituras en la puerta de su casa por las noches y todos los días. Más adelante quisiera surtir más en su tienda o de repente convertir el local en una fuente de soda donde pueda vender comida y bebida.
texts.en:
Vicky is currently in the 7th month of pregnancy of her third child. Her two older children are 17 and 12 years old. Because of her condition, and because of the recent construction of her house, she is only working in one of the two businesses that she usually runs. For the last two years Vicky has run a small store which is not currently operating, as the products had to be stored in a safe place during construction on her home. Once she has had her baby, Vicky plans on restocking her products to take up her daily routine once again. Currently she sells fried food from the door of her home in the evenings and during the day. She hopes to offer more products from her store in the future, or to convert the space to a soda fountain where she can sell food and drink.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic ingredients for food sales, and money for the birth of her child.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy N. is married with six dependents and has received an education through senior high school. She has sold kenkey (a kind of dough made from maize and cassava), bread, and doughnuts at Moree Junction near Cape Coast since 1999. Her husband is employed as a mason. Dorothy uses her income to help pay for her family’s expenses, which include school fees and utilities.  She will use the loan to purchase more flour and maize in order to make more kenkey, doughnuts and bread.  Dorothy plans to save the extra profit from her expanded business in the bank so she will be able to use it as she deems necessary.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and maize.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is a tailor and also sells tailoring materials such as zippers, thread, etc. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 ($350 US) so that she can purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en: The group of borrowers consists of four peopL.. Its leader, Mrs. Lon L., 37, makes a living selling various grocery products, such as cooking ingredients, plastic products, and sweets. She started the business four years ago, and currently earns approximately US$4 per day. Her husband is a local construction worker. Mrs. Lon L. has three children, all attend school and help her business when they are not studying. Currently, the family's living conditions are not so comfortabL. due to the surrounding their house is full of pollutions, which is harmful for their health. Therefore, Mrs. Lon L. is requesting a loan to purchase piece of land to cover the pollution places. The other three borrowers are C., 48, who is a cleaner for a company and also needs a loan to buy groceries to sell; N., 45, who works as a cleaner and needs money to build a kitchen; and R., 29, who earns a living selling vegetables and needs a loan to expand her business. All of the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase piece of land to cover the pollution places

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Victoria vende carne al por mayor, reparte a comerciantes del mercado Vivanco, los animales los adquiere en las ferias de la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovinos.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank.
Victoria is 34 years old, has 4 children and lives with her common-law husband. Victoria sells meat wholesale to vendors at the Vivanco Market. She acquires the animals at fairs in the region with the help of her husband.
Victoria needs a 1400 PEN loan to purchase sheep.
Victoria dreams of her children becoming professionals and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Cate's Group

texts.en:
Cate N. is the leader of Kayunga market group 1. She is a hard-working and devoted lady who has had a business selling fresh foods and vegetables in the market area since 1996, when her husband died. Her produce includes tomatoes, onions, cabbages, Irish potatoes, carrots, and vegetables. She is happy that she has been able to make a profit from her business. She uses the profits to pay school fees for her two children, one of whom is still at the university. Cate also helps to care for two orphans, who are also in school.

She has also been able to buy a Fresian cow that she hopes will give her milk for sale. She needs this loan to help buy maize brand for the cow and fresh produce for sale at her stall.

loans.use: To buy maize brand for her cow and fresh produce for her market stall.

loans.name: Adepa Wo Fie Group

texts.en:
Felicia is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She is a trader and runs a provision store. She has her store on the street in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called “Adepa wo fie” which literally means “One’s household has something good to boast about”. She is fair in complexion and fourth from the left in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts’ desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. C. Pov, age 26, is a widow (pictured here with her father). She has two children: a son and a daughter, which are both young. She lives with her parents on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. C. has been a ferment factory worker for one month. Because her father sells cows, she is asking for a loan of $400 in order to purchase a cow for her father to resale.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her father to resale

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es: María Josefa R. A. reside en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador junto a su único hijo quien es empleado. María  tiene una venta de variedad de carnes como pollo, res, cerdo; su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado el Matazano donde sus ventas son a diario, manteniendo una clientela estable que prefieren de las carnes que María vende ya que son de muy buena calidad; el destino del crédito que solicita María es para surtir su inventario de sus productos.
texts.en:
María Josefa R. A. lives in the municipality of Soyapango, department of San Salvador, El Salvador, along with her only son, who is employed. María sells a variety of meats, such as chicken, beef and pork, at her business located in the Matazano market. She works every day, maintaining a stable clientele that prefers her meats because of their very high quality. The loan she is requesting will be used to stock her inventory with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат Усмонова проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Инобат более 20 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она занимается продажей национальный "тюбитеек". У нее имеется постоянный поставщик, который поставляет ей подешевле, а она на рынке продает их подороже. Муж работает на частной стройке. Кредит просит для пополнения оборотных средств.
texts.en:
Inobat U. lives in Tursun-zoda region. She is 48, married, and has one child. Inobat has been in sales for more than 20 years. She sells national hats called "tubeteyka." She has a supplier that provides her with low-priced hats, which she later resells at higher prices on a market. Her husband works at private construction. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Charisse

texts.en: Charisse Q. is from the village of Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Charisse owns and operates a business making sandals which she sells to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Charisse joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Charisse is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Felomena

texts.en:
Felomena is the kind of businesswoman who prefers to always be busy. She sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables in Baclaran, a place far away from her home.
