Most of the fruit she sells come from various villages in the town where she lives. She gathers them all together and delivers by truck, or commonly known as a “backload” in the village. She also goes to Baclaran and personally sells the fruit. The income she generates from selling fruit is being used to purchase other products, such as clothes, which she sells in the village. 

Felomena is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to have additional capital for her retail business. She aims to further expand her business and she needs capital to be able to purchase more products. In this way, her income will increase. She hopes that her loan request will be granted.

Felomena is 50 years old, but for her, age doesn’t matter in business. She just hopes to remain strong and healthy to pursue what she started in business. Her family owns more than a hectare of farmland and it is being cultivated by her humble husband, Damian. They have four children, but they did not pursue their studies due to early marriage. She hopes that with the help of her business, she can manage to give a little help to her children.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie G. is from the village of Barangay 3, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Margie is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Margie sells beauty products such as lotions, shampoos, deodorants, make-up and others in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income for the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Imelda Rene

texts.en: Mrs. L. is from the town of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and blessed with five adult children. Mrs. L. owns and operates a business selling used clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than eight years, earning Php 8,000 monthly net income. She also has a remittance from her daughter from abroad as another source of income. Now, Mrs. L. is obtaining her 4th loan in the amount of Php 4,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita A. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 60 years old, married, and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pablita owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Pablita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pablita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Farig

texts.en:
Farig was born in 1956. He is married and has four children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, Ahmadbayli village.

Farig has been in the cattle-breeding business for ten years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy four calves for improving his cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Kennedy Otieno

texts.en: Kennedy Otieno O. sells shoes to frequent and walk-in customers in a marketplace. He has in the business for 10 years and has two employees. His wife runs an embroidery business. His business challenges are lack of funds and strong competition from similar shoe businesses. He is using the proceeds to buy more leather materials. In the future, Kennedy wants to be a wholesaler. He is married and has four children ranging from two to nine years. He describes himself as hardworking and intelligent.

loans.use: To buy leather material.

loans.name: Janette Elissa

texts.es: Janette es madre casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo el mayor que  cursa el 5 año de secundaria y el menor de 5 años que cursa el primer grado. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de adornos y piñatas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad, sus inicios se dan porque su mama se dedicaba anteriormente a este medio de vida, por lo que ella fue aprendiendo poco a poco a realizar cada una de las destrezas  para la elaboración de sus productos ya que no fue muy fácil porque anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, pero esto le generaba muy pocos ingresos mas tarde decide continuar con el negocio de su Mama que le favorecía mucho mas ingresos para su familia. Actualmente ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de telas, papeles, bordados, tijeras, cintas, globos
texts.en:
Janette is married and is a mother caring for two children. Her older son is in the last year of high school and her younger son is 5 and is in first grade. Janette works making and selling decorations and piñatas. She's been in this line of work for more than 3 years. She began because her mother had previously done the same sort of work, so little by little she learned the techniques needed to make her products. It wasn't easy because previously Janette had worked selling cosmetics. However, that business generated very little money and so she then decided to continue with her mother's line of business. This provides a much better income for her family. She is currently asking for a loan for working capital in order to buy fabric, paper, embroidery, scissors, ribbons and balloons.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy fabric, paper, embroidery, scissors, ribbons and balloons.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Maruja es casada y tiene 52 años, Maruja tiene una tienda en un local alquilado, ubicado en el centro D. la ciudad, en donD. venD. artesanías variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maruja necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. artesanías.
Los sueños D. Maruja son que sus hijos tengan estabilidad económica y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maruja ia a member of the Communal Bank Agua Viva. Maruja is married and is 52 years old. She has a store in a local rented space located in the town center. There she sells various handicrafts every day. Maruja needs a 1500 soles loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of handicrafts. Maruja's dream is for her children to have financial stability and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is 28 years old. She is married with two children and her husband is a businessman. Happy is a lovely woman. She attracts happiness to her business and this has made her attract and retain more customers. She sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business. Happy has a good relationship with LAPO. (Lift Above Poverty Organization)  LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: S. Sopheap, 43, is a professional tailor, making $3 each day in the Takeo province. She is a widow and has three children; two are students and one is a tailor as she is. S. Sopheap would like a loan of $800 to purchase three more sewing machines for her business. She will be able to increase her profits through hiring employees to run these machines.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mr. Chann Y is a 55-year-old farmer who lives in a commune in Siem Reap Province. Chann Y is married to Roov, age 42. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to four children. 

Since 1995, Chann has always used a cow that he hired from his neighbor. Now he wants to reduce this expense by looking for assistance in buying his own cow. He is happy that this loan will provide him with a new asset and he intends to raise the cow for breeding in the future. 

(Mr. Chann Y was not available at the time, so his wife and his son are pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Edgar Jose

texts.es:
El Señor EDGAR JOSE F. R., Labora como Metrologo en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, es casado y padre de  un Hijo y este se
 Encuentra en el colegio el junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar José F. R. works as an Inspector at the Iván Montenegro Market in Managua. He is married and the father of one high-school aged son. Together with his wife, he has been able to help his family get ahead. He will invest this loan in the purchase of building materials to remodel his home, making it more secure. He will thereby provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and addition to home

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en: Altanzul is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Elbegjargal, is 4 years old and hasn't reached school age yet. Altanzul worked as a cook in a small restaurant between 2004 and 2010. With the experience that she gained from her previous work, Altanzul opened her own cafe with her brother in 2010. The business is supported by the entire family. She started her business with a working capital of 60,000 tugrugs (~ 45 USD), and in only short time her working capital has increased to 300,000 tugrugs (~  216 USD). Since she started operating her business, her family's quality of life has improved. Altanzul is a very hard working person who has good communication skills. Altanzul says, “My dream is to one day expand my cafe into a comfortable restaurant.” She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~  220 USD) loan to purchase flour, rice, vegetables, and meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more local household items to sell

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
35 year-old Marianne M. and her family are one of the families who will be relocating from the land where they have lived for their whole lives. The owner of the said land is claiming his rights for personal reasons. Before his demand takes effect, Marianne hopes to have put up a savings fund through her transportation business. The business is managed by her husband and financed by the loan she availed from ASHI. Her membership to ASHI institution started in 2000. Since then she has received several loans, which enabled her to maintain the tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire and to support their family's needs. Marianne’s parents gave the tricycle to her and her husband so that they could have their own source of income. As this tricycle has been used since 2004, its motor engine is no longer efficient. The sidecar is also very old and has to be repainted to be able to look nice and appealing to the passengers.

Marianne and her husband agreed to request for a larger loan so that they can purchase a brand new motorcycle. The repairs to the old one would cost a huge amount of money. Some of the money will be spent for repairs and repainting of the sidecar. Marianne is hopeful that once they have all these for their business, their income will grow and she will be able to have a savings fund. She hopes to save enough money to build their own house someday on the land owned by her husband's parents. Their old motorcycle will still be operating as a rental to have more profits to support her only child’s education until graduating from college.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and payment of the repair and repainting of the sidecar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria P. is from the village of Santa Rita. She is 43 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying seeds of vegetables for farming

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Emma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El  socio es el Sr. Raúl; el tiene 34 años de edad y El socio es conviviente, estudió la superior incompleta, debido a que debido asumir los gastos económicos de su nuevo hogar, él socio es natural de la comunidad de yungaqui. El socio se dedicaba antes a la compra y venta de palos ahora a él le va mejor el pudo ahorrar y cambio de negocio. Él ahora compra y vende autos de segunda mano. El  socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar un auto de segunda para venderlo a un taxista.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Raúl belongs to the community bank, "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui". He lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of and department of Cusco. Raúl is 34 years old and lives with his partner. He started higher education but was not able to finish because he had to assume the expenses of his new home. Raúl is a native of the community of Yungaqui. He used to dedicate himself to buying and selling posts. However, he was able to save and improve his business. He now buys and sells used cars. Raúl is requesting this loan to increase his working capital and buy a used car so that he can sell it to a taxi driver. Raúl values and is infinitely grateful for the credit offered to him since it helps him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to pay back the installments according to the timetable stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a used car to sell to a taxi driver

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia nació en el distrito San Jerónimo en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Felicia lleva toda la su vida rodeada de vacas, ovejas, chanchos, etc. Sus abuelos y sus padres se dedican a la compra y venta de carne. Hace 20 años, Felicia abrió un puesto venta, en el mercado “Vino Canchón”, donde vende carne de cordero, res y chancho. La pueden encontrar  en su puesto que está equipado con una balanza y una zona donde corta la carne, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de la carne.

Con su próximo préstamo, Felicia espera recibir $1000 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería. Le gustaría  con el dinero del préstamo comprar un ganado crio para hacerlo engordar y después vender su carne. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Felicia hace dos años atrás es que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Felicia was born in Cusco’s San Jerónimo district and still lives there with her husband and three children. She has spent her entire life surrounded by cows, sheep, pigs, etc. Her grandparents and parents were meat merchants. Twenty years ago Felicia opened a sales stand in Vino Canchón” Market where she sells lamb, beef and pork. She can be found tending to her stand, which is equipped with a scale and an area where she cuts the meat, every day of the week from 7am until 7pm or until her supply of meat runs out. Felicia expects to get $1000 USD in her next loan. Currently she has enough merchandise but would like to use the funds to buy a head of cattle to raise and fatten up for subsequent meat sale. The “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (San Jerónimo Lionesses) communal bank has been in operation for 10 cycles but Felicia has only participated for the past two years; she does quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle to raise for subsequent meat sales.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn C., who lives in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province, was born in 1962. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sok C., is a horse cart driver. The family does not have a motorcycle for transportation. To improve this situation, Mrs. Sorn C. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorcycle. She is the mother of six children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a laborer, two help with their parents’ businesses, and the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Tabaksneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Tabaksneh” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Gbassay T.. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently living with her husband, who is a businessman.

For ten years now, Gbassay has been selling onions, groundnuts (peanuts), salt, Magi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more onions, groundnuts, salt, Magi, pepper, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Xasay

texts.ru:
Xasay A. 37 let. On jenat  i imeyet 2 detey, sin 14 let uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom, i sin 10 let toje uchitsya v shkole  i zanimayetsya tancami. Xasay i yeqo semya jivut v Absheron regione.

7 let tomu nazad Xasay nachal zanimatsya etim biznesom taksista. Etomu biznessu on  nauchilsya u svoyeqo dedushki kotoriy bil shoferom , on nauchil Xasaya kak pravelno doljen vesti sebya shofer. Seychas Xasay nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya mashini.
texts.en:
Xasay A. is 37 years old. He is married with two children. Both of his sons go to school The 14-year old son is good at sports. The 10-year old son is enrolled in a dance course. Xasay and his family live in the Absheron region. Seven years ago Xasay started working as a taxi driver. He learned all about this trade from his grandfather, who was also a taxi driver. At the moment Xasay needs 2000 AZN in otder to buy spare parts for his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and high transport costs.

She has operated a retail shop for over two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she operates a tailoring shop as her other source of income. Faith faces a challenge of defaults in payments of goods by those who purchase on credit and also high cost of transporting goods to her place of operations.

She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of diverse products. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with one two-year-old son. She sells children's clothing at the local market. Tatyana's been in this business for 11 years. Experience and optimism help Tatyana to maintain good sales. Moreover, children's clothing is always in demand.

Tatyana would like to purchase seasonal clothing for sale. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 grivnas. Tatyana built a new booth last year. This gives her a competitive advantage in attracting more clients and increasing sales.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Kanneth

texts.en:
Kanneth I. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Kanneth is single. To make a living, Kanneth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Kanneth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Kanneth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kanneth is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Kanneth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hairolla

texts.en: Hairolla H. is 45 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  He lives in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  Hairolla operates a livestock and raw material trading business in his town. He started his business in 2004 by purchasing and selling livestock and the animal skins in his local area. His daily sales income is between 15,000 and 25,000 MNT and his net profit is between 15-25%.  He continues to make progress with his business and uses his earnings to improve his family's quality of life. His earnings have enabled him to build a house for his family. After many years of operation, Hairolla has gained many permanent partners and suppliers and was able to create a savings account with 10,000,000 MNT in the bank. Hairolla is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell for upcoming preparation of meats for winter.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to sell

loans.name: Noelia Margarita

texts.es: Noelia Margarita E. T. de 41 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se encarga de atender su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Noelia vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad con quienes reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Noelia es madre soltera y la única que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su hogar, por esta razón trabaja muy duro en su tienda, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: café en polvo, sodas, leche, golosinas, huevos, pan y otros productos más los cuales le permitan contar con más clientes y de esta misma forma más ganancias.
texts.en: Noelia Margarita E. T. is 41 years old. She is a very hardworking person who manages her own business -- a store that sells groceries and other basic products for the home. Noelia lives with her two children, aged ten and four, in the town of Atiquizaya which is part of the department of Ahuachapán. Noelia is a single mother, and she is the only person who looks out for the well-being of her children and her home. For this reason, she works very hard in her store since it is her only source of income. She is asking for a loan to purchase instant coffee, soft drinks, milk, sweets, eggs, bread, and other products that she needs to stock in order to be able to bring in more clients which would allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of convenience store inventory

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 65 years old and married with two children, ages 28 and 34. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. His farm produces tea, sugarcane, vegetables and maize which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income realized from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. In future, he aspires to start a retail cereals store at his local market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, es un valeroso hombre de 62 años; que enviudo hace 20 años. A pesar de los constantes problemas y dificultades, cuidó muy bien de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos David. En su casa ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced. Para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, Pedro se tuvo que dedicar a varias actividades económicas, una de ellas es la agricultura, ahí comenzó hace 30 años. En todo ese tiempo aprendió muchas técnicas de cultivo, por ello sus frutos de naranja, tangüelo, carambola y mango; son los más reconocidos de la localidad, tanto así que son los más cotizados en el mercado central de la capital. Paralelo a ese negocio, él se dedica al transporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Santa Ana - La Merced. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Caramboleros”, y esté es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a ser un socio responsable y puntual. Pedro está en plena cosecha de Mangos, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varias javas para empaquetar su cosecha; además comprará abono orgánico para esparcirlo en sus demás cultivos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a brave man, 62 years old, whose wife died 20 years ago.  In spite of the constant problems and difficulties, he took good care of their 5 children, one of whom, David, lives with him at home in the city of La Merced.  In order to make a life for his kids, Pedro had to do various things, one of which was farming.  He began around 30 years ago, and learned a lot of cultivation techniques, because of which his oranges, tangelos, starfruit and mangoes are the most well-known in the area and the most coveted in the central market in the capital.  In addition to that business, he works in public transport, covering the route from Santa Ana to La Merced.  

He belongs to the village ban "Los Caramboleros" and this is his third loan with MFP, where he promises to be a responsible and punctual member.  Pedro is in the middle of the mango harvest; for that reason, he is planning to use this loan to buy some packing crates for his fruit.  He also will buy some compost to spread over the rest of his fields.

loans.use: Buy packing crates for fruit and sacks of compost

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Women comprise a significant share of Kyrgyzstan’s labor force, most of them involved in trade, a very important part of Kyrgyzstan’s activities.

Aizada S. K., the 34-year-old treasurer of this group, is married and has two young sons. Her husband works in transportation services, while she has been involved in the retail of women's apparel in a local market for eight years. When he’s free from work, her husband tries to substitute for her at work so that she can spend more time at home with the children.

Starting this business with a loan of 20,000 from a local bank, Aizada's good management enabled her to quickly repay the loan. She currently earns a monthly income of 7,800 soms and has thus far been able to purchase nice furniture for their house.

With the loan she is requesting from Kiva, Aizada plans to purchase more goods and diversify her assortment. The anticipated profit will be spent on purchasing a permanent place for retail in the market and an automobile.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Azizan's Group

texts.en:
Azizan lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. For 14 years, she has lived there with her family in a single-room brick house. 

Azizan is 34 years old. Several years ago, her husband died suddenly, leaving her a widow. It was a very difficult time for her but she never lost hope.  She started working in people's homes to bring up her 3 daughters. 

Azizan's brother-in-law also lives with her. He is a loader by profession and loads goods onto trucks. But the income he earns is not enough, so he would like to buy a rickshaw and start a transportation business. Azizan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her brother-in-law in his business. She is hopeful that a new business will be more profitable for him and he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.
 
Azizan is a regular user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan, she has established good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw to start a transportation business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. sells provisions in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.  Educated up to junior high school, Victoria is a single mother of one child. 
Having been in this business for two years, she wants to grow her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional provisions for sale and to reinvest the additional profits into back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions for sale

loans.name: Jessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Jessenia Del Carmen tiene 25 años y es madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo. Sus propósitos son de seguir manteniendo su clientela ya que es la fuente de ingresos necesarios con la que cuentan. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos y calzado, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene su negocio es de 5 años, inicia este negocio en busca de trabajo que le generara ingresos para su familia  por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercadería, al comienzo no le fue tan difícil ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así recurre a todas sus amistades  para mostrarles los productos de venta además empezó a realizar los financiamientos con el fin de invertir más en su mercadería por lo que siempre ha trabajado con Fundación y decidió quedarse con este apoyo. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para ropa interior, perfumes, vestidos, bolsos, calzados, cremas entre otros productos debido a la temporada que se acerca.
texts.en: Jessenia Del Carmen is 25 years old.  She is a single mother and has one child in her care.  Her goal is to continue maintaining her customers since her business provides income that she needs.  Jessenia's business is selling general merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics and footwear.  She works as an itinerant street vendor and has been in her business for 5 years.  She started out in her business as she was looking for work that would make income for her family.  She decided to start selling merchandise.  In the beginning, things weren't so difficult as she has always enjoyed working.  She showed her friends the products that she had for sale and started taking loans so that she could invest more money in purchasing merchandise.  Jessenia has always worked with Fundación Leon 2000 and decided to continue relying on their support.  This loan will provide Jessenia with working capital that she will spend on underwear, perfume, dresses, bags, footwear, creams and other products as the summer season is approaching.

loans.use: to buy underwear, perfume, dresses, bags, footwear, creams and other products

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares dnde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz. Milagros tiene la edad de 24 años solo estudio la preparatoria y es madre soltera de una niña de 9 meses de nombre judith.

ella nos platica que antes de que naciera su hija trabaja en una papeleria pero desde que nacio su hija no puede salir a trabajar asi que se ha asociado con su hermana para poner una pequeña papeleria en la cual tambien venden dulces y refrescos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas, biografias, dulces y refrescos.

ella espera que sus ganancias sean buenas ya que espera en un futuro contruir un local para instalarla su papeleria .
texts.en:
Milagros is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Milagros is 24 years old and has a high school education. She is a single mother with a nine month old daughter named Judith.

Milagros says that she worked at a stationery shop before the birth of her daughter. After she was born, Milagros was not able to go to work, so she and her sister opened a small stationery store where they also sell candy and soft drinks.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pencils, pens, white and colored paper, glue, scissors, folders, bond paper, modeling clay, packing foam, craft foam, notebooks, books, prints, journals, candy, and soft drinks. Milagros hopes that her earnings are good because she hopes to build a store in the future to house her stationery shop.

loans.use: To purchase stationery, candy, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 63 years old and a widow with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She  has a dried fish/shrimp paste making business in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Sally  has been 20 years in this business.  In the future, Sally  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma resides in Ghala mandi, an area of a city called Sahiwal. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years. She is a housewife who manages her household work by staying at home. 
She is married to M. A. who is a fruit vendor by profession. He puts the fruit on his cart and starts selling early in the morning by visiting different streets of the city. He deals with his clients very well and makes good sales every day due to the good quality of his fruits. Najma is a very supportive person. She helps her husband by arranging the fruit for him on his cart. She has given birth to four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and hopes that a loan will bring positive financial changes to his business. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Najma.

loans.use: To buy fresh seaonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador desde hace 28 años se dedica a la venta de periódicos de una empresa muy conocida que ofrece en una de las avenidas mas transitadas de la ciudad. A el se le denomina en esta institución un cliente con distinguido ya que sus créditos los ha pagado con puntualidad  y se encuentra agradecido por el apoyo brindado ya que de esta manera ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Francisco desea terminar la construcción de su cuarto en la planta alta necesita poner en la paredes un material que la protegiera de las inclemencias del tiempo y se encontré mas reforzada para esto necesita capital para terminar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Franciso is a very hard working man who has been selling very well known newspapers for 28 years on one of the city’s busiest avenues.  In this institution he’s known as a client with distinction because he’s repaid all his loans on time and he is grateful for the support provided because he’s been able to complete his projects thanks to it.

Francisco wants to finish building his bedroom on the second floor; he needs to attach material to the walls that will protect them from the weather inclemency and strengthen them.  To do so, he needs capital.

loans.use: to finish building his bedroom.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, nació en la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 40 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Albino de 43 años y fruto de ese amor concibieron 09 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida para ellos. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Juliana junto a su pareja en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados, por ello es que sus frutos son los más vendidos. Su principal fuente de ingreso, es la venta de cacao, café y plátano, por lo que tiene  06 cuadras de terreno cultivados. Su producción es vendida en la ciudad de San Francisco y en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que le ayuden en la siembra y extracción de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, pues se cristaliza la recompensa luego de tanto esfuerzo y dedicación que puso sobre sus plantas. Tiene 20 años ejerciendo esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos, ya que constantemente atacan sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos, por ello pide su apoyo para cumplir ese deseo. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y trabaja sin causar problemas a su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de su producción.
texts.en: Juliana was born in the city of Quimbiri. She is 40 years old and a cheerful and hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Albino, who is 43 years old. Together they have 9 children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. The hard work that Juliana does with her spouse in their fields have made their crops be very well cared for. Because of this, their products are the most in demand. Her main source of income is the sale of cacao, coffee and plantains. She has 38,400 meters of cultivated land. She sells her products in the city of San Francisco and at harvest time hires day laborers to help in the planting and harvest of her products. What she likes the most about her work is the harvest, because it is the reward after so much hard work and dedication to her plants. She has been doing this for 20 years and thinks that the hardest thing is protecting her crops from insects, since they are constantly attacking her plantings. Over time, she wants to acquire new land and to increase her crops. That is why she is asking for support to make this wish come true. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She has paid her previous loans off on time and had worked with no trouble in her community bank. With the loan she has asked for, she will buy fertilizers to improve the quality of her production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Girlita

texts.en:
Girlita, is married with three children. Girlita is 60 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Girlita has a mini-grocery store at home, that sells all kind of food (sugar, noodles, can goods and other items),home (laundry soap, bath soap, floor wax) and school supplies (notebooks, ball pen and pencil) that earn PHP 3,800 per month. She has had this business for five years. Girlita contributes her income to her husband to sustain their monthly consumption. Girlita wanted to have additional stocks like feeds for sale because most of her neighbors are asking for feeds everyday. So, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase feeds to sell.

Girlita has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Girlita hopes that she can have agricultural supplies in their area.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora displays provisions such as biscuits, toffees, rice, etc. on a table for resale. She also sells yam tubers. Dora is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has received senior high education. She has been in this trade for four years and as part of her duties she assists her husband to take care of the home. The reason why she wants a loan is to be able to buy more provisions to display for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to display for sale.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes platos típicos, la socia trabaja vendiendo sus platos de comidas en el centro comercial paraíso, la socia solía trabajar atendiendo un kiosco escolar en la época escolar y ahora está elaborando comidas; la socia también es dueña de un stand en el centro comercial Paraíso y su esposo atiende el stand de venta de calzados; la socia trabaja mucho para poder dar lo mejor a sus hijos en cuanto a una buena educación, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración de sus platos diversos y de este modo poder crecer e incrementar sus ventas.

Los otros socios invertirán su dinero en la venta de condimentos, reciclaje, venta de chatarra, venta de gas a pedido, elaboración de picarones, tejido de chompas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the “Las Palmeras” communal bank, located in the Huanchac district of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Luz Marina is 32 years old, is married, and has two children.  She makes and sells various typical dishes in the Paraíso shopping center.  She used to run a kiosk when she attended school, but now she makes food.  She also owns a stand in the Paraíso shopping center, where her husband sells shoes.  Luz works hard in order to be able to provide a good education for her children.  She wants to invest the money from this loan into supplies and ingredients to make her various dishes so that she can increase her sales.

The other members will invest their money into making condiments, recycling, scrap metal sales, gas sales to order, desserts, and knitting sweaters.

She appreciates the support and is likewise committed to make her payments faithfully.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovana tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive con su pareja, con el que tiene 02 hijos, reside en casa propia y vive en el distrito de Tambogrande. en el departamento de Piura al norte del Perú, ella por vivir en una zona urbana cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y energía eléctrica.

Giovana cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta actualmente con clientela fija y fidelizada.  Además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo los cuales vende en su casa y recorriendo caseríos cercanos y gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido apoyar  a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo

Giovana  esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para que ella pueda compra mercadería para surtir su bodega y comprar más productos de belleza para que cuente con mercadería necesaria en su domicilio, ella piensa que esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Giovana es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Giovana is 34 and lives with her partner, with whom she has two children. She lives in her own home in the Tambogrande district in the Piura department in the north of Peru. Because she lives in an urban zone, she has basic water and electricity services.

Giovana has a store in her home. There she sells various daily use products, such as basic staples and groceries, to her neighbours. She has a fixed and loyal customer base. She also sells beauty products from a catalogue, which she sells in her home and by traveling to various nearby hamlets. Thanks to these businesses, she has been able to support her husband in maintaining their family and getting ahead.

Giovana is requesting a loan of 2200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can purchase merchandise to stock her store and purchase more beauty products so that she will have the necessary merchandise in her home. She thinks that this is an investment that will allow her to continue expanding her business.

Giovana is a very diligent and hard-working person. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (basic staples) and beauty products to stock her business.

loans.name: Iveth De La Paz

texts.es:
Iveth, vive con su hijo, es casada recibe ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja de policía, ella es empleada trabaja desde hace 17 meses en la Alcaldía Municipal gracias a su grado de educación, es una mujer trabajadora y apoya mucho a su hijo.
Iveth solicita un préstamo para cancelar una deuda con esta oportunidad abrira la oportunidad para cubrir la necesidad que presenta, pues son gastos personales que no puede cubrir con su salario.
Su objetivo es lograr una tranquilidad economica puesto que considera que nuestros servicios son mejores y que tendra más solvencia en sus ingresos.
texts.en: Iveth lives with her son and is married.  She receives support from her husband, who is a policeman.  Iveth has worked as an employee of the local city hall for the past 17 months.  She is hardworking and committed to supporting her son.  Iveth seeks this credit in order to pay off debts that she simply cannot pay off with her monthly salary alone.  This will allow her to achieve financial solvency and live with peace of mind.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses and pay off debts

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother of 8 children, all adults save for the last two, who are still in school. She has been doing mixed farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, producing and selling maize, avocado, sugarcane, beans, and bananas. She has been in farming for the last 25 years and sells her produce at the local market.

Josephine has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and expand her poultry business. She says the income from poultry will enable her to better manage her retail shop in the local market.  She says farm produce prices are never stable, and the weather is also rather unpredictable.  She adds that the income will also go towards education and food for her children.

Josephine is glad for Juhudi Kilimo's loan services. This is her sixth loan.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Dhan Kumari

texts.en:
Dhan is 25 years old, married and has two children who are 9 and 6.  In 2000, she went into business farming vegetables, and works seven days a week, four hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is determined to improve her family's life and thanks Kiva lenders for their support. 

Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural, and most families grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to buy greater amounts of seed and fertilizer and increase their land's output. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for a small farm.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has 4 children. She has received junior high education. Aba smokes fish in Abura, which she has done for 4 years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.
To smoke the fish, you need to go to the sea shore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen.  When you come home with the fish, you clean them. Once you drain the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. Firewood and a traditionally-built oven are prepared to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. 
The most important thing about this process is that it is the smoke, not the fire, that cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.
Cape Coast is a town in the Central Region of Ghana that is known to be a fishing community. Most women in this region are fishmongers who supply other surrounding villages with fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Chikophe

texts.en:
Chikophe is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past three years, Chikophe has operated a bO. bO. (motorcycle) business, operating from home to the market. He faces a major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators in the area. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 Chikophe wants to add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen was born in 1960. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune. She has two children. One of them is married. Her husband has died. Her family life is difficult. Not only does she grow rice, but also she sells groceries to earn more money. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her general store by buying more groceries, like cake, candy, beer and fruit.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, like cake, candy, beer and fruit.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; el tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de servicio de taxi y también quiere comprar un artefacto para su casa.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para su casa.
                                                      
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Jose Luis, 24, belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank located in Cusco District which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.  He has a spouse and a son.  He alternates his daily activities with a transportation business.  He has a car that provides taxi services from 6am until 7pm.  He’s able to support his family through this business.  He wants to expand his taxi services and also to buy an appliance for his home.  He is asking for the loan to buy a television set for his house.  He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his house.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is a 35-year-old widow who was left with three children after her husband passed away. To be able to support her kids, Mervat was urged to start a small retail business selling clothes at her house. Since she started, she has been able to manage it in addition to taking care of her kids. Since there is an upcoming opportunity to increase her sales rate (the holidays season plus the winter season), Mervat decided to apply for this loan to buy more clothes so she can be prepared to cover as many of her customers’ needs as she can. Because Mervat is a conservative person, she asked her mother Alia to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her grocery store which she operates from her home. She sells household items like sugar and cooking oil.
With the loan she will buy grocery items such as sugar and cooking oil in bulk. This will allow her to fulfill her clients' orders and increase her profits.
She has operated her business for the past many years and is very confident about her success after the loan investment.
Her husband is a government servant and earns a reasonable income.
She has given birth to four children, all of whom study in a local school.
Besides her business, Nasreen also performs her household duties very actively.
Note: In the picture, the lady who has the passbook in her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and other grocery items.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school while the other two have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the seasonal nature of this business, which is why she wants to begin selling coconuts as well as charcoal. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy 60 sacks of coconuts to sell. She joined Yehu as a way to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en la provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, tres dependientes y un independiente.

La señora Silvia trabaja desde hace seis años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, también se dedica a la crianza de truchas.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez sacos de alimentos para truchas.

La señora desea tener una empresa donde pueda vender al por mayor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo y las reuniones con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of communal bank "Kapia Marca," located in the Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children three who are dependent of her and one who is independent.

Mrs. Silvia has been working for six years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan was for $300.00 Peruvian Soles which was invested in her grocery business. She also raises trout.

With this new $3000.00 Peruvian soles loan she will buy ten sacs of feed for the trout.

Silvia wishes to have a business where she can sell wholesale.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease to receive a loan and the meetings with the other members.

loans.use: buy ten sacs of feed for the trout

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widowed woman with five children, four attend school while one is to young.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Gladys has operated a food stall for the past two years.  She is also a water vendor.  Her clients are neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.  Gladys dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar and also to build a shade cover for her water business.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar and also build a shade cover for her water business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman with eight children. Irene is 50 years old, residing at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Irene own and operate a farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Irene wants to make improvements of her house and to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary manages a large crop of rice in the Philippines. He has been in this business for almost 30 years. With his long duration in farming, Hilary state that his expert in managing his rice field is continually improved. He is also continuously dream that he will maintain good quality of crops and get high yield.
Hilary is 52 years of age, married, and is blessed with nine children. Hilary’s wife is a teacher and work also as a housekeeper. The reason why Hilary always dreams to get high yield is to further bestow his children needs in school which are mostly sending in college.
With the costly farm inputs at this time, Hilary gets financial shortage to sustain his farm needs. Hilary is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides for his farm. He believes that through this loan, he will provide all farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Жительница города Турсунзаде, Зебинисо честная и ответственная женщина. Ей 58 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Зебинисо продавщица, занимается продажей одежды на рынке. В этой сфере она работает уже 13 лет. Зебинисо помогает покупателям в выборе одежды и подборе индивидуального образа. Однако из-за отсутствия новой сезонной одежды и денег в обороте, Зебинисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить новые сезонную одежду и расширить свой бизнес. Она искренне надеется, на то что ее запрос о кредите получит одобрение.
texts.en: A resident of the city of Tursun-zoda, Zebiniso is an honest and responsible woman. She is 58 years old, and married with three children. Zebiniso is a trader, and sells clothes at the market. She has worked in this area for 13 years. Because of the lack of stock for the summer season, and money to use, Zebiniso turned to the organisation in order to receive a loan to buy new batch of goods. She sincerely hopes that her request for a loan is approved.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and son in Yelpin village. The family's main income is formed from cattle breeding, selling dairy products and apple growing. Anzhela and her husband work hard to sustain the farm, and their son helps them a lot. 
Anzhela requested this loan to purchase a cow and fodder to feed the cattle so the farm will continue providing income for the family. Increasing the cattle with one more cow will enable this hard working woman to gather more milk, process it and get cheese for selling in the market. 
With the big hope and faith, Anzhela and her family wait for lenders' support to their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and fodder to feed the cattle so the farm will continue providing income for the family

location.town: Yelpin village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a single mother with one child. She runs a plantation with her brother and his adopted son. The plantation only grows taro which is sold once a week in the market in the capital Apia on the weekend. From this she earns approximately USD 1500 per week. She also sells donuts in the village on Saturdays and Sundays which provides her with some additional income. With the loan she wishes to purchase some fertilizer and weed killer. She is a member of the Nuusutia village center which won second prize in SPBD’s best center competition in 2006. She is pictured with her brothers adopted son outside the house where the weekly meeting is held. Also in the picture are materials used on the plantation .

loans.use: Purchase weed killer and fertilser for her plantation

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara has lived around Baba for her entire life. She has a small piece of land where she plants rice, corn, plantains and cacao. She also has a small business in the small town of Baba, where she sells juice, tortillas and snacks. She is applying for the loan because she wants to buy pigs that she will eventually sell as a secondary source of income. She will also invest in her land to produce rice. She has twins who are currently living in Guayaquil because they want to go to school. Clara has been trying to help them study but is having a hard time paying for their school and living expenses. Clara’s dream is to help her two sons graduate as professionals from a good school in the large city.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive land that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The land in Baba is very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm, they first must prepare the land by removing weed, plowing and leveling it. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the land for rice production. After appropriately preparing the land, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial support, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers), there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Vannary

texts.en: Vannary has been married for 28 years and has 4 children, 1 daughter and 3 sons. She is a pharmacist and medical practitioner. She is selling medicine at home and treating people in the villages. She has succeeded in providing medical services in her village. Her husband is a driver and works at the Road and Bridge Construction Company. Two of her sons are also drivers. One son is in the business of transporting bricks in villages, and he has 5 workers for this business. With the given loan amount of $600, Vannary can add with her saved money in order to buy one truck for her son in the business of transporting bricks. She is capable of handling the loan and could repay it without any problem. The current loan term is 12 months.

loans.use: Buy one truck for transporting brick to clients in the villages.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is 39 years old and has five children. Her husband sells flowers and she's an artisan, weaving clothing items typical of her village. She embroiders and embellishes these pieces with lively designs and colors and sells them to the women in her area. Petrona belongs to the co-op Fatima 7.

She will use this loan to buy yarn, which she considers to be her main raw material, at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull Kiva Volunteer.

PETRONA , TIENE 39 AÑOS , 5 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FLORES Y ELLA ES ARTESANA DEDICADA A LA CONFECCION DE ROPA ARTESANAL TIPICA DE LA ZONA DONDE VIVE Y LAS BORDA CON LLAMATIVOS DISEÑOS Y COLORES Y LA VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU ZONA . ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO FATIMA 7 . CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA HILO AL POR MAYOR YA QUE CONSIDERA ESTO COMO LA MATERIA PRIMA EN LA PRODUCION DE SUS PRENDAS.

loans.use: To buy yarn wholesale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela lives with her much loved husband, and even though they are getting older, both of them continue working for their vocation and desire to serve their fellow citizens. Their children are grown up and independent, each with their own family. They began their business activities selling everyday items with financial support from their children. Ater her husband retired, they wanted to be able to continue with their own business to cover the costs for the public services they received from the city. The small shop is busy every day and they begin work early in the morning and continue until late at night, due to the constant presence of their neighbors. To satisfy the demands of their customers, they need to expand the stock of items they offer. For that, they need a loan of $400 which they will repay in 6 months. Manuela's efforts serve the public, and give an example that for work, there is no "right" age. Let's make it possible for them to realize their objectives with our support.

La señora Manuela vive sola en compañía de su querido esposo, a pesar de la avanzada edad de ambos continúan trabajando por vocación y deseos de servir al prójimo. Sus hijos son mayores e independientes y cada uno cuenta con su familia. Iniciaron sus actividades con el comercio de artículos de primera necesidad con el apoyo económico que le brindaron sus hijos después que su esposo se jubiló para que pudieran tener una actividad en la que puedan continuar trabajando por cuenta propia y con el objetivo de costearse los gastos por los servicios públicos que reciben en la ciudad. La bodega la tiene ocupada todo el día y empieza sus labores muy temprano y las culmina muy entrada la noche; debido a la concurrida presencia de sus vecinos. Con el objetivo de satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes necesita aumentar el stock de artículos para satisfacerlos plenamente. Para ello necesita el apoyo económico en calidad de préstamo por el importe de 400 dólares que los devolverá en un plazo de seis meses. Siendo los deseos de Manuela servir a la colectividad dando el ejemplo que para el trabajo no hay edad. Hagamos que en poco tiempo pueda concretar sus deseos con nuestro apoyo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY EVERYDAY ITEMS WHICH SHE SELLS FROM HER STAND.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and fabrics to resell

loans.name: Vanna
