texts.en: Mrs. P. Vanna, 41, and her husband have been married since1992. They have four sons. All of their sons are studying in a local school. Vanna and her family live along National Road number Two about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She and her husband are in the business of fishing and doing farming. Vanna is selling fish in the village. She started selling in 2001. Her husband grows peanuts and does fishing for her selling. Vanna has borrowed money from Maxima many times. Now she is requesting loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase a cow and peanut seeds for her farming business.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and growing peanuts

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 38 year old married man. He lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Hani owns a bakery where he makes what is called a 'mankouche',  a kind of bread on which you put thyme, or cheese etc. Hani works with his wife and needs a loan to buy flour for his business.

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Lucrecia Nury

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucrecia is a single mother and lives with her 2 children in Villa Reconcilliacion. She has more than 25 years of experience in the sale of clothing, shoes, and small appliances and also has the ability to sew clothing. Before starting her business she used to sew for a living and her customers convinced her to start selling general merchandise. This activity enabled her to increase her income and thus feed her two children since she is the head of the household and her sewing did not sufficiently cover the expenses of her home.

She started her sales business with financing. She sells the small appliances on order and does not have any inventory of them. In the future she plans to improve her living conditions and count with a better infrastructure, her house is in need of improvements. For these improvements she is requesting the loan, funds to start building the front part of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Lucrecia es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en Villa Reconciliación, posee mas lleva 25 años de experiencia en ventas de ropa, zapatos, electrodoméstico, además posee otras habilidades como coser ropa, antes de emprender su negocio se dedicaba a elaborar prendas de vestir y fueron sus clientas la que la impulsaron a que vendieran mercadería en general, ya que con esa actividad le generaría mayores ingresos con los cuales pudiese alimentar a sus 2 hijos, siendo ella el pilar de su casa debía de mantener todos los gastos y la costura no le era suficientes.

Es con un financiamiento que empieza a vender los productos que hoy en día comercializa. En existencia no cuenta con electrodomésticos ya que solo los vende por encargo. En un futuro la señora desea mejorar su nivel de vida y tener una vivienda con una mejor infraestructura, ya que la vivienda requiere de una mejora, por lo cual solicita un préstamo para iniciar a construir el frente de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase metal, cement, cinder blocks for the improvement of her house.

loans.name: Adjovi Fissétou

texts.fr:
Adjovi Fissétou T. was born on April 13, 1964 in Atakpamé, the seat of the Plateaux region of Togo. (The city is located 160 km from Lomé).  She is married and the mother of five.  She lives with her husband, who is a warrant officer.  Her business is in selling carpeting in bulk at the Autonomous Port of Lomé, a business she has been practicing for over eight years.  Her first loan, in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA, enabled her to get well-established in the year 2000.  After a prompt repayment of her first loan, she cleared a profit that enabled her to help her husband with schooling costs for their children.  During this period of time when she receives many orders, she is again requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy 20 new-arrival carpets for increasing her inventory and to serve her customers better.  

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Adjovi Fissétou est née le 13 avril 1964 à Atakpamé, chef-lieu de la région des Plateaux au Togo (Ville située à 160km de Lomé). Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari qui est un Adjudant. Elle a pour activité, la vente de moquettes en gros au Port Autonome de Lomé, activité qu’elle exerce depuis plus de huit ans. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000FCFA lui a permis de bien s’installer en l’an 2000. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle a dégagé un bénéfice qui lui a permis d’aider son mari dans les dépenses scolaires de leurs enfants.
A cette période où elle reçoit beaucoup de demandes, Madame T. Adjovi Fissétou sollicite encore un emprunt d’un montant de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 20 moquettes d’un nouvel arrivage en vue d’augmenter son stock et de mieux servir ses clients

loans.use: To expand her display of carpets

loans.name: Janeth's Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 27 years old and is married woman with one child, aged three. Janeth is a soft drinks seller, a business she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more drinks (soda, juice and water) for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Samiu, who has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her business.

loans.name: Toshpi

texts.en:
D. Toshpi is 47 years old and married with one son. For more than 10 years Toshpi has been selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, apples, strawberries, and raspberries. Her son helps with the business. She begins her workday very early, buying produce from the local farmers and then selling it in the market. Her attractive prices and friendly nature have allowed Toshpi’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

It is now the selling season and she is planning to purchase a wider variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. Toshpi is therefore requesting a $450 loan for the term of 4 months. She and her family are counting on your help, and thank you for your support.

loans.use: To Increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru:
Rajabmo S. is a housewife and raises livestock. She has a cow whose milk she sells to neighbors. This brings in profits that are necessary for her family. Rajabmo has the opportunity to increase her profits by taking out a loan. This will allow her to purchase another cow. The additional milk from the cow will increase her profits and will help to provide for Rajabmo’s family which has 10 children. Rajabmo plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Раджабмо домохозяйка , занимается животноводством . Содержит корову , молоко которой продает соседям. Это приносит доход , который так необходим для ее семьи. Но есть возможность увеличить прибыль путем получения кредита. После чего она сможет купить еще одну дойную корову . Получение дополнительного молоко, увеличит прибыль и поможет обеспечить семью которая состоит из 10 детей. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is 43 years old and he is married. His wife, Natividad, is a very hardworking and understanding woman. Together, hand in hand, they sustain their household and pay for the education of their children.

Victor works in public transportation. Where he lives the three-wheeler light vans are often used for public transportation and that is why he decided to buy one and become a driver. Time has passed by and Victor would like to try other activities, one day he would like to open a small workshop to repair motorcycles.

He now requests a loan to buy another three-wheeler light van to provide work to a young man who works with him as a driver and he will keep on driving the three-wheeler he already owns. Victor wants to ask you to trust in him, he believes that he is a hard working and honest person. He gives his word that he will pay back the money within the agreed loan term.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor tiene 43 años, es casado, su esposa, Natividad es una mujer muy compresiva y trabajadora con la que mano a mano y diariamente soportan la educación de sus hijos y el sustento de su hogar.

El trabajo de Víctor es el transporte de pasajeros, en la zona donde él vive es muy usado el motocarro para el traslado urbano, y él optó por comprarse uno y ser él mismo el chofer. Ha pasado el tiempo y Víctor quiere optar por otras actividades a la par del transporte, él desea poner un pequeño puesto de venta de repuestos para moto.

Él solicita un préstamo para adquirir otro motocarro, y darle trabajo a un muchacho trabajador como chofer, mientras él sigue manejando el otro motocarro. Víctor quiere pedirles que confíen en él, ya que él considera que es una persona trabajadora y honrada, da su palabra de devolver el dinero en el plazo mencionado.

loans.use: To buy another three-wheeler light van to provide work to a young man who works with him as a driver

loans.name: Glenny Sandra

texts.es:
Glenny is 20 and lives alone in the house that her parents left her. Glenny is very eager to support herself and be an independent young woman and to that end she started selling clothing a year ago. She works all week, in the morning and afternoon, as well as on weekends at the various markets in Juliaca. Being on her own is hard for Glenny since she was used to living with her family and not having to worry about supporting herself. However, Glenny enjoys her work because it brings her a sense of freedom and independence. Glenny wants to do well with her business in order to support herself, and in the future, raise a family and give them a comfortable life. With the money from the loan, Glenny will be able to purchase more clothing and increase her sales. Also, in the future she will be able to rent a stand in a store to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Glenny tiene 20 años vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. En su afán de mantenerse por sí misma y ser una joven independiente, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año, esta venta la realiza durante toda la semana por las mañanas y las tardes; los fines de semana en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca.Estar sola es muy difícil para Glenny ya que estuvo acostumbrada a vivir con su familia, y no preocuparse por su manutención, pero a Glenny le gusta su trabajo por que la hace sentirse libre e independizada. Glenny quiere prosperar en su negocio para auto mantenerse y formar una familia en el futuro a la cual pueda brindarle una vida confortable. Con el dinero que se facilite, Glenny podrá comprar más ropa e incrementar sus ventas, para en un futuro alquilar un stand en alguna tienda comercial y ofrecer su mercadería.

loans.use: Increase amount of merchandise (clothing) and rent a stand in the future.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La Sra. Gricelda es madre soltera y tiene dos niños de edad escolar ella nos esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de uniformes y útiles escolares  ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero. 
Gricelda trabaja en una farmacia en el aria de cajera esté es su ingreso familiar ella renta un cuarto para vive ella y sus dos niños cuando se va a trabajar una vecina le cuida niños. 
La Sra. Gricelda nos está solicitando $300.00 dlls para la compra de uniformes t útiles escolares para su hijos  para que no pierda el años escalar.
texts.en:
Gricelda is a single mother who has two school-age children. She is requesting a loan from us in order to purchase uniforms and school supplies since, at this time, she does not have enough money.

Gricelda works in a pharmacy as a cashier. This is her family income. She rents a room, in which she and her children live. When she goes to work, a neighbor takes care of her kids.

Gricelda is requesting $300 to purchase uniforms and school supplies so that her children do not lose out on their school years.


Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio inició el negocio, ya que había oportunidad de crecer económicamente en este giro y tener que generar buenos ingresos para mantener a su familia. Comenzó su negocio hace 10 años con una camioneta vieja, vendiendo frutas y verduras en pocas colonias, después fue progresando y cambio de camioneta, poco a poco fue progresando y ahora tienen un local donde establecer su negocio sin dejar de visitar las colonias.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local donde se va a poner de fijo con empleada seguir en su camioneta.
texts.en:
Ignacio started this business because it was a good opportunity to grow financially and to improve his family´s living standards. He started 10 years ago, selling fruits and vegetables out of an old truck to customers in surrounding areas. Slowly, he was able to purchase a better vehicle and secure a location where he could still sell his products and visit his customers. He needs a loan in the amount of US$500, which will be paid back within 6 months, to remodel his business location, hire a permanent employee and continue driving to his clients' neighborhoods.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel business location

loans.name: Elizabeth Manuela

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Elizabeth es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Elizabeth vende gelatinas y canchas, que ella misma prepara con la ayuda de sus hijos, algunas de las canchas los compra de los mayoristas, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente en una calle concurrida de la ciudad, en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias de la región donde también vende los mismos productos.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gelatina, aceite, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank, "Las Gaviotas." She is married, is 47-years-old, and has 6 children. Elizabeth sells gelatin and toasted corn, which she herself prepares with the help of her children. She buys some of the corn from wholesalers. She makes her sales as a street vendor on a crowded street in the city. Sometimes she has the opportunity to travel to markets in the region where she also sells the same products. Elizabeth needs a loan of 400 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of gelatin, oil, and sugar. Elizabeth's dreams are to buy a car to transport her products and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 400 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of gelatin, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima tiene 27 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en mecánica por  cuenta propia, el negocio de doña Fátima es la venta de fritanga toda la semana por las tardes, empezó hace ocho años, lo mas difícil fue hacer la clientela, la experiencia en la elaboración y servicio al cliente lo aprendió de su mama ya que ella también vendía comida para subsistir con la familia, con la solicitud de crédito va invertir en materia prima, para comprar mas productos para la venta de fritanga y así poder ofertar mas sus ricos platillos a sus clientes, a largo `plazo es poder acondicionar el local donde vende, y poder crecer cada día mas para obtener mejores resultados, uno de sus mas anhelado sueños es poder tener su casa propia ya que actualmente habita donde sus suegros.
texts.en:
Fátima is 27 years old and lives in a neighbourhood called Sabana Grande in the capital of Managua. She has a five-year old son and her husband is self-employed as a mechanic. Fátima sells fried foods weekday evenings. She started her business eight years ago. The most difficult was building a clientele, gaining experience with food preparation and customer service, which she learnt from her Mom since she also sold food to support her family. She will invest the loan in raw materials, to buy more products for frying and thus offer more of her delicious dishes to her clients. Her long-term goal is to install an air conditioner where she sell, and to be able to grow her business every day to get better results. One of her most cherished dreams is to have her own house as she is currently living with her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her fried dishes

loans.name: Zully Vanessa

texts.es:
La señorita Zully es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y madre de un hijo menor de edad. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró  abarrotes para su bodega. Tiene casi 3 años y medio trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su negocio ha crecido desde que está trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y productos navideños para vender en su bodega.
Zully desea continuar trabajando para hacer crecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Miss Zully is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiñay” in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 21 years old, single and mother of a young son. With her first loan of (about) $100 she purchased general goods for her store. She has worked for about 3 and a half years with the Communal Bank and tells us that her business has grown since working with the bank. With this loan of $500, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase dessert bread and Christmas products to sell in her general store. Zully hopes to continue working toward making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dessert bread and Christmas items

loans.name: Leti Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Ventilla,  comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y esta al cuidado de un hijo, asimismo posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaría).
Trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio es la Artesanías (tejido a punto); su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para acopiar quesos y comercializarlos en los mercados de Puno.
En la actualidad ella piensa mejorar su otro negocio de quesos, y quiere llevar este producto a otros mercados (Cusco y Arequipa), por ello viene solicitando  S/. 800.00 nuevos soles para poder comprar moldes de quesos, galoneras, bidones y prensas; así como también piensa invertir en asistencia técnica para poder elaborar sus quesos con mayor calidad; de esta manera piensa obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar así como la educación de sus hijos; ella menciona que se debe promocionar la asistencia técnica a las mujeres para poder obtener productos de mejor calidad, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the communal bank "Sacuyo" in the sector of Ventilla, in the Sacuyo community, Acora district, Puno Province, Puno Department (state). She is 26 years old and in the care of a child; she completed the fourth year of secondary school. She has worked for a year with the Manuela Ramos organization. She has a handicraft business. Her first loan was for 500 Nuevo Soles, to used for cheeses that she sold in the markets of Puno. Currently, she is thinking of improving her other cheese business, and would like to take this product to other markets (Cusco and Arequipa), which is why she is requesting 800 Nuevos Soles to be able to purchase cheese molds, galoneras, barrels and presses; she also is thinking of investing in technical assistance to be able to make her cheeses of a higher quality. This way she will be able to obtain a higher income and improve the quality of life in her household as well as the education of her children. She says that the technical assistance must be promoted to the women in the area to obtain products of a higher quality. She is committed to repaying her loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese molds, as well as technical assistance to improve the quality of her cheeses

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y trabajo”, vive en Jr. Triunfo Nº 401, Distrito D. Juanjui, departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 46 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad  y 2 que dependen aún D. ella. Es casada, su esposo esta muy delicado D. salud. Con el primer prestamo recibido D. S/ 300.00 deciD. invertir en su negocio D. sastrería. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en un lugar acondicionado D. su casa, oficio que le permite un ingreso diario propicio para el pago mensual D. las cuotas con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará telas en rollos  D. diferentes colores sobre todo para uniformes por que ya empieza la época D.  campaña escolar lo que quiere aprovechar al máximo.

Bertha esta contenta con lo logrado y agradece al banco por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha Luz belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva. She lives in Jr.Triumph Nº 401, District of Juanjui, department of San Martin. She is 46 years old and is a mother of four children, two of legal age, and two who still depend on her. She is married, although her husband is in delicate health. With the first loan of $300 that she received, she decided to invest in her business of tailoring. She has been working with the bank for for five years. At the present, she is continuing with her business, located near her house, in a favorable position which insures her daily income and the exact punctuality of her monthly repayment of her loans. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy fabrics in rolls of different colors for uniforms, because she wants to take advantage of back to school shopping. Bertha is content with what she has achieved and is thankful to the bank for the support that it offers hard-working women.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth in rolls of different colors to make uniforms for back to school shopping.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta F. is a farmer. She grows rice on her farm, the income from which she uses to feed and clothe her family. Her harvest is mainly intended for family use only. Sometimes, when she has plenty of harvest, she also sells rice to traders in their village. Her husband, Remegio F. is also a farmer. Together, they work hard to meet the needs of their children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. Her loan will definitely help her achieve a better yield. In that way, she will be able to give more support to her children.

CEVI helps Marieta run her farm business. Now, she is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase ammonium fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana P., 29, is married with two children. She sells food to the general public six days a week.

She has no previous loans with SPBD. Susana expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Susana’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase boxes of mutton flaps, boxes of drumstick, bunch of bananas, sack of taros.

loans.name: Hanson

texts.en:
Hanson B., 55, is the married father of seven children: five are out of school and independent and two are still pursuing education at the senior high school. He is a dealer of car spare parts and scraps. He buys his supplies from spare parts dealers and sells these in retail to his customers.

He enjoys his trade very much. However, he is handicapped by low working capital and is finding it difficult to succeed in the climate of general economic hardship. He therefore needs a loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy a new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make good income in order to expand his business.

Hanson is a member of the community group called the “Mawuli” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and as peer pressure to repay the loan.

Hanson is in the photo taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts and scraps.

loans.name: Teodor

texts.en: B. Teodor is a truck driver. He transports in his truck furniture from Romania. He has 3 children, two daughters and one boy who is the youngest. Teodor has only this job that he loves and with which he supports his family. He wants to change the truck's tires because they are pretty old and at the same time to fix some defects in the motor because he did not restore the engine a very long time ago. Teodor borrowed a loan from Microinvest of 30,000 Moldovan Leu to purchase new tires.

loans.use: New tires and engine maintenance

loans.name: Nazia Azeem Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji is married to A. A. and they have been living together in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, since past 11 years. She is a noble and a kind lady and the group leader of five other women. Her husband is an electrician and runs an electrical goods shop. He has three years of experience in this business. Nazia baji is applying for a loan to buy electric goods (wires, switch boards and switches) for their electrical goods shop.

Kiran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Sarafeen baji and Razia baji each want loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches and switch boards) for her electrical shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: The buffalo belongs to Sarafeen baji.

loans.use: To buy electrical good to sell

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: el sr. Margarito A. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, el tiene una tienda de abarroterias en su casa de habitacion, el se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio para atender a sus clientes, el vive con su esposa y su hija que tambien le ayudan con la atencion de los clientes, el esta muy contento ya que su negocio les genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y su familia, el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener muy surtido su negocio , en el futuro piensa construir para poder hace mas grande su local y asi poder montar un mercadito completo, su meta o sueño es poner una bodega o deposito.
texts.en:
Margarito A. sells popular consumer products. He has a grocery store in his house. He gets up very early to open his business to take care of his customers. He lives with his wife and daughter. They also help waiting on the customers. He is very happy with his business since it generates income to cover the home and family expenses. He needs a loan to buy more merchandise to have a very well stocked store. In the future he is thinking of building in order to make his location bigger. Then he could set up a complete market. His dream is to have a general store or warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy soft drinks, churros, glasses, plates, plastics, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, beans, shortening, oil, salt, tortillas,milk products, pastas, toilet paper, soaps, pencils

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 49 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 05 hijos (dos a su cargo), tiene estudios D. segundaria incompleta (3er Grado),  vive en el Barrio Vilcapaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. lubricantes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. lubricantes y así tener stock.

Su mayor deseo es poner un grifo (venta D. gasolina).

A ella le gusta el orden con que se maneja su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina belongs to the Flor Azangarina II (Flower of Azángaro, 2nd) Communal Bank which is located in the District and Province of Azángaro, Department of Puno. She is 49 years of age, in a civil marriage and is the mother of five children, two of whom are in her care. She has an incomplete secondary education and lives in the Vilcapaza neighborhood. She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years. Her first loan was for 500 New Sols which was used to buy lubricants. At this time, she needs a loan of 2,000 New Sols to buy lubricants for her inventory. Her greatest wish is to open a gas station. She likes orderly way her Communal Bank is managed.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lubricants.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La profesora María Magdalena está solicitando su 8vo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, ella requiere hacer un repello de la pared de su casa, es habitante de la colonia Naciones pero  labora en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea como docente los fines de semana y como bibliotecaria los dias de la semana, es  una mujer profesional con alto espitud de superación, ella tiene dos hijas mayores de edad las cuales estudian y trabajan las que se pagan sus gastos y sus estudios solas, su esposo trabaja en la finca que ellos poseen los cuales aporta con los gastos familiares,  es una mujer responsable en su labores y muy querida en su comunidad, su sueño  es de mejorar sus condiciones del hogar, para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida al nucleo familiar  y obtener mejor desarrollo en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is applying for a loan that she will use to improve her house. She needs to repair cracks in the walls of the house. She is a resident of the Naciones suburb, but she works as a teacher in the urban neighborhood of Nueva Guinea at weekends and as a librarian during the week. She is a professional woman with a strong drive to get ahead. She has two grown daughters who are in school and work to pay their own expenses and school fees. Her husband works on the farm that they own and that covers household expenses. Maria Magdalena is a responsible worker and much loved in her community. Her dream is to improve her home to provide a better place to live for her family and contribute to the development of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cracks in walls of house.

loans.name: Noe

texts.en:
Noe L. is a 44-year old farmer in Sto Nino, South Cotabato, Mindanao. He has one child and is doing his best to nurture him until he grows. In 1998, he started to farm. He has only one-hectare to till but this helps him to provide for the growing needs of his family.

He would like a loan of Php 8,000 to buy fertilizers and chemicals. Fertilizers and chemicals are vital in ensuring an abundant and quality harvest. He is hoping that his investments will have good returns in the future.

As he is managing his farm, he hopes and plans in the future to have a stable income so that he will no longer need to apply for a loan from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.es: Andrea se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado todos los días, y los días de mercado de donde es originaria de San Martín Jilotepeque, tiene un  comedor y en su casa tiene una venta de pollo, es una mujer emprendedora porque le gusta el comercio tiene su clientela ella prepara variedad de comidas, tiene 7 hijos casados la mas pequeña le ayuda a atender el negocio que es la venta de pollo porque esta ubicado en su casa le da gracias a Dios porque tiene ganancias lo que le ha servido para volver a invertirlo en su negocio a ella le gusta ser responsable en sus pagos, su sueño es tener una bonita casa y también ver su negocio con mas clientela y mas variedad de comidas
texts.en:
Andrea sells food every day in the market. "Market Days" is a concept that originated in San Martín Jilotepeque. She also operates a dining hall in her home where she sells chicken. This entrepreneur enjoys her business because she gets to prepare a variety of dishes for her customers.

Andrea is married and has 7 children. The youngest child tends to the business that sells chicken because it is located at home. She thanks God that she has income to reinvest into her business. She also likes being responsible with her payments.

Andrea dreams of having a beautiful home and seeing her businesses attract more clients and offer a greater variety of dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her food businesses

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura M. owns and manages a 2.5-hectare rice field. She has two children, with the eldest 18 years old. Her children keep her inspired to perform better in her business to provide a good future for the family. Aside from rice, the family also tills a 1.5-hectare cornfield that supplements their overall income. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance farm necessities and start another business. 

She said this is her fifth loan from CEVI and she wishes to use its services more in the future.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle G. is a rice farmer in Vereula Agusan del Sur. She is blessed with one child who is now five years old. Her husband is always supportive and hard-working and that helps her manage. Their small rice field which is 1 hectare in size, she hopes, can give her family enough income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to apply for loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities to obtain an abundant harvest.

She joined the CEVI micro credit program in April 2009. This is her second loan with CEVI because the interest rate is very low. She hopes to access more CEVI loans in the future.

loans.use: financing her little farm

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn L. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in the Siem Reap province. She sells rice noodle and makes about US$4 per day, while her husband is a farmer who typically make US$6 in revenue a day. He usually buys a stock of rice and yam and resells it to wholesaler at the market. Moeurn L. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase rice in bulk so he can has a special discount from seller. (Moeurn was not available so her husband is pictured instead)

loans.use: Buy and sell rice.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 54 years old and married to Leopoldo, a farmer.  They have six children: Sherwin, 30 years old is a farmer, Ceasar is 26 years old,  Bernalu is 29 years old is at college level, Margarita is 23 years old, Bernie is 21 years old and their youngest is Christian who is 13 years old.  They reside in Baranggay Sta. Cruz, Alicia, Isabela, a rural and plain area. Their house is near the irrigation area.

Leonila has been engaged in the vegetable vending business for almost ten years.  She now wants to make a loan of PHP20,000 from the KIVA lenders to sustain her business.  Aside from that, she also sells processed foods for additional income.

loans.use: Addtional Capital for her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Miss Socheat S., age 24, is single (not in the picture because she was busy with her work, but her mother is pictured instead), lives with her sister,  brothers and widowed mother in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.  
 
Socheat has been a garment factory worker for five years. Her mother stays at home. Socheat is applying for her first loan of $500 to help her sister purchase materials for her business selling Chinese noodles.

loans.use: To purchase materials for selling Chinese noodles

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Delapaz Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, widowed, and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Evelyn sells drinks and Nigerian cooked foods from her stall. She wakes up daily at 4:30 a.m. to start preparing her food for sale. She has been in this business for four years. Evelyn is a hard-working woman determined to lift her business and family out of poverty.

LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. As a LAPO client, Evelyn is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase additional drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia C. is from the village of San Andres. She is 61 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Amalia owns and operates a clothing business, providing general clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

Amalia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, es una mujer muy responsable y puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien posee un negocio independiente. Lastenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de venta de bebidas refrescantes.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2500 soles que utilizará en la compra de bebidas refrescantes como néctares, refrescos, gaseosas, yogurt, etc. La meta de Lastenia es seguir adelante en su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Lastenia is a very responsible and punctual woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is 44 years old, has two adult children, and sells refreshing beverages from her home. Her husband, who has his own business, supports her in her work. Lastenia has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for three years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used in her beverage business. She now needs 2500 soles that will be used to buy refreshing beverages like: fruit nectars, beverages, soft-drinks, yoghurt, etc. Lastenia's goal is to continue in her work and to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshing beverages like: fruit juices, soft-drinks, sodas, yoghurt, etc.

loans.name: Axiel De Fatima

texts.es:
La  señora Axiel M. C., Labora como Secretaria Ejecutiva en el área de docencia del Centro de Capacitación Nicaragüense.
 
 Ella  tiene  dos hijo a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, está casada, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita y este ultimo para gastos de colegio, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en los gastos de colegio para su hijo.
texts.en:
Ms. Axiel M. C. is an executive secretary at CECNA, the Nicaraguan-German Professional Training Center. She is married and has a son under her care, who is still of school age. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL in four years. She invested the first three loans in home improvement and the last one was used to pay for school expenses. She is thankful for loans granted by CEPRODEL. She will use the requested funds to pay for her son's school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school costs.

loans.name: Julia Njeri

texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old and the mother of two sons. Her husband, Francis, is a pastor in one of the local churches. They live in Zambezi on the outskirts of Nairobi town. She operates her tailoring business from within and most of her customers are fellow villagers and the people who attend church together.

Julia opened this business in the year 2008 and, since then, she has been able to establish a network of customers. This has enabled her to have a steady income for her family. She has not borrowed elsewhere and this is her first loan with KADET. She was introduced to KADET by her friends who formed a group then joined KADET.

Julia plans to invest in her business by buying a sewing machine which will cost 26,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) and some material for 4,000 Kshs, so that she can meet her customer's needs and also increase her family's income.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and some material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soy

loans.name: Nyakabungo Tukwatanise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
T. Mariah, at the top right also appears in the group photo and she is a 43-year-old married woman, is a teacher with five children of her own and one dependent.

Mariah has been  a teacher at Ibanda Bright School for twenty years and earns one hundred thousand shillings a month while teaching. She attributes her long track record to her trustworthy nature.

On the face of it, Mariah seems reserved but actually is very friendly and she says that she needs this loan to be able to pay her children’s school fees.

Mariah intends to go for an upgrade course in education, at one of Uganda’s leading universities in the near future. She, in the event that this should come to pass, envisions a bright future for her family and herself.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia's husband works in a woodcrafts workshop where wooden crosses and statues are being produced as well as mosaic ornamentation and wooden statues for churches and tourists. 

Four years ago, she and her husband started doing the same work in their house, preparing to start their own business. They both have three children whose expenses are growing as they grow up. Therefore, they decided that it's time to start their business and rent a workshop place.

Nadia took a loan from FATEN that they needed, in addition to their savings, to pay the first month's rent and buy raw material to start working in their own workshop. She hopes to have good returns as her husband is known in the area for his unique, professional and beautiful work.

Nadia is the one in the picture above at FATEN's office.

loans.use: To rent a workshop and buy materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia B. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Lydia is single. To make a living, Lydia operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beauty products, such as cosmetics from Avon. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Klubo M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Good Friends'.  She is 45 years old, married, and has four children who range from 11 to 23 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 11th grade.

For 10 years, Klubo has been selling cooking oil and pork at the Old Road Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia.  She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  She started this business with the help of a friend; lack of sufficient working capital to buy more goods is her major challenge. 

Klubo plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cooking oil and pork.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Klubo is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and pork.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a hardworking and focused 41-year old mother of three children between the ages of 15 and 9 years, all of whom attend school. She is married to a government employee and desires to educate her children to university level.

Zipporah owns a posho mill and sells flour, maize, beans, muthokoi (ground maize) and other food products. She also sells charcoal, operates a tailoring shop and rears chickens. Zipporah employs one person and sells her products to her neighbours. A member of Key Venture Self Help Group, whose members have guaranteed her loan request of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu Kenya, she will use the funds to add more chicks.

loans.use: To add more chicks

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 23 years old and married. He is a farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale town. He has been farming for 7 years and sells his maize, milk, beans and vegetables to the local market. He also operates a mini shop in the same area.

His biggest challenge in farming is marketing and poultry diseases which are common in the area.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.25,000 to expand his poultry project. He will use this loan to stock up chickens. He says that if he is able to stock enough poultry, he will take advantage of the numbers and find a better market, which will enable him to get enough profits, hence he will be able to meet the family basic needs.

In 5 years' time, he hopes to have expanded in terms of market coverage and also diversify his products and start keeping broilers as well.

He is hopeful that he will be taking more loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica D. is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Veronica is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Veronica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael M. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 49 years old and is married with eight adult children. Rafael owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rafael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rafael is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel T. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Maribel joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Jose de 32 años de edad, nacio en Chuquissaca el 12 de noviembre de 1978, casado con la Sra. Elodia de 31 años de edad con un hijo que vive en la localidad de las Liras a 25 Km de El Torno hacia el oeste. La suerte para el que el sindicato agrario le doto de 12 hectareas, en la cual vive y trabaja sembrando maiz, yuca,arroz, mani y todo lo que cosecha lo vende en el mercado de El Torno, y el dinero solicitado es para la compra de una motocicleta para que el señor se pueda movilizar ya que son distancias largas que el recorre y la compra de este medio de transporte le ayudara mucho, es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.           .
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 32 years old. He was born in Chuquissaca on the 12 of November, 1978. He is married to Ms. Elodia who is 31 years old. They live in the town of Liras which is 25 km from El Torno, towards the west. He was fortunate that the agrarian syndicate endowed him with 12 hectares, where he lives and works raising corn, yucca, rice, and peanuts. All their harvest is sold in the market in El Torno. The money he is asking for is to buy a motorcycle so that he will be able to travel the long distances that he needs to. Buying this mode of transportation will help a lot. It is hard work and he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence and support provided to him in authorizing the loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Reurn Thy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people make up this village bank loan and they have selected Mrs. Reurn T. as a village bank president. She is 54 years old. Each group member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. The group is located in Pris Kraom village in TaK. province. Mrs. Reurn T. is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice that she sells in order to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Pon Vet, is a village chief. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Reurn T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a healer, while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ester Rosaura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ester Rosaura; ella tiene 28  años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio venta de fruta en el Centro Comercial de Confraternidad, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m mediante este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos y les puede dar una educación, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar variedad de fruta como manzanas, naranjas, uvas y papayas. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Ester Rosaura, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Ester Rosaura is 28 years old, she is a single mother and has two children. On top of everyday chores, she runs a fruits and vegetable shop in the collective shopping center, working there form 8 am to 6 pm. Thanks to this job she provides for her children and is able to pay for their education. She wants to improve her activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fruit such as apples, oranges, grapes and papayas. She is thankful to those who will help making her dream come true through this loan, and she commits to comply with repaying her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, oranges, grapes and papayas to sell.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa E. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Flordelisa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordelisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Flordelisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Flordelisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Flordelisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Flordelisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Flordelisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Gangamala Group

texts.en:
B. M., a married man in his early seventies with 10 children, runs a small business selling fried fish on the street in his home village. He has been doing this for the past four years, between 6 a.m. and 2 p.m. daily, earning him a low monthly profit.

This will be B.'s first Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. With this loan, B. will buy more fish at the markets in the morning and thereby increase his sales. B. will share the loan with his loan group Gangamala, which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, B. is standing in the middle of the back row, wearing a striped shirt.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn M. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old. Edelyn is married. To make a living, Edelyn owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells snacks, soft drinks and other kinds of products.

Edelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Edelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sharol's Group

texts.en:
Sharol D. C. lives in the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old and leads a seven-person loan group. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sharol is married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by making and selling food, largely at the campus of a nearby school. She has been in this line of work for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Sharol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid six previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 12,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies and items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso M. is from the village of Burgos. He is 61 years old. Alfonso is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Alfonso owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Alfonso has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alfonso joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfonso has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Alfonso is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Alfonso from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie C. is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu st., Poblacion, Madredijos, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: general store, buying and selling chicken, and dried fish.  Her husband, Lopito C., who is 60 years old, works as a driver/mechanic to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are between 19 and 36 years old. Norie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to save up for the future for her business operations. Norie C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr: Uldarico; el tiene 62 años. La socia es casado  y tiene 7 hijos  el socio se dedica a la confección de disfraces para toda ocasión, cojines para sillones,  fundas de cama y otros, el socio realiza estas,  tareas en sus ratos libres el trabaja en la telefónica, el socio está a punto de jubilarse y luego se dedicará a trabajar íntegramente en su negocio casero, el ahora desea el préstamo para comprar telas, cintas y realizar algunos Santa Claus para la venta en esta época y de este modo tener un ingreso extra. El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar Santa Claus  y aprovechar las fiestas navideñas.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Qorichuspa" communal bank, a group that is located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Uldarico, who is 62 years old.  He is married and has seven children.  He sews costumes for every occasion, as well as seat cushions, bed covers, and other items.  He makes these in his spare time, as he also works in the telephone business.  He is on the verge of retiring and then he will fully dedicate himself to his home business.

At the moment, he would like a loan to buy fabric and ribbon to make Santa Claus costumes, in order to bring in some extra income in this season.  He is requesting this loan to capitalize on the Christmas celebrations by making Santa Claus costumes.

Mr. Uldarico is happy to receive this loan and he promises to comply with his repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to sew Santa Claus costumes and take advantage of the Christmas season to bring in some extra income

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and the only provider for his family and parents who live with him.

Mohamad decided to open his own business so he opened a barber shop in 2004. He is well known in his local community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,700 loan to renovate his shop, buy a small generator and install an aluminum closet. He is aiming to increase his revenues and expand his business.

loans.use: To renovate his shop, buy a small generator and install an aluminum closet

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana G. esta agradecida por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos con los cuales su negocio ha crecido en inventario. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta mercancía a su negocio de ropa de verano, y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que se requiere, no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso para ella y sus hijos.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de sus ventas del negocio. 
Espera contar  con su cooperación en este crédito.
texts.en: Adriana G. is grateful for your cooperation with her previous loans which have helped her to increase her business inventory.  She is requesting a new loan since she is lacking merchandise for her business which is selling summer clothes.  Right now, she doesn't have the money she needs to make the necessary investment.  She does not want to undercapitalize her business since it is a source of income for herself and her children.  She plans to pay back her loan with the profits that she makes from her sales.  She hopes that she can rely on your cooperation with this loan.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn R., 38, is a local farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Lorn R. can earn about $1.75 per day. Her husband is a 38-year-old farmer who also assists her in the farming business, making an average profit of $1.75 also. They have four single children; three of whom are still studying in the local school while the other one works with her aunt as a mobile phone seller in the Poiy Pet City. Lorn R. is applying for a loan to hire a machine to plow farmland and to pay for harvest costs of previously hired domestic laborers.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow farmland and to pay for harvest costs (hired, domestic laborers).

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité está conformado por 15 señoras dispuestas a progresar, decidieron participar del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  mujeres humildes y muy trabajadoras, formando asi un  equipo de trabajo donde la responsabilidad es solidaria.
Ellas son independientes en sus labores como la venta de comidas, tienen despensa, venta de frutas y verduras.
Las mismas recibiran créditos  que invertirán en compra de azúcar, carne, harina, huevo, fideo, golosina, queso, etc.
Desean un progreso personal y familiar con este préstamo otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya.
La sra. Maria Luisa es una persona muy trabajadora, que posee desde hace varios años una despensa en su casa, para proveer de todos los alimentos a sus vecinos, pero desea variar más sus productos, por eso necesita del crédito.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of 15 women who are ready to progress.  They decided to participate in the Women Entrepreneurs Communal Bank program.  They are very humble and hard-working women.  They make up a work team with joint responsibility.

They are independent in their work such as selling food, having a grocery store, and selling fruits and vegetables.  They will use the loans they receive to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, sweets, and cheese, etc.

They want to make personal and familial progress with this loan that was granted by the Fundación Paraguaya.

Maria Luisa is a very hard-working person who has had a grocery store in her house for several years.  She does this to provide her neighbors with all of the food they need.  However, she wants to have a greater variety of products, which is why she needs the loan.

loans.use: To buy drinks, flour, vegetables, natural remedies, and fruit, etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia A. is married and has six children. She has completed her senior high school education. For the past 20 years, Emelia has been selling general provisions at Effiakuma Estate, which is near Takoradi.

Emelia’s income helps pay for household expenses. Emelia plans to expand her business and will use her loan to purchase additional goods for sale. She will save the additional profits she earns.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Francia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 2 & 3. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children in a safe environment. She has been able to improve their environment after being in business and providing what her spouse can´t, such as a better standard of living, better home structure, clothing and many other small changes. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy dancing.

Francia buys and sells new and used clothing, this has been her business for over 3 and a half years, which she started with some money she received from previous employment. She is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loan and grown her business. 

She plans to use this loan to invest further in her business. She will use the profits to increase her sales and to make her business grow, while she is saving to make one of her dreams come true (to become a lawyer), and others like to have a store and to guide her children into professional lives.

Her group is part of a biggest group formed in her rural community for them to do business and take big changes into her neighborhood, located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry.

The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Pictures were taken during the disbursal process in a meeting in one of the associate's home. That why we decided to take the photos while they were sitting.

loans.use: to buy different apparel for resale

loans.name: Maria Eleuteria

texts.es: Doña Eleuteria vive en Tres Estrellas, en una comunidad indigena donde la mayoria de la gente es ganadera se dedica a criar y engordar animales, tambien en esta comunidad se ve mucho que los hombres emigren al extranjero a Estados Unidos en busca de un trabajo y poder mandar dinero a su familia, Doña Eleuteria nos platica que su prestamo lo pidio para poder comprar la mercancia que le hace falta; Ella nos dice " Me hace falta Huevo, pan, leche, sal, azucar, cajas de dulces, refrescos, quiero comprar un poco de todo para que la tienda tenga toda la mercancia, una dificultad en mi negocio siguen siendo las ventas, no siempre se vende como uno quiere, pero aun asi voy saliendo adelante, la mercancia la compro en un pueblo cercano para no salir tan lejos, con el prestamo voy a invertir y mi intención es sacar ganancias para poder pagar el credito y tambien que quede algo para mi, tengo la meta de salir adelante con el negocio ya que no hay de otra con la ayuda de prestamo como estos, tengo 52 años de edad, soy casada ya cumpli 30 años de estar viviendo con mi esposo, solamente un hijo depende de mi, estudia, en total tengo 7 hijos, vivo en casa propia y mi esposo trabaja como albañil.
texts.en:
Doña Eleuteria lives in “Tres Estrellas” (Three Stars), an indigenous community where most of the people engage in raising and fattening livestock. Several men from this community have migrated to the United States in search of work so that they can send money back to their families.

Doña Eluteria says she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise that she is lacking. She states, “I need eggs, bread, milk, salt, sugar, boxes of candy, and soft drinks. I want to buy a little bit of everything so that my store will be stocked with all types of merchandise.” One difficulty she faces with her business is that her sales are not always at the level that she wants, but she continues to press forward. She acquires her merchandise from a nearby town so that she does not have to travel far. With this loan, she plans to invest with the intention of earning enough to repay the loan and also have something left over for herself. Her goal is to succeed with her business since she receives no other assistance besides the loans.

Eluteria is 52 years old and has been married to her husband for thirty years. She has a total of seven children, but only one is a dependent who is in school. Her husband works as a mason and they live in their own home.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M., 57, is a resident of Malaria, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Lorenzo, a jeepney driver. She is the mother of five children; two are working, one is in high school, and the others have settled with their own families. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is the dream for most Filipino parents like Emma, as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
