Emma operates an auto-repair shop, offering repairs, check-ups and beautification of all types of cars and jeepneys - any type of vehicle that is referred to them. They also have a little refreshment stand in their auto-repair shop, where they sell beverages to the waiting customers and passing passenger vehicles. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Emma is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy new machines and other materials needed for auto repairs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emma dreams of expanding her business and enjoying a good and healthy life together with her family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new machines and other materials needed for auto repairs

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul T. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and two daughters. The youngest daughter studies at university and the other children are married. In order to meet the family needs, Aigul and her husband breed livestock animals. They resell some animals at a higher price after fattening. In this way, they earn 5,600 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Aigul wants to purchase a TV in order to improve their living conditions. In the future, she dreams of building a house in Bishkek for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a television

loans.name: Marcelino Group

texts.es:
el grupo Marcelino esta integrago por tres mujeres que son vecinas y muy amigas, decidieron formar este grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las actividades de cada una de ellas:
la joven  Wendy se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, es madre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela, tiene dicho negocio desde hace mas 5 años. cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. sus tiempos libres los deica a visitar la iglesia. 
la sra. Maria Eufemia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de 
habitacion, Maria se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para hacer sus ricas tortillas.
La sra. Maria Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace 4 años. Maria Juana es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de ropa, leña, cal, maiz, frijoles, arroz, azucar, manteca, aceite, margarina, papel higienico, cafe, pan, galletas, salsas, pastas, sal, churros, refrescos, jugos.
las ganancias las necesitan para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Marcelino group consists of three women who are neighbors and close friends.  They decided to start this group to get ahead in their businesses and with their families.  Here are their activities:

Wendy sells products for everyday use; she runs a store from her home.  She has 4 children, who are in school.  She has been trading for more than 5 years, and can count on her husband's support.  In her spare time, she goes to church.

Maria Eufemia makes and sells tortillas from her home.  She wakes up at 4 am every day to make her delicious tortillas.  

Maria Juana has been selling American-style clothes for the last 4 years. She is a single mother and has 3 children.  

The loan will be used to buy clothing, firewood, lime, corn, rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, toilet paper, coffee, bread, biscuits, sauces, pasta, salt, churros, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.use: to buy clothing, firewood, lime, corn, rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, toilet paper, coffee, bread, biscuits, sauces, pasta, salt, churros, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Janeth Magaly

texts.es:
Janeth Magaly tiene 40 años, vive en union libre con el compañero y con dos hijos de dos año y el otro de 10 meses vive  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Janeth se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajndo para el futuro de los hijos.

Los momentos de libres se dedica a pasar con su compañero y con los hijos.
texts.en:
Janeth Magaly, 40, has a spouse and two children.  One of them is 2 years old and the other is 10 months old.  She lives in Ventanas Canton, De Los Ríos Province.

The “El Recreo” communal bank is located in Ventanas Canton in the San Vicente de las Lomas hamlet.  The members are dedicated to short cycle corn, rice, beans and soybean farming.

Janeth farms corn, rice and soybeans on her parents’ land.  Her purchases are made in Ventanas and sales are at daily markets especially Sunday’s.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are competition and weather variations.  Her dream is to continue working for her children’s future.

During her free time she enjoys going on excursions with her spouse and children.
.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Samaito

texts.en:
Samaito is single and is living with his parents. He has been planting maize and beans and sells during harvest time. He’s been in this line of work for several years, having learned it from his father. 

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and he is applying for his 3rd loan in order to buy farm supplies like manure, insecticide and fertilizer. 

His goal is to help his parents, contribute to his family’s development and forge his future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 47 years old married man and the father of four children.  For the past five years, he has been working at a grocery store.  Fawaz is well-known in his region and is liked by most of his customers because he has good taste, chooses the best quality products and he also provides perfect customer service.

Fawaz is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-KIVA partner to buy summer commodities (ice cream, juice, other items) and to help his son in his house construction.  Fawaz is a special father who works hard for the sake of his children, in order to provide everything they need.

In the future, Fawaz hopes to expand his business in order to fulfill his customer needs.

loans.use: To buy summer commodities

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Jalia has a beauty salon business that sells body lotions and braids for the hair. She has run this business for six years.
To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids and body lotions for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Jalia hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase braids and body lotions for resale.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Sullana que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Olga  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y caprino (cabras) desde hace unos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un buen precio a sus clientes.  Olga es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el finalidad que en un futuro pueda brindarles mejores estudios superiores a sus hijos principalmente.
texts.en:
Olga is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. They do not receive basic services. Olga resides in the District of Sullana, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Olga has been raising and selling sheep and goats for a few years. The animals are kept in an area behind her house and are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, Olga sells them at different markets. She has her own customers in the city of Piura and the income she earns is used to cover her daily household necessities.

Olga is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy feed for her animals. This will allow them to have a good diet so that they can be sold at a good price to her customers. Olga is a person who is well-known in the area where she lives because she is always concerned about her family’s welfare. Her primary goal for the future is to provide her children with the best in higher education.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 39ans d’âge, célibataire et mère de  4 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 10 et 26 ans est devenue vendeuse de poison salé au marché a l’arrêt de ses études secondaires.
Son expérience pour les 3 crédits  passés lui a permis de prendre  conscience de ce qui concerne les épargnes, elle a des recettes de 50.000 a 100.000F par jour.
 Elle  rentre dans le cycle 4 et va  bénéficié d’un prêt plus important, pour cela elle va acheter 10 cartons de poisson salé importé (thon, morue, soles, requin, cancre)  et  5 cartons de poisson de mer bars a Pointe Noire  qu'elle va pour séché le poisson sur place. 
 Entreprenante,  souriante et accueillante, elle a une seule ambition, celle d’avoir une baraque de vente de poisson salé en gros.
C’est une mère responsable et très célèbre auprès de ses clients au marche
texts.en:
This client is a young 39-year-old woman. She is a single mother with 4 children aged between 10 and 26 who became a market trader of salted fish when her high school studies ended.
Thanks to the experience gained during her 3 previous loans, she has learned how to manage her savings. Her daily revenues are between 50,000 and 100,000XAF.
She is now in her 4th loan cycle and will benefit from a larger loan that will enable her to buy 10 boxes of imported salted fish (tuna, cod, sole, shark and crab) and 5 boxes of sea bass from the coastal town of Pointe Noire so that she can dry fish at home.
An enterprising, cheerful and welcoming individual, she has only one ambition: to have a stall where she can sell salted fish wholesale.
She is a responsible mother who is very well-known among her customers at the market.

loans.use: To buy boxes of salted fish: Tuna, sole, cod, shark and crab

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
With her determination to help her husband in providing a quality life for their children, Herminia looks for a source of income so that she can help her husband. Now, she is managing her sari-sari store business. She mostly sells canned goods, cooking oil and drinks. Herminia has been in this type of business for over one year.

Herminia is 52 years old and has three children. She is sending two children to school and one is working abroad. Herminia can rely only on her income from her business and the remittance from her child abroad. She doesn’t like to rely, all the time, on her child. Hence, she wants to expand her business. 

Herminia is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy additional goods to sell in their village like breads, coffee, sugar, milk and snack foods. Her goal is to maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in their village like breads, coffee, sugar, milk and snack foods.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a 28 year old married lady. Mesaid sells kangas and clothes in Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This is her third loan in KADET. With this loan she plans to add more bales of cloth and kangas. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: Add more bales of cloth and kangas

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 63 años, es socia del FINCA Peru desde hace mas de 13 años.
Justina tiene una tienda en su propia casa, con mucho esfuerzo pudo hacer surgir esta tienda con la ayuda de los préstamos recibidos, gracias a ello pudo terminar de construir su casa y educar a sus hijos, las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le ayudaron a poder formar su negocio y ser mas responsable y constante, pudo comprarse un carro y construir parte de su casa que ahora alquila, recuerda que su primer crédito lo utilizo para poder comprar azúcar y arroz pero poquito, ahora su tienda ha mejorado mucho. el préstamo que recibirá lo utilizará para construir otra parte de su casa y poder alquilar.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 63 years old, and has been working with FINCA Peru for more than 13 years.

She has a store in her own house, and through her efforts her store has grown. The loans helped her finish the construction of her house and to educate her children. The training she received through the communal bank helped her to start her business, and to be responsible and reliable. She was able to buy a car and construct part of her house which she now rents. She remembers that her first loan enabled her to buy a little bit of sugar and rice. Now her store has greatly improved. 

The loan she is now asking for will be used to build an addition to her house to be used for rental.

loans.use: to purchase materials to be used for an addition to her house

loans.name: Katooke Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
James is a Ugandan man, age 49, who needs a loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale. A retail shop owner, he hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of seven children. 

He has had this business for eight years. He started as a farmer, growing Irish potatoes. He saved money and set up the shop. 

He dreams of growing his business to a wholesale business and educating his children.

He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mowa-Nou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MOWA-NOU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Léocadie Léonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Léocadie Léonie est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un photographe nommé Vincent. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leurs charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Léocadie Léonie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Léocadie Léonie exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture qu’elle prépare à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Léocadie Léonie vend des boissons. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Léocadie Léonie désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Léocadie Léonie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MOWA-NOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MOWA-NOU group is made up of three people who live in the same district in Bénin.  The representative of this group, named Léocadie Léonie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  This is the first time that this group has requested financial assistance from ALIDé in order to build up their businesses.  
Léocadie Léonie is 45 years old and married to a photographer named Vincent.  The couple has six children. All of them have been educated and three are still in their care.  The couple lives with their children and together they are able to meet the various needs of the family. Léocadie Léonie did not attend school.  She is in the business of serving food that she prepares at home, which allows her to meet the needs of her family without too much difficulty.   As a sideline, Léocadie Léonie sells drinks.   In order to respond better to her customers’ demand, she would like to build up her stock of supplies and to increase her business activitiy.   In order to do this, Léocadie Léonie is requesting, along with the other members of the group MOWA-NOU, a first loan from ALIDé.
.

loans.use: to buy food products for cooking and drinks.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. He has been working as a furniture upholsterer for the past 10 years, and today he is the proud owner of a furniture upholstery business. He works hard to meet his family's needs. 

He’s asking for a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business. He notes that these purchases will help him improve his work and increase his revenue. In the future, he plans to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas is a 26-year-old young man who is married with one daughter. He works on a machine which polishes tiles. He earns a good income from his business, but he wants to purchase a new machine to improve his work and increase his income. He needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Firas gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new tile polishing machine. This will enable him to compete with others in the same field and provide high quality services to his customers. He hopes that he will be able to increase his income and provide better living conditions for his family. Firas is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a new tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en: To continue her business, Ni Komang is requesting a new loan to buy four more piglets. She already has a good pig pen from her last loan. Ni Komang earned a good profit from her last loan and she has been able to save some money. Her business helps her to support her children's education and other needs. Ni Komang wants her children to have a higher education for a better future.

loans.use: to buy four piglets.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 48 años, empezó con su negocio hace 4 años, estableció su negocio en su casa ya que por el sector que vive no hay bazares.

Atiende su bazar desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Su única dificultad son las épocas de lluvias ya que el sector se llena de agua. Si está casado pero no tiene hijos.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo cuadernos, papelería, laminas etc. Su meta es poder construir su casa de cemento y poder  agrandar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis, 48, started his business four years ago; he started it at home because the neighborhood he lives in has no stores.  He is open from 7 in the morning to 10 at night.  His only difficulty is during the rainy season because the neighborhood floods.  He’s married but has no children.

He has many hopes for his business and this is why he wants to use his loan to buy notebooks, paper goods, illustrated prints, etc.  His goal is to be able to build his house out of cement and to enlarge his business more.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper and illustrated prints.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children. One child attends school, while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Fatuma has operated a grocery-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. One of the major challenges she faces is delayed payments from customers who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Sam Im's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district, Sa Im is a 33-year-old mother of three children. She has one dependent child working for pay at a rubber plantation. She started farming rice and planting cassava on her farmland ten years ago. In addition, she sells cupcakes in the village for extra income. She currently earns more than ten U.S. dollars per day to feed her family. 

There are two members of Sa Im’s group. This is her first loan with VisionFund while her co-member, Teur, has been with VisionFund for one year. She wants to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Aquiles Francisco

texts.es: Don Aquiles de 37 años de edad, originario de Jinotega de oficio comerciante, se dedica a venta de ropa y zapatos. Con su primer préstamo Kiva lo fue muy bien esta agradecido por el apoyo y confianza que recibió al otorgarle el préstamo, lo utiliza para comprar zapatos y surtir de nuevos estilos su mercadería, las ventas fueron buenas .Pero el sigue en la lucha de lograr poner una pequeña farmacia y ejercer su carrera como farmacólogo pero para eso el quiere lograr tener suficientes ahorros para empezar y quiere ayudarse con los ingresos que le genere la venta de zapatos. Es por tal motivo que esta solicitando un segundo crédito para compra de Zapatos.
texts.en: Aquiles, 37 years old, was born in Jinotega and is a merchant. He sells clothing and shoes. His first Kiva loan went very well and he is grateful for the help and confidence he received upon being granted the loan. He used it to buy shoes and supply his store with new styles, and sales were good. But he continues his struggle to install a small pharmacy and launch his career as a pharmacist. To do this, he will need sufficient savings to start out and he wants to improve the income he generates selling shoes. For that reason Aquiles is requesting a 2nd loan to buy additional shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita’s neighbor admires her for being humble. She is a housekeeper at the same time managing their rice field. Estelita is 52 years old and blessed with three children. Her husband is a chairman in their village and her partner in managing their farm.
Estelita has been in this type of business for over thirty years. Through their profits in farming, Estelita was able to send her children in school. She and her husband will continue to manage their rice farming business. They will strive to continue support their children needs in school and will have a better future. 
Estelita is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care. She hopes to become a successful farmer a borrower as well.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Это веселей человек Фируз. Он честный и активный мужчина. Фирузу 28 лет. Он имеет 3 брата. Им 26, 24 и 22 года. Старшие находятся на заработках загранице. Младший вместе с Фируз занимается животноводством. Мать Фируза и жена занимается портнихой. Фируз 4 года выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Он покупает скота и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ему помогает брат. У Фируза иммется коровник, он там выращивает своих домашних животных. Фируз хочет закупить еще пару голов коров для увеличения их численность. По этой причине он запрашивает кредит.

loans.use: Для закупа скота и увеличения их численность.

loans.name: Los Dulces Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Del 11 al 19 de diciembre la feria regional ganadera organizada por la asociación Ganadera Local, esto en el estado de Veracruz. Dicha feria es la más grande del país por lo que no puede faltar la exhibición de la producción artesanal, industrial, cultural y de servicios, además de la exhibición de ganado vacuno, principalmente.
   En una de las colonias se integró el grupo Los Dulces cuyo nombre obedece a la actividad que realiza una de las integrantes. Ellos son: Guadalupe M. quien vende productos naturistas, tamales y fruta; María, zapatos y ropa; Carmela, comida y dulces; Alfredo, medicina naturista; Guadalupe P., ropa; Luisa, bolsos; Concepción, comida típica y ropa; Graciela; dulces y refrescos; Amalia, ropa; Celina y Minerva, comida; Geovane, carteras; Ricardo, ropa; Victoria, costuras y Miriam, zapatos.
   Doña Carmela ha formado una familia muy unida junto a su esposo Marco y sus tres hijos de los cuales sólo una depende de la pareja. La entrega y dedicación de Mela, como le conocen sus amistades y familiares, queda demostrada en su actividad ya que ha vendido dulces por más de 15 años ininterrumpidos. Las ganancias obtenidas le permitieron iniciar una actividad secundaria y ahora vende tacos durante los fines de semana contando con el apoyo de su familia para atender a los comensales. En un inicio sólo contaba con una mesa pequeña donde colocaba los utensilios para preparar la carne y otra mesa donde disponía la verdura, tortillas, servilletas y platos. Posteriormente pudo comprar mejores mesas de madera, nuevas sillas y remodelaciones al lugar: “estoy feliz pues mi hija me ha dicho que soy su inspiración y ha iniciado con la venta de dulces, así nos apoya con los gastos de la escuela” comentó orgullosa.
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne, aceite, chiles, platos, paletas, chicles, caramelos de menta, anís, lunetas y malvaviscos con el objetivo de fortalecer sus actividades. Su sueño es establecer una tienda de abarrotes para formar un patrimonio familiar.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el lugar donde Carmela coloca su puesto de comida, ella es quien viste blusa color azul.

loans.use: Comprara: carne, aceite, chiles, platos, paletas, chicles, caramelos de menta, anís, lunetas, bombones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farming business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucy and her husband have a store for supplying lubricants (oils for motors, brake and clutch fluid) for vehicles. They live in the city of El Alto on Litoral Avenue. Their store is located in their house. The have two minor children dependent on them, making this work their only source of income for maintaining the family. She works independently, and this loan is intended for the purchase of merchandise (lubricants) for moving into the business of providing for public and private transport of the city. This will be her ninth loan with Impro, and her past history makes her a number 2 client, which is to say, with a good record of paying her obligations. Her credit history should permit her to obtain this credit since she has experience in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lucy y su esposo tienen una tienda de servicio de Lubricantes (Aceites para motor, freno y embrague) para vehículos. Viven en la Ciudad de El Alto Av. Litoral, su tienda se encuentra ubicada en su mismo domicilio. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad y bajo su dependencia, siendo este trabajo su única fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. La Sra.Lucy trabaja independientemente y el crédito esta orientado a la compra de mercadería (lubricantes), para su comercialización a transportistas públicos y particulares de la ciudad de El Alto. Es su noveno crédito en Impro, su historial en nuestra institución califica como cliente 2, es decir con buen cumplimiento de pago de su obligación. Sus antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem S. is 28 years old, married and  a mother of three children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell water convolvulus and fruits at a market and typically make about $3/day in revenue. One of her children is a student and the rest are too young to attend school. S. is asking for a $400 loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport her vegetables from and to market. For the next year, she plans to save enough money to buy another stand and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport  her water convovulus to the market.

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.es:
Mr. Eriberto is 54 years old, married, and he lives with his wife Porfiria Torres. They have four children, all adults. Two of them work in Argentina and send a bit of money home every month to support their parents; the other two live with them: one works for the city government and the other one works for the town management.

Several years ago, Mr. Eriberto opened a grocery store in their home, where he, with the help of his wife, sells all kinds of basic needs goods like sugar, pasta, flour, diary, eggs, etc.

His business is doing very well because it is located in an area where there is not much competition. Mr. Eriberto is requesting a loan of $300 that he plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of drinks like soft drinks, juices, and beer. The demand for these products is very high and this will help him to increase his profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

El señor Eriberto tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa Porfiria Torres; tienen cuatro hijos, todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos se encuentran en la Argentina trabajando y mensualmente envían un poco de dinero a sus padres para ayudarlos; sus otros dos hijos viven con ellos y uno trabaja en la Gobernación de la ciudad y el otro en la Municipalidad.

Hace siete años, don Eriberto abrió una despensa en su casa, donde ayudado por su esposa, vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, tales como azúcar, fideos, harina, productos lácteos, huevos, etc.

Su negocio marcha muy bien, ya que se encuentra en una zona donde no abundan negocios de este tipo. Eriberto solicita el crédito de $ 300 que los desea invertir en la compra al por mayor de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos y cerveza puesto que la demanda de estos productos es bastante alta y esto ayudará a aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: To invest in the wholesale purchase of drinks like soft drinks, juices, and beer

loans.name: Sisitagaloa

texts.en: Sisitagaloa is a single lady who is twenty one years old. She just finished school and she is now looking for a job. In the meantime, she is staying home, and she wants to use her spare time to run her elei business (a traditional Samoan way of printing on fabric) and sell her products at shops in town. Her first loan of US $300 was used to buy paint, materials, brushes, and elei materials for the business. She said that if the business goes well and becomes more profitable, then she will no longer need to look for a job, and instead focus on this business. She is very happy in her business and hopes that her next loan will make it more profitable and comfortable.

loans.use: To buy materials for her elei printing business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has been working in grocery sales since she created a market close to her home twenty-four years ago and today she continues dedicated to this activity because she wants to offer a better future to her three children who are the sole reason for her existence. She has always worked with dedication and effort and has known to allocate her time properly between caring for her kids and her business. She's been doing this for all these years so now she watches with satisfaction the positive response from her children who treat their studies with persistence and dedication. This fact encourages her to continue increasing her plans to improve her sales position at the market. So every day Antonia leaves very early from her home all prepared and with all the chores done so that she can dedicate her whole morning to the grocery sales, then later in the evening she can tend to all the demands of her kids and her home. Antonia wants to acquire a greater quantity and variety of merchandise to obtain a larger earnings and pay for college-prep and university studies for her two older children, who also support her in the market during the busiest hours. She is requesting a loan to invest in these goals. The possibility to support Antonia is in your hands; don't let this opportunity pass.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Antonia, viene trabajando desde hace muchos años en la venta de abarrotes, desde cuando se creó un mercado cerca de su localidad ya hace 24 años y hoy sigue inmersa en esta actividad porque quiere ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus tres hijos que son toda la razón de su existencia.Ella siempre con dedicación y esfuerzo ha sabido repartir adecuadamente su tiempo para atender a sus hijos y su negocio, y lo ha estado haciendo durante todos estos años para ahora observar con satisfacción la respuesta positiva de sus hijos a través del empeño y dedicación en sus estudios, este hecho la anima a seguir incrementando sus planes para mejorar su puesto de ventas en el mercado. Así cada día, Antonia, sale muy temprano de su casa ya lista y con todos los quehaceres realizados para dedicarse toda la mañana a la venta de los abarrotes para luego por las tardes atender todas y cada una de las demandas de sus hijos y hogar.Antonia desea adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para obtener mayores ganancias y pagar los estudios universitarios y preparación preuniversitaria de sus dos hijos mayores, quienes también la apoyan en la atención de su puesto de ventas en el mercado durante las horas de mayor demanda; para ello solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en estos fines.Recuerda la posibilidad de apoyar a Antonia, está en tus manos no dejes pasar esta oportunidad.

loans.use: Capital to acquire a greater quantity and variety of everyday goods for her market sales.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Mr. Benito is 35 years old; he is married and has 2 minor children. For the last ten years Mr. Benito has been in the business of recycling tires. He has a steady client base to which he sells his product. He also sells used tires to the main tire dealers of the city.

His hard work and the help of his wife, who also works with him in the business, have allowed them to buy a house, support their family and cover the costs of schooling for their children.

With the proceeds of the loan that he is requesting he wants to acquire a larger inventory of tires and paint and other materials needed to refurbish them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Benito tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos todos menores de edad. Benito se dedica al reciclaje de cubiertas hace ya más de 10 años, posee clientela fija a quiénes les provee de éstos productos y además vende cubiertas usadas a las principales gomerías de la ciudad.

Con su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposa (quién también trabaja con él) lograron comprar una casa, mantener a la familia y cubrir los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

Con el crédito que solicita, desea adquirir mayor cantidad de cubiertas, pintura y otros materiales que utiliza para arreglar las cubiertas y ponerlas en buen estado.

loans.use: Purchase of new and used tires and materials.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, age 40, is divorced and takes care of her 3 children (between ages 9 and 19). She has a business of selling clothing on the street. She started doing this business in 1986 and now can make a monthly profit of about $270 from her sales. She works from 7am to 3pm daily.

Jamila hopes for a loan to buy more inventory to sell. She belongs to the loan group Kisiwani, which totals 41 members.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Igamerov

texts.ru:
I. Igamerov is 25 years old, married but has no children yet. He works at the automotive shop as a master car repairman. On weekends he buys and sells cattle. Currently he has two cows and 5 rams. Together with his wife he fattens the cattle and sells the animals at the Chairuch market. I. is applying for a loan to purchase two additional cows for fattening.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Эгамеров Ислом ,возрост 25 лет женат пока детей не имеет.Сам работает в техстанции мастером по ремонту автомашин.В выходные дни занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота.Сейчас имеет 2 коровы и 5 баранов.Они вместе с женой откармливают скот и продают на Чайрухском базаре. Сейчас хочет взяв займ купить еще пару коровы для откорма.

loans.use: Fattening and sale of cattle

loans.name: Pascuala's Group

texts.es:
Pascuala is a 38-year-old woman who makes regional, traditional clothing for a living. She makes blouses that take her a long time to finish because she embroiders them. This merchandise is sold to women in her community, as well as to women in the nearby communities. She is able to support her 3 children with what few profits she earns. With this loan, she would like to purchase more fabric and thread so that she can make more clothing. The other members of the group, Elena H. G., Rosa H. G., Dominga H. S., and Maria G. H., are all artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA TIENE 38 AÑOS, SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA TIPICA DE LA REGION, ELABORA BLUSAS A LAS CUALES LES DEDICA MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE TAMBIEN LAS BORDA, ESTA MERCANCIA ES VENDIDA CON MUJERES DE SU MISMA LOCALIDAD O COMUNIDADES CERCANAS, CON EL POCO DINERO QUE OBTIENE DE ESTO MANTIENE A SUS 3 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR MAS TELA E HILOS PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS ROPA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: ELENA H. G., ROSA H. G., DOMINGA H. S. Y MARIA G. H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, and dyes

loans.name: Sweetbetha's Dhamana Group

texts.en:
Sweetbetha is 35 years old and married, with two children, ages 20 and 7. Sweetbetha owns a small food vending store and grocery, which she started in 2008. Every day she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $95 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food and grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with Grace, who also has a grocery business.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her food shop.

loans.name: Abdukohir

texts.en: K. Abdukohir is 26 years old and lives in Chkalovsk, where he is engaged in food selling. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006, and the success of his business has enabled him to both repay his loans and expand his business to include not only milk products but also a variety of meats including sausages, salami, and meat rolls.  K. Abdukohir has many customers and is able to offer prices lower than those in the bazaar.  He is now applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1200 for 10 months. He wants to expand his trade and  purchase one more refrigerator.

loans.use: To enlarge his trade and to purchase one more refrigerator.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar is the widow of M. A.. Her husband died ten years ago.. She has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 50 years. She has seven children; two sons and five daughters. Her son, Zulfiqar, has a food business and runs his own hotel. She wants to apply a loan for her dry cleaning business. She hopes that if she earns a profit she will marry her daughter.

She has four other women in her loan group. Sakina baji wants to buy juicer machine; Ghulam Fatima baji wantsa loan to expand her shoe business; Nusrat baji wants to make plastic utensils and Farhat baji wants a loan for her garment business.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Egya

texts.en:
Egya E. sells fish and owns a canoe. He is married, but his wife's income as a fishmonger is not sufficient for Egya and his 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Mr. Chea Kark's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chea K. is the group leader of four people who all live in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. In the rainy season, Mr. Chea K. grows rice, while he grows vegetables in the dry season. On his plantation, Mr. Chea K. now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer to support the rice field. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use part of the loan to buy pesticide to kill insects in order to make his crop more productive.

Mr. Chea K. is a widower with eight children, one of whom is working as a construction worker while six others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy pesticide

loans.name: Teresa Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú, actividad que lo realiza en el puesto de venta que está ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, lugar donde acuden diariamente los comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. No le faltan clientes por su buena sazón, variedad de los platos que oferta y la atención que brinda a los clientes. 

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparación diaria de los platos que oferta a los clientes como verduras, carnes (res, cerdo, pollo, pescado), también invertirá en el arreglo de su casa para acondicionar el negocio más adelante.

La señora Teresa tiene  34 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo, quien es su motor para seguir luchando y trabajando día a día. Es una mujer decidida, tiene como meta tener un restaurante en su propio domicilio para atender a los clientes con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa Lilia A. belongs to the “Picota” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region, in the provincial district of Picota. She dedicates herself to the sale of menu-type food, selling from her stand in the local market. People from the neighborhood and visitors from nearby communities go to the local market daily to eat. Ms. A. attracts many clients because of the good seasoning she uses on her food, the variety of dishes on the menu, and the good restaurant service she provides for her customers. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy rice, sacked sugar, several gallons of cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients for the daily preparation of the vegetarian, beef, pork, chicken, and fish dishes she offers on the menu. She is also investing in home improvements in order to prepare her business for the future. Mrs. A., 34, is a single mother who lives with her son, who gives her strength to keep fighting and working every day. She is very determined, and her goal is to open a restaurant in her home that better attends to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Clara Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Clara Edelmira P. P. tiene 48 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la Manzana I lote 34 del Barrio 3 B del distrito El Porvenir provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudiaba para ejercer como Auxiliar de Contabilidad en un Instituto pero no continuó porque se casó a los 26 años.
Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales, el mayor ya es independiente y los menores son estudiantes.
Clara tenía una bodega pero empezó a fiar sus productos y no pudo recuperar los créditos entonces tuvo que cerrar. Actualmente vende combinado, que consiste en servir un plato con tallarín, ceviche y papa con crema a la huancaína. Lo realiza en forma ambulante.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas compró cosas para su bodega, que ahora ya no la tiene.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será  cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará insumos y volverá a invertir en su actual negocio y tratará de reinvertir en su bodega.
Clara sueña con poner un gran restaurant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clara Edelmira Pareda P. is 48 years old and is a member of the communal bank Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos. She lives at Manzana I, Lot 34 in the neighborhood 3B in the district of El Porvenir, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied to work as an accountant aide at the Institute but did not continue because she was married at 26. She has 3 children, of which the oldest is already independent; the two younger ones are still students. Clara has a grocery store, but started to give them out on credit that she was later unable to collect, so she had to close shop. Today, she sells food which consists of a dish of tallarin, ceviche and potato with huancaína style cream. She sells this door to door. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she has returned in 4 installments, she bought products for her store which she no longer owns. With this loan of 800 soles, which will be payed back in 4 installments, she will purchase ingredients and food products and will again invest in her grocery store in addition to her current business. Clara hopes to eventually own a restaurant.f

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and food products

loans.name: Elsa Ene

texts.es:
La señora Elsa tiene 36 años de edad, es tesorera de su Grupo Solidario Génesis y vive en la calle Juan Velasco Alvarado Mz 4 lote 19 El Milagro, distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Farmacia Técnica, pero no trabaja en su carrera porque los sueldos no corresponden a la realidad. Tiene una hija de 6 años que depende enteramente de ella.
Elsa empezó a trabajar con una bodega, lugar donde vende toda clase de abarrotes. Con sus ganancias puso un video pub el cual le da mucha ganancia. Actualmente tiene también una cebichería, el negocio se desarrolla en su propia casa. Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en la bodega.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, instalará el sistema de agua para su negocio.
Elsa sueña con viajar y conocer el extranjero.
texts.en:
Elsa is 36 years old, and the treasurer for the Genesis Solidarity Group. She lives on Juan Velasco Alvarado Street in El Milagro, Huanchaco district, in La Libertad, Perú. She studied as a pharmacist, but doesn’t practice her profession because the salaries are not realistic. She has a small 6-year old daughter who wholly depends on her. Elsa started to work with a grocery store, where she sells all types of products. With her earnings, she initiated a video pub which generates good profits. Currently, she also has a cebichería (food sales) which she runs out of her own home. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, which was canceled in four months, she invested in the grocery store. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will install a water system for her business. Elsa dreams of traveling and getting to know other places.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a water system for her business.

loans.name: Eva Gloria

texts.es:
Eva C. T. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito II” de la provincia de Huaraz.

Eva tiene 50 años de edad, y tiene 04 hijos con su conviviente, Eva afirma que no ha tenido dificultades las cuales no pudiera superar, asegura que ver por sus hijos y tener su negocio han sido sus mayores logros, ella se dedica a la extracción y comercialización de agregados (arena, piedras) para las construcciones, que extrae de un área del río Santa en la zona de Tacllán en las afueras de la ciudad de Huaraz, que luego distribuye a las construcciones haciendo uso de su propio medio de transporte (volquete), aunque ella comparte este negocio con su esposo, comenta que le ha ido muy bien aunque ahora hay mucha competencia, porque los empresarios hacen uso de herramientas para la extracción de mayor volumen de agregados que propician que los pequeños extractores solo puedan vender a estos empresarios o simplemente ya no realicen esta actividad por ello Eva también desea tener otro negocio que le genere mayores ingresos.
  
Con este préstamo de s/.1700.00, que pagará en seis cuotas; hará uso de este dinero para la reparación de su volquete y su respectivo mantenimiento.
 
Eva segura que necesita saber sobre otras alternativas de negocio.
texts.en:
Eva C. T. is part of the "Niño Manuelito II” Communal Bank in the province of Huaraz. Eva is 50 years old and has 4 children with her partner. She has not had any difficulties which she has been unable to overcome, and looking after her children and her business has been her greatest achievement. She extracts and sells construction materials (sand, stones), which she excavates from an area of the Santa River in the Tacllan zone on the outskirts of the city of Huaraz. Later she distributes the materials to construction companies using her own means of transportation (dump truck). She shares the business with her husband and it has gone well. Now however there is much more competition because of the use of larger-volume extraction machinery and many of the smaller businesses either sell to the larger ones or get out of the business. Eva would like to have another business which generates greater income. With this loan for S/. 1,700, which will be repaid in six installments, she will repair and maintain the dump truck. Eva would like to learn about other business alternatives.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of machinery.

loans.name: Las Juanas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Juanas" esta representada por la señora Giovana e integrada por 16 miembros los cuales un amayoría son mujeres a esepcion de un varon el cual se dedica  ala venta de Cds. el resto de las socias se dedica a la venta y comercio de cosmeticos y material de belleza y accesorios para damas, como cosmeticos, ropa, zapatos y productos Herbalife. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los integranrtes del grupo a mejorar la calida de sus productos y a proporcionar un servicio de mejor calidad es por esta razon que requieren de un fianciamiento a travez de la fundacion Agrocapital, para hacer crecer su negocio comprado materiales e insumos y mejorando sus puestos de  venta para ser mas atractiva a la vista de los demandantes. En general las integrantes del grupo no tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios pero aseguran ser gente responsable y con gran calidad humana por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las Juanas" is represented by Ms Giovana and is made up of 16 members who are primarily women. Except for one woman who sells CDs, the members work in the sale of cosmetics and beauty products and women's accessories, like cosmetics, clothing, shoes and Herbalife products. There exists great competition in the market, and thus, the members are forced to improve their product's quality and provide better service. For this reason they ask for a loan through Agrocapital to increase their business by purchasing material and improving their business stands in order to attract clients. In general the members do not have experience working with lending groups, however, they guarantee that they are responsible and well-meaning people. It is for this reason that Agrocapital has given them the opportunity to increase their revenue and to improve the quality of their, and their family's, life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica a cocinar a gran escala para cubrir sus pedidos D. comida para grandes banquetes y eventos sociales, ella prepara alimentos que serán utilizados en bodas y diversas ceremonias. En promedio cocina para 300 personas a más, según las porciones que prepara. Recuerda que los inicios D. su negocio, hace más D. 6 años, vendía D. manera ambulante y fue recomendada por unas amistades para cubrir pequeños banquetes que estuvieron satisfechos por el grato servicio que recibieron y así la recomendaron para mayores cantidades D. pedidos. Hoy tiene mucha demanda y esto garantiza las entradas económicas D. su familia, eso a María la anima a seguir trabajando duro para seguir generando esos recursos. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una D. las integrantes D. su banco comunal que siempre trabaja D. manera comprometida para que  todos sus integrantes sean favorecidos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. mayores cantidades D. condimentos y demás ingredientes básicos para la preparación D. su comida, D. esa manera abastecer con eficiencia los pedidos que hacen.
texts.en:
María is 59 and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She earns her living cooking on a grand scale for banquets and social events, like weddings and all manner of ceremonies. She cooks for 300 people or more, on average, depending on the number of servings. She recalls starting out more than 6 years ago, traveling around selling her food. She was recommended by some friends to do small banquets. People were satisfied by her pleasant service so they recommended her for others. Nowadays María is in high demand, guaranteeing income for her family, so she's motivated to keep working and earning the money. This will be María's fourth loan with MFP. She is a committed member of her village bank, always working for the benefit of all the members. She plans to use her loan to buy more condiments and any other ingredients she needs to prepare her food, so she can do her job more efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for preparing her meals

loans.name: Ural

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Ural has worked in farming. By way of this work, he succeeds in supporting his family, providing his little boy with the studies he deserves. The reason that he has applied to IMON International today is to get a loan with which to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing his crops. Ural hopes that he will be given a loan and that way he will succeed in his business and improve his living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Leitu

texts.en:
Leitu F. is 42 years old and married with six children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people /public two days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase farming equipment for her plantation. 

Leitu has had one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are her only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala ($105 USD).

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment such as an axe, spade, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82760
Epifanía  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta.
Epifanía es casada tiene 61 años cinco hijos que ya están  casados.
Epifanía es D. Huanuco, estudio costura, actualmente cose peluches, ella empezó vendiendo kerosén, cerveza y gaseosa y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio, actualmente tiene su BODEGA PATRICIA, su esposo le ayudará por un tiempo, por que le han detectado cáncer Terminal, esto ocasiona muchos gastos, pero Epifanía confía en Dios.   
Epifanía necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. bolsas D.  fideos  y sacos D. arroz, azúcar.
DesD. que esta en Finca, aprendió como manejar el negocio, tratar bien a la clientela, los créditos han sido D. mucha ayuda para surtir su tienda. 
El sueño D. Epifanía es dejar un negocio estable para su hija  menor.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a member of the Teresa D. Calcuta (Mother Teresa) Communal Bank. She is 61 years of age and married with five children, all of whom are married. Epifanía is from Huanuco and has studied sewing. Currently she makes stuffed animals. She began selling kerosene, beer and carbonated drinks and little by little her business grew. It's now called Bodega Patricia. Her husband was helping her for a while, until he was diagnosed with terminal cancer. This has resulted in many expenses, but Epifanía puts her trust in God. Epifanía needs a loan of 1,200 Sols to buy packets of noodles, sacks of rice, and sugar. Since she has been with FINCA Peru she has learned how to manage the business and to treat her customers well. The loans have helped greatly to sustain the store. Epifanía dreams of being able to leave a stable business to her young daughter. First Loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82760

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Kotognogontala est  constitué de cinq femmes  mariées  vivant dans des familles polygames  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  5 enfants. Elles habitent à Kaboila une des  communes rurales  de la préfecture de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Afin de  satisfaire le besoin de leurs  clientèles et augmenter  davantage leurs bénéfices, les femmes du groupe  sont à leur  dix-neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente des matières en plastique, du charbon de bois et du sounbala (ingrédient pour la sauce). 
Elles comptent acheter,  60 sacs de 100 kg de noix de néré pour préparer le sounbala , 70 sacs de charbon de bois et  50 colis de matières en plastique. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour la scolarité  et la santé  des enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
texts.en:
The Kotognogontala group consists of five married women living in polygamous families, with an average age of 40 and an average of five children. They live in rural communities in the Sikasso prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

To satisfy the needs of their clients and increase their profits, the women of the group are on their nineteenth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. The preceding loans were reimbursed well. They manage various activities: selling plastic materials, coal from wood, and sounbala (an ingredient for sauce).

They count on buying sixty 100 kg sacs of néré nuts to prepare the sounbala, seventy sacs of coal, and fifty packages of plastic materials. They sell their goods at the large market (the Grand Marché) in the city of Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold at the Sikasso Grand Marché on the spot to a clientele composed of men and women, either in cash or with credit. They hope to come to a point when each can earn an average monthly profit of 20 000FCFA, of which a part will be used for the education and health of their children and the other part to be invested in their activities and the reimbursement of the loan.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various supplies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.ru: Меликова София проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 58 лет, вдова . Одна воспитывает троих детей. Работает в продуктовом магазине. Занимается бизнесом уже 5 лет. Магазин приносит около 500 сомони в месяц. В данный момент София решила увеличить товарооборот. Для этого она обратилась к нам за кредитом. На полученные деньги она сможет завезти новый ассортимент.
texts.en:
Sofia M. lives in the Varzob region. She is 58 years old and a widow. Sofia has been raising her three children alone. For the last five years she has been managing a grocery store which makes about 500 ($100) somoni every month. Currently Sofia wants to expand her inventory and so increase profits from the store. For this purpose she has turned to Kiva for a loan. She will use the money to bring in additional goods for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.es:
la señora CONCEPCION ROSARIO A. de 55 años de edad, esta casada con el señor LORENZO FUNEZ,  tienen 06 hijos, todos casados, ella vive en la colonia nueva Vista de san lorenzo su casa esta fabricada con ladrillos de adobe y vive con su nieto, el cual esta en la escuela de la comunidad. ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y frescos, ella desea vender chicharras que es muy parecido al chicharron pero mas grande y tostado, ya que anteriormente tenia una pulperia pero no le funciono debido a  que en la zona hay muchas pulperias. es por esta razon que ella esta solocitando el credito ya que esta invirtiendo en las chicharras. 

ella quiere comprar el producto por mayor 

su deseo es que su nieto estudie y se prepare para la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Concepcion Rosario Alverez is 5 years old and is married to Mr. Lorenzo Funez. She has 6 children, all of whom are married. She lives in a new neighborhood, Vista de Son Lorenzo. Her house is made of bricks and adobe. She lives with her grandson, who goes to school in the community. She sells fruit and sodas. She wants to sell cicadas, which is like a pork crackling, but larger and more toasted. Earlier, she had a grocery store, but it did not do well because there are many grocery stores in her area. This is why she is asking for a loan to start selling cicadas. She wants to sell a better product so her grandson can continue to study and prepare for his life.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cicadas, salt, sodas, fruit

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
Benigna es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Benigna es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Benigna tiene un puesto en el mercado de Santa Elena en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Benigna necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tomate, zanahoria.
Los sueños de benigna son que su negocio crezca y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Benigna is a member of the Power Communal Bank group. She is 25 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her partner. Benigna works every day selling vegetables from a stall in the Santa Elena market.

She needs a loan of 900 soles to buy tomatoes and carrots. Benigna dreams of growing her business and finishing the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tomatoes and carrots

loans.name: Jessica Jamileth

texts.es: La señora Jessica jamilet Álvarez , tiene la edad de 28 años , habita en el barrio las Borgoñas en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos de seis y siete años , los dos estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es construir su casa , ya que actualmente la casa de doña Jessica esta bien deteriorada , ella desde hace tres años trabaja como cocinera en un Restaurante , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, ella inicio parte de la construcción con el esfuerzo de su esposo y de ella misma . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y poder hacer las mejoras a su casa para ofrecer a sus hijos una casa digna.
texts.en:
Jessica Jamilet A. is 28 years old and lives in teh las Borgonas neighborhood in the Ticuantepe commuity, together with her husband who works as a laborer and supports her with the household expenses. They have two six and seen year old children, who are both in elementary school. Their plans for their family are to build their house, now that their house is actually deteriorated. For three years she has worked as a cook in a restaurant. Their biggest difficulty has been the lack of finances to start part of the construction with the work of her husband and herself. With the loan she is going to buy construction materials and be able to make the repairs to her house to offer them a dignified house.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Эркабоев Алишер- молодой мужчина,30 лет-занимается бизнесом  более 10лет. Зарабатывает хорошие деньги, потому что у него оптовая продажа продуктов питаниями. У Алишера   быстрый товарооборот, так как он привозит оптом хороший товар, который пользуется спросом. Его жена Зебо поддерживает мужа и торгует за него пока он ездит за товаром или где-то задерживается. Наш Фонд поддерживает таких бизнесменов и готов  сотрудничать с ними в дальнейшем. Алишеру тоже нравится сотрудничить с нами, потому что работая с нашей организацией он приобрёл финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Alisher Erkaboev is a young man of 30 years, has been doing business for more than ten years. He makes good money because his business is wholesale of food stuffs. Alisher has a quick turnover as he brings in quality goods in wholesale which are in high demand. His wife Zebo supports her husband and does the sales when he goes out for the goods or when he gets help up. Our Fund supports such businessmen and is ready to be partners with them in the future. Alisher is also happy to be working with us because by working with our organization he received financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín es un joven trabajador de 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años de manera independiente, cultiva la papa y la vende directamente a los mercados de la ciudad más cercana a su zona. También tiene ganado vacuno que le sirven para el arado, los cuales arrienda sus vecinos agricultores para obtener ingresos extras. El trabajo que realiza es diario, llegando por la noche agotado, sin embargo es un trabajo que disfruta porque es su propio negocio. El sueño de Efraín es ser un gran ganadero y agricultor que pueda producir a gran escala los productos de su tierra. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los integrantes más activos de su banco comunal y su responsabilidad se destaca en su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de sacos de abono y guano para preparar sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Mhlali Group

texts.en:
Mhlali is the group leader of Mhlali group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group of loan 40000 Afghani. 

Mhlali and Zhaki want the loan for theirs husbands who are taxi drivers. Najeba wants a loan for her husband who has a butcher shop. Jameil wants a loan for her husband who has a metal workshop. 

They are very happy about the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sulaiman's Group

texts.en: M. Sulaiman is a 50 year old male and a father of 10 children between the ages of 24 years and 8 months. He also helps to take care of 2 orphans, and all his children are still attending school. He is a business man involved in the sale of charcoal, milk and firewood from Mutai for 5 years now. Before this, he was a mere farmer selling his own produce until he got some capital and started with a daily business. Sulaiman has good customer care skills and good quality products and these have won him customers. At the moment, he lacks more capital to expand his businesses further with more stock. He is such a hard working and friendly man with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: Restocking his business by buying more charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta S. is from the village of Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 38 years old. Crisanta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, rice and feeds in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children.. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku J., currently in the business of selling maize flour, is requesting a loan to purchase dried cassava to grind into flour to sell. Kaku, 32 years old and married to a head teacher, has seven children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase dried cassava to grind into flour to sell

loans.name: Faridullah

texts.en:
This is Faridullah, son of M. N.. He lives in the 6th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 27, single, and lives with his 5 other  family members. 

Faridullah is a tinsmith. This occupation has been passed down to him from his grandfather, and he has been working in his shop since he was a child.  He is a responsible, hard-working man who supports his family members with the income from his work. 

Faridullah would like to mention that Kiva loans are useful; that is why he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN, which he will use to expand his business and to buy the necessities of his trade.

loans.use: to expand his business and to buy the necessities of his trade

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
D. Nyamjav is 58 years old and lives with his wife in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife conducts a clothes-trading business out of a rented stall at a local market in the town. Nyamjav operates a gold and silver crafts-making business.
