His profession consists mostly of crafting and welding his products as well as making repairs to metal items. 

Nyamjav started his business in 2003 and has been quite successful. His business continues to grow each year and today his working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugriks (MNT). Nyamjav has many plans for the future and says, "I am working hard and hope to have my own workplace in the future." He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrik  loan to refurbish his tools used in his gold and silver crafts business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To refurbish his tools used in his gold and silver crafts business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke sells pastries like chin-chin. Chin-chin is made from flour and sugar. She is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is a friendly woman. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of flour to fry more chin-chin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to fry more chin-chin to sell

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
la señora Maria Julia R. tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, y ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y le ayuda con la comida y otros gastos.
Maria tiene una pulperia en donde vende pollo, menudo, mantequilla, queso, jugos, frescos etc. esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir su negocio debido a la epoca de navidad vendio muchas cosas y ahora necesita surtir mas su negocio, las ganancias que le dejaron las ventas las ocupo para hcaer unos arreglos en su casa de habitacion.
necesita el credito para sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Julia R. is a 45-year-old married mother with children who are no longer dependent. Her husband is a fisherman who helps her with food and other living expenses.

Maria has a general store in which she sells chicken, tripe, butter, cheese, juice, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to restock her shop because during the Christmas season, she sold many of her products and now needs to increase her inventory. She used the profits for home improvements. She needs this loan in order to help her business move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, lard, cooking oil, soap, soup, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun K. is 57 years old, and raises pigs. Her husband, Mr. Siym Soun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice to support their family living. This couple lives in Smaong Village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Phun K. has some problem because her pigs are too small to sell, yet she does not have the money to support them. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed. The rest of the loan she would use to buy more piglets to raise.

Mrs. Phun K. is the mother of five children, two of whom are farmers while the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets

loans.name: Maxym

texts.en:
Maxym is married and does not yet have any children. He owns a small business where he sells various home products.
Maxym started this business about one year ago. He graduated from college but, because of the high unemployment rate, he could not find a decent job. Therefore he decided to become self-employed and he started his own business.
Maxym is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase more stock. His desire is to develop his business as it is the only source of income for his young family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia tills her two-hectare rice field with patience.  She has been doing this since 2004.  Florencia also runs a small store where she sells oil, vinegar and other daily necessities to her neighbors. She has a 16 year-old child who goes to school.  Florencia aims to have her child finish college and have a bright future.  Her husband, Teodoro, is her partner in maintaining the farm. She hopes to succeed in all ventures in life.

Florencia recently joined CEVI to gain access to its loan program. She requested a loan Php4,000.  If granted, she will purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa R., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Ricardo R., a driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life.  She has been juggling three businesses in the past five years. She does direct selling for the country’s popular cosmetics and clothing brands, she has her own electronic cellular phone loading station, and a buy-and-sell business.

Luisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 26,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more products to be incorporated into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also envisions herself having her own house.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Store inventory

loans.name: Romilyn

texts.en: Romilyn F. is from the village of Danao. She is 21 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Romilyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Romilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Romilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Julfa

texts.en:
Julfa V. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Julfa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Julfa owns & operates a business selling fish products in the local community. Julfa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Julfa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Women Together #2 Group

texts.en:
Marie T., holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Together #2. She is 39 years old, single with five children between 9 and 22. She could not continue her education through high school due to financial problems.

For five years she has been producing and selling a locally made washing soap, called Iron Soap, at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia.

She started her business with 2,000 Liberian Dollars and now has 7,000 Liberian Dollars as working capital. Her problem is the large number of competitors at her business site. Marie sells quality soap to keep customers returning. Her goal and dream is to expand her business into a factory and improve her family's living conditions. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to purchase oil and caustic soda to produce more soap.

loans.use: To purchase oil and caustic soda to produce more soap.

loans.name: Jimna

texts.en:
Jimna is a 31-year-old businessman. He owns Furaha Hardware where he sells bicycle spare parts in Nairobi, Kenya. His customers are mainly cyclists and people who repair bicycles.

Jimna has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 to add to his stock of bicycle spare parts and this loan is guaranteed by United Self Help Group.

Jimna is married to a teacher and they have a 6-year-old son who goes to school. Jimna hopes to improve his life and describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: To add to his stock of spare parts

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged between 10 weeks and 14 years old. Two of the children are attendng school.

She is a farmer from Central Kenya in Murang'a town. She has been farming for 13 years and employs 1 permanent employee and 3 casual labourers. Her products are coffee, maize, and beans which she sells to the local market. She solely depends on the income from farming to meet the family's expenses. Her major challenge is the lack of sustainable water supply to the farm and for domestic use.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.60,000 to purchase a water tank. This water tank will reduce the cost of water for domestic use and also provide enough water for the animals. In future, she would like to be able to store enough water for irrigation and domestic use.

She says, "With Juhudi Kilimo loans she will be able to own a good dairy cow".

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou E. is from the village of Talon Gingoog City. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the  accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Julieta is separated from her spouse and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina M. is from Ambalatungan, Santiago. She is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rufina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 51 años de edad y la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con la administración de su agencia de viajes y turismo Andino desde hace 2 años, La socia desea el préstamo para poder comprar boletos  y pagar los prepagos de hoteles y restaurantes. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los prepagos de hoteles y boletos turísticos.   

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the community bank named Dynamic. She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco. Paulina is 51 years old and she is married and has four children. For the past 2 years her occupation has been the management and administration of an Andean tourism and travel agency. Paulina requests a loan so that she will be able to purchase prepaid tickets to hotels and restaurants, and guided tours. Paulina values and appreciates the loan that she is granted because it gives her the chance to grow and improve the quality of their life. She is committed to the obligations of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid hotel vouchers and tours tickets.

loans.name: Kimsreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsreng I. (who is in the photo with her loom), is 28 years old, has been married since 2009 and just had a young son. She lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Kimsreng has been a silk weaver for 13 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh City. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Faustino Rolando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Faustino Rolando; el tiene 75  años de edad y es viudo y tiene 5 hijos; El socio tiene un negocio de crianza de cerdos en el distrito de Poroy, también se dedica hacer servicio de taxi turístico, el trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,el socio le gustaría tener un lugar más grande para poder criar los cerdos ya que le gusta este trabajo ya que después lo vende  en las distintas ferias o también lo lleva a la ciudad del Cusco. El socio solicita el préstamo para  el negocio de crianza de chanchos, para comprar chanchos y alimentos. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II. The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cuzco and the department of Cuzco. The member is Faustino Roland. He is 75 years old, is a widow, and has five children. The member has a business of raising pigs in the district of Poroy, and also works as a tourist taxi driver, working from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The member would like to have a bigger place to be able to raise his pigs since he likes this work because later he sells them in different fairs or he also brings them to the city of Cuzco. The member asks for the loan for his business of raising pigs, in order to buy pigs and feed. The member is thankful to those that form a part of his dream through this means and he promises to fulfill the payment of his contributions in the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He asks for a loan for his business of raising pigs, to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, all of whom are currently in school. Francis has a bar business which he has had for less than one year. He also sells fish.

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda which will be used to purchase more creates of soda and beers. With the help of this loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and be able to pay his children’s school fees.

In the future, Francis hopes to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more creates of soda and beer

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana D. is a widow with two grown sons. She is a market vendor from Berdyansk. Tatyana owns a clothing sales business. She sells women’s clothing items in one of the local marketplaces of her home town. Tatyana has been in business for more than 12 years. Currently, she has 13000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to 6500 Grivnyas. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise. She is hoping to purchase inventory in bulk at wholesale prices for resale at retail prices. Tatyana is an ambitious and determined entrepreneur. She works hard to keep her business running and meet her family’s basic needs. 

Note: On the photo Tatyana is in the front with her guarantor in the back.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Nyakabare Bakyar Twekundire Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
K. Victor of 'Nyakabare Bakyara Twekundire' group, Ntungamo is a hard-working and knowledgeable business-oriented man who has been running a grocery shop from Mukayenje, Rukungiri for over three years. Here he bakes bread and cakes and sells other local agricultural produce like bananas, beans and more with help from some casual labourers. 

This business has seen him bask in an average profit of 100,000 Ugandan shillings on top of his banana sales from his plantation. Therefore Victor is looking forward to restocking raw materials in his bakery business with the support of this loan money he is receiving. This will enable him to expand into large-scale production

loans.use: purchase raw materials for baking

loans.name: Isaac Mwamto

texts.en:
Isaac Mwamto O. is a 31 year old business man who is a welder who sells products made to his customers at a profit. He is married to Susan Imbosa and together they have four children ages 9, 7, 6, and 2 years old. He runs his business in Lumakanda Eldoret Kenya, and has been in this business for about four years.

Isaac was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he has no other history with any MFI.  He is applying for his third loan KES 30,000 with KADET LTD and he plans to purchase a new welding machine.

He hopes to operate a large scale welding machine to serve his customers better and in the future he wants to extend the same services by appyling for tenders in different companies.

loans.use: To purchase a new welding machine.

loans.name: Moyor

texts.en:
Moyor S. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two adult daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Both his daughters work. 

Moyor operates a small grocery shop. He provides a variety of food products to his customers. He opened his grocery shop in 2003 and has since built a stable operation. For the future, he plans to expand his business so that he can afford to purchase a car for himself. 

Moyor is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha T. and her husband, Mr. Phally Pheng, have been married since 1986 and have two sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, one works in a garment factory, one is a fisherman and another one attends school. The family lives along national road number one, approximately 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chantha is a rice farmer. She has asked for a Kiva loan once before. She is now applying for her second loan of $300 to purchase a boat and a boat motor for her son’s fishing business.

Photo: Mrs. Chantha T. and her husband

loans.use: To purchase a boat and a boat motor for her son’s fishing business

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton, de 30 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive junto a su mamá, Artemia, de 58 años de edad, a la que cuida y protege en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. La siembra de papa, olluco y oca (tubérculos), es su principal actividad económica; pero como buen hijo del campo, Nilton menciona que siembra “de todo”, entre hortalizas y cebada, la forma de trabajo de esté emprendedor hombre es en épocas agrícolas, las cuales se determinan de acuerdo a las temporadas de lluvia y sequía. Durante los 20 años que tiene dedicándose a la agricultura, aprendió no solo las técnicas de cultivo, también a comercializar sus productos, que son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde aplica en cada momento las enseñanzas de, “mejorar sus ventas”, que le otorga su banco comunal. Por ello ahora, él desea adquirir una casa en la ciudad para poder tener un lugar donde quedarse en épocas de campaña agrícola.  Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como hombre responsable, él se siente reconfortado por pertenecer a su banco comunal, bueno y responsable. Con el monto que solicita comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá entre sus sembríos, y si el dinero le alcanza podrá invertir en la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nilton, age 30, is a single hardworking gentleman. He lives with his mother Artemia, age 58, and cares for and protects her in his own home in the town of Ricrican. He grows tubers such as potatoes, ulluco, and oca as his main business activity. Being a “good son of the field”, Nilton says he can grow everything from vegetables to wheat. This man keeps himself busy with his farming whether it is the rainy or dry season. During the twenty years he has been farming, Nilton has learned farming techniques and how to sell his products at wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Every opportunity he applies what he learned from his Communal Bank to increase his sales. For now he wants to acquire a house in the city so that he will have a place to stay during the farming season.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Being a responsible man, Nilton feels comfortable that his Communal Bank is also good and responsible. With the amount requested, he will purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on his crops and use any money left over to invest in clearing his farmland.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer & clear his fields

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
36-year-old Betty N.'s entrepreneurial nature is what has put momentum into the success of her retail business over the course of the last five years in Wakitaka-Jinja. The financial and moral support of her husband, who actually began the shop, has been of paramount importance, too. 

In her shop, she sells a variety of retail commodities, but priority is given to goods which are in high favor with many rank-and-file people around her neighborhood. These goods include sugar, soap, sodas, rice, beans, etc. She says the business generates about $378 a month. 

Before all this came to fruition, Betty was a housewife. She and her husband are happily married and have four kids who all go to school.  Betty is requesting this loan to purchase more retail commodities like salt, washing and bathing soap, plastics, etc. to resell. She envisions improved sales revenue prospects in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities such as salt, washing and bathing soap, plastics, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Gretchen

texts.en:
Ma. Gretchen O. is 32 years old and single. She is from the village of Kiara, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. To make a living, Ma. Gretchen owns and operates a mini-restaurant and retail store. Her main source of income comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals, such as afritada, adobo and bulalo, to customers in the local community. Ma. Gretchen also sells canned goods and beverages in her store. Ma. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

Ma. Gretchen joined HSPFI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Gretchen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. She is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Ma. Gretchen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her businesses. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drink

loans.name: Myrzamurat's Group

texts.en:
Challenging circumstances force many people to find a way to feed their families. Our next creditor is no exception. He has had to overcome many disappointments and struggles on his way to his current established business.

Myrzamurat M., 50, is a member of this group. He is married and the father of a seventeen-year-old daughter. His most important wish is to bring up a healthy and strong daughter, provide her with education and ensure her basic needs are met at home. For these reasons, Myrzamurat has been working hard on his business of livestock breeding and reselling for the past three years. With this loan, he will buy some more goats to raise and resell.

Myrzamurat is a young, ambitious and energetic businessman who is dedicated to his work and can do more if supported financially. He says his biggest challenge has been fluctuations of livestock prices in the market. His daughter helps him with the household when she’s not studying. Myrzamurat works hard to keep his business going and is known for his tolerance and consistency in dealings with clients. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Roque, se conformó el 29 de octubre del 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General, Eva, quien se dedica a la venta de animales, se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras acercándose a la Fundación Paraguaya. Una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Es un grupo que se destaca por el trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realiza.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,  se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La sra. Eva cría gallinas, vacas y cerdos para luego venderlos a pequeños empresarios que desean aprovechar la carne de estos animales. O simplemente, vende los productos lácteos que saca de la vaca, los huevos de la gallina y la grasa del cerdo.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee named “San Roque” was formed on October 29, 2008. Eva, the current Director General, sells animals for a living. Thanks to her efforts, she learned about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program after visiting Fundación Paraguaya. Once she was advised about the program requirements, Eva was able to gather eighteen women who enjoy working. They are in their sixth loan cycle working together in the program.

The group is known for working together and cooperating with one another. All of them participate in fundraising activities so that they can help one another reach their common goals and those of Fundación Paraguaya.

Sra. Eva raises chickens, cows, and pigs and later sells them to small business owners who want these animals for their meat. In addition, she sells other products such as milk from her cows, eggs from her chickens, and lard from her pigs.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, chickens, and cows

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Don Carlos de 65 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa quien vende frutas y verduras, no tienen hijos y don Carlos posee un carro de alquiler, de esta actividad recibe ingresos, ya que de ofrece transporte a personas que deseen transportarse a otro lugar. Don Carlos tiene una larga trayectoria como motorista, pues sus empleos has sido específicamente como motorista.
Él solicita un préstamo para dar mantenimiento al vehículo, comprara amortiguadores, reparación de tapicerías de todo el interior del vehículo, con esta ayuda contara con mejores condiciones para realizar el trabajo diario y ofrecer un viaje más cómodo y seguro a los clientes.
Para don Carlos el plan a futuro es comprar una unidad de transporte (bus), para realizar viajes.
texts.en:
Carlos, 65, lives in San Miguel with his wife who is a fruit and vegetable merchant; they have no children.  

Carlos has a vehicle he leases; this is his source of income in that it provides transportation for people who wish to move from one place to another.  Carlos has a long history as a driver since his jobs have been as a driver.

He is asking for a loan to maintain his vehicle.  He will buy shock absorbers and repair  the vehicle’s upholstery.  With this help he will have better working conditions and provide more comfortable and safer trips to his customers.

Carlos’ plan for the future is to buy a bus to make trips in.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and for upholstery.

loans.name: Precy's Group

texts.en:
Precy M. is from the village of Simmimbaan. She is 47 years old. Precy is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Precy M. Group.

Precy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Precy runs a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Precy has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Precy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Precy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Precy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 1 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Lý N. Thị (3) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Lý is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 1 Đông Vệ (08.05.1 Đông Vệ).


Lý is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Lý owns & operates a general store selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste, in the local community.  Lý has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to buy  shampoo, soap, & toothpaste,...and resell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand  her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Cầm (1) is a 71 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  C. Thị Thân (2) is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  T. Thị Huyền (4) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  H. Thị Dung (5) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lý N. Thị (3) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Lý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1 Đông Vệ (08.05.1 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lý kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lý đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Cầm (1) là 71 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  C. Thị Thân (2) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  T. Thị Huyền (4) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  H. Thị Dung (5) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to pay for shampoo, soap, & toothpaste

loans.name: Faiziya

texts.en:
Z. Faiziya is married and the loving mother of her child. Her husband is a driver. Faiziya works hard to provide for her family. She started her business with a small amount of capital and in time, expanded her business with the help of Imon International. At the present time, she has her own place at the market and she sells children’s clothes. She has been in this business for 15 years and she would like to get a loan of 3,000$ US to purchase new spring children’s clothes. She thanks all the lenders who support her and allow her to increase her assortment of goods, which will attract more customers. 
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes

loans.name: C1912 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 31 years old.  She is married with two children aged between 6 months and 2 years.  She runs a small, well-organized store where she sells milk from 8am until 6pm every weekday. She has been operating her business successfully for two years. 

Eugenie is the leader of this group, called "DUFATANYE" in the local language, which means "to be together." She is the second person on the left.  The group consists of six women, all of whom have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase milk for their markets.  This loan will allow them all to provide better service to their customers, and to earn more profits. With this extra income they all earn, Eugenie and her group hope to save money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
María  de profesión conserje trabaja desde hace dos años en este oficio fijo, siendo su negocio la venta de cosméticos anteriormente, pero decide trabajar ya que las ventas eran pocas, y tiene una familia que apoyar, su esposo labora como carpintero.
El objetivo de María en todos estos años, ha sido la construcción de su vivienda el cual ha venido poco a poco con esta mejora y que ha sido a través de los financiamientos que Afodenic le ha otorgado en cinco ciclos continuo. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo repellara paredes interna, comprando arena, cemento, arenilla entre otros materiales. Hasta terminarla por completo y poder pasarce. Todavía habita en su pequeña casa en donde también ha venido haciendo las mejoras.
texts.en:
María is a janitor by profession.  She has been working in this fixed job for two years.  She previously sold cosmetics but decided to work since she wasn't making many sales and she has a family to support.  Her husband works as a carpenter.

María's goal over all these years has been to build her home which she has done little by little through loans from Afodenic which she has received over the course of five continuous loan cycles.  Now, with this new loan, María will plaster her internal walls, buying sand, cement and fine sand, amongst other materials.  She will finish the job completely.  She still lives in her little house where she has been making these improvements.

loans.use: to invest in buying sand, cement and fine sand to plaster her walls and continue improving the condition of her home

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.es:
Ruperto tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el caserío las Pampas ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, que se encuentra a una hora de distancia aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque,  vive con su esposa e hijo en una casa propia, la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz por ser una comunidad en desarrollo.  El distrito es una zona turística, agrícola y ganadera.

Ruperto se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de aves de corral y ganado vacuno, desde hace 5 años, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, conlosingresosquelogreobtner por la venta de los mismos podra solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

A solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para continuar comprando animales para engordarlos y luego venderlas con la finalidad detener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Ruperto es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad por sus ansias de superación cada día y darles una  mejor oportunidad a su hijo en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Ruperto tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el caserío las Pampas ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, que se encuentra a una hora de distancia aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque,  vive con su esposa e hijo en una casa propia, la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz por ser una comunidad en desarrollo.  El distrito es una zona turística, agrícola y ganadera.

Ruperto se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de aves de corral y ganado vacuno, desde hace 5 años, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, conlosingresosquelogreobtner por la venta de los mismos podra solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

A solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para continuar comprando animales para engordarlos y luego venderlas con la finalidad detener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Ruperto es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad por sus ansias de superación cada día y darles una  mejor oportunidad a su hijo en un futuro cercano.

loans.use: Compra de aves de corral y ganado vacuno

loans.name: Sijohidin

texts.ru: Сичохидин проживает в районе Кумсангир. Он женат. У него 5 детей. Ему 34 года. Он уже четыре года как занимается растениеводством. Не далеко от дома у него имеется большой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет кукурузу. Он берет кредит для закупа семян кукурузы, минеральных удобрений и солярки.
texts.en: Sijohidin lives in Qumsangir.  He is married and has five children.  He is 34 years old.  He has been farming for four years.   He has a large plot of land not far from home.  There he grows vegetables and plants corn.  He is taking out a loan to buy corn seed, mineral fertilizer, and diesel.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and diesel.

loans.name: Matanyaroh Ii Group

texts.en:
Nbalu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Nbalu was born in northern Sierra Leone 35 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has five children. For 20 years now, Nbalu has been selling market food: palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), fish, rice, salt, vegetables, etc. 

Together, Nbalu and her group members are seeking a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leone (SLL) from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

With her share of the loan, Nbalu is going to buy the above-mentioned foodstuffs in large quantities to add to her business stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, fish, rice, salt, vegetables, etc. in large quantities to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” es un grupo responsable que se mantiene unido y está conformada por 10 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades de comercio y en donde la Sra Carmen Rosa lo preside hace mas de 1 año.
Carmen Rosa es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando al menor de ellos en sus estudios. Carmen Rosa se dedica  a la   venta de productos de belleza llevando así mas de 4 años dedicándose a dicho rubro, a sus 41 años Carmen se siente feliz porque ha logrado sacar adelante con la ayuda de sus esposo  a sus hijos. El deseo de  Carmen es de terminar de construir su vivienda para   poder instalar una bodega en donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad y habilitar habitaciones para que pueda alquilar. Con el préstamo solicitado piensa comprar colonia, talcos, cremas, entre otros productos en oferta. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” están comprometido a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jesús Pan de Vida" is as responsible, united group comprised of ten people who are involved in different areas of commerce.  Mrs. Carmen Rosa has been the president of the group for over a year.

Carmen Rosa is married and has two children, the youngest of which is still in school.  Carmen Rosa has been selling beauty products for over four years.  At age 41, she is happy that she has been able to help provide for her husband and children.  Her dream is to build a house with enough space to set up a store to sell basic needs products, and to fix up rooms to be rented.

She plans to use the loan to buy cologne, talcum powder and creams, among other items.  The communal bank "Jesús Pan de Vida" is committed to continue working well with the Program.

loans.use: To buy cologne, talcum powder and creams.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Rosita has a retail shop that sells vegetables such as string beans. She has run this business for three years. Rosita has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Rosita is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Asunciona se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Asunciona es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
Asunciona, age 49, lives with her husband and children in her own house.  The house has no basic services.  It is located in the Mórrope district in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is known for its farming, cattle, and tourism.

Asunciona has been raising and selling livestock (pigs) for several years.  Her corral is in the area behind her house.  She feeds them balanced feed, and once they have reached their optimum growth she is able to sell them to her customers.  With the income that she gets she is able to pay for the household expenses.

She has requested a loan for 1,000 from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more animals and balanced feed.  Once they are fattened she sells them at different markets in her zone.  She does this to get a better price for them.  That way she can have more income in order to have a better quality of life.

Asunciona is a hard-working and tenacious person.  The only thing she wants is for her family to get ahead and succeed.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Sambalhundev

texts.en:
Sambalhundev is 63 years old and lives with her husband in a four-room apartment in Govisumber province of Mongolia. All five of her children are living separately. Her husband works as a controlling engineer at a construction agency. 

Sambalhundev started her business activity about one year ago. She operates a clothes trading business. She expanded her commercial space at the local market. Currently she has goods and materials that are worth 1,000,000 MNT. She is planning to have many commercial counters at the market. She takes loans from our bank and asks for discounts regularly. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and to expand her business activity.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 47 años, convive con Yolanda, su esposa. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Hugo y Yordan. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.La siembra de tubérculos como; papa, oyuco y oca, es su principal actividad económica; ya que desde niño creció entre la vegetación y los terrenos agrícolas, por lo que el trabajo en el campo, es lo que más le gusta. Desde que formo su propia familia, comenzó a sembrar en terrenos alquilados, pero gracias a la dedicación que brinda a sus sembríos los que cultiva, abona y cuida constantemente. Consigue vender sus cosechas, en el mercado central de su ciudad, obteniendo buenas ganancias; los que hicieron que ahora con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, obtuviera sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Minimizando así, gastos que le permiten obtener un dinero extra, además de pensar en aumentar la cantidad que produce. Por todo lo que avanzó, Juan; desea mejorar la construcción de su casa, para darles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que ahora puede proyectarse a otras adquisiciones.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo constante. Asimismo exhorta que le brinde nuevamente el pequeño préstamo, para continuar con sus objetivos.Juan de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales, los que esparcirá en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
47-year-old Juan lives with his wife Yolanda.  The couple have two children: Hugo and Yordan.  They live together in their own home which is located in the village of Ricrican.  Juan grows tubers such as potatoes, oyuco and oca.  This is his main business activity.  Juan grew up amongst vegetation and farmland and working in the fields is what he enjoys most.  When he formed his own family, he started sowing his crops on land which he rented.  However, thanks to the commitment that he puts into his work sowing, fertilizing and caring for his crops, he manages to sell his harvests in the central market in town, which makes him good profits.  With a lot of hard work and saving, he was able to buy his own farmland which minimized his expenses and enabled him to make extra money and think about increasing the quantity of produce that he grows.  While Juan has made a lot of progress, he would like to make improvements to his home so that he can provide his children with an excellent quality of life.  Now he is able to plan other acquisitions.

Juan belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his fifth loan from MFP.  He feels grateful for the constant support.  Juan is requesting a new small loan so that he can continue achieving his goals.  With your support, Juan will invest the money he has requested in buying natural fertilizers which he will spread over the next lot of crops he sows.

loans.use: to invest in buying natural fertilizers which he will spread over his crops

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 29 years old and single. For nine years, he has been doing motorbike repairs. He has employed four people in his business. He also does farming to earn extra income. He joined a group in Faulu Kenya where he is able to save his money, share business ideas and access loans easily, because the members of the group guarantee each others loans.

Benson hopes to become a successful businessman in the future. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a grinder and a welding machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy a grinder and a welding machine

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: María Del Socorro se dedica a brindar el servicio de taller de costura. Hace más de 40 años que posee este negocio. Ella es propietaria y administradora de su negocio que está ubicado en su vivienda, en el cual confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Inicio desde muy joven este negocio, mediante su Mama quien anteriormente se hacía cargo de la actividad. Ahora María solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en materia prima como telas, hilos, tijeras entre otros productos.
texts.en: Maria Del Socorro provides seamstress services. She has had her business for more than 40 years. She is the owner and administrator of her business which is located in her house. She produces all types of clothing. She started out her business when she was very young and her mother previously had the business. Maria requests a loan with the goal of investing in materials such as fabrics, thread, scissors and other products.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, scissors and other products.

loans.name: Duhurizehamwe/cymr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste fait partie du groupe Duhurizehamwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «mettons ensemble des forces   ». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant  de 3 ans, qui est scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est  3 ans de secondaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour cultiver de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Baptiste belongs to the Duhurizehamwe group.  The name of the group means “we're joining forces.”  He is 32 years old, married and has one 3 year-old child who is in school.  His educational level is three years of secondary school. Jean Baptiste grows rice.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. His strategy for growing his business is to use selected strains of rice seeds.  In the coming years, Jean Baptiste would like to buy other fields for growing rice.  He plans to educate and care for his children with the profits.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIOLETAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pascuala. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de mantas, venta de comida, punto VIVA, venta de arroz por mayor, venta de chicharron, pensión, venta de mascotas. 

La señora Pascuala  indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de sus vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y de arroz que trabaja hace diez años, aprendiendo el mismo de una de sus primas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de fruta y arroz), que cosechará de su ectaria en los Yungas y posteriormente lo comercializa en el puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con el grupo y la capacitación de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Violetas” (Violets) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Pascuala. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses to get ahead such as manufacturing blankets, selling food, providing phone service, selling rice in bulk, selling pork rinds, operating a dining hall, and selling pets.

Sra. Pascuala said that she joined Pro Mujer 1½ years ago after receiving an invitation from her neighbors. She currently has a business selling fruits and rice that she has managed for 10 years. Pascuala learned this trade from one of her cousins.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory of fruits and rice. These products are harvested by the hectare in Los Yungas and then sold at her vending post. Working in this manner has enabled her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Pascuala is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pascuala said that she enjoys sharing with the group and participating in the health seminars.

loans.use: to buy fruits and rice.

loans.name: Wilson Dario

texts.es:
A sus 32 años de edad Wilson, hombre emprendedor, nos cuenta como aprendió el arte de la costura de la mano de su hermana, la cual fue su maestra y apoyo.

Así las cosas comenzó a confeccionar su linea propia de prendas de vestir, con lo cual logra generar ingresos para su sostenimiento y el de su pequeña de tan solo 9 años de edad.

En la temporada de fin de año busca poder generar un mayor nivel de producción, dado que en esta época el potencial de ventas es mayor, y por lo tanto se encuentra esperanzado en generar mayores ingresos. Por tal motivo quiere poder comprar más insumos y materia prima para desarrollar su actividad.
texts.en: At 32 years old Wilson, an entrepreneur, tells us how he learned the art of hand sewing from his sister, who was his teacher and support.  So he began to make his own line of clothing, with which he manages to generate revenue for his livelihood and that of his daughter who is only 9 years old.  At year-end, he looks for the ability to generate a higher level of production, since at this time, the potential for sales is greater, and therefore, he is hoping to generate more income. For this reason he wants to be able to buy more supplies and raw materials for his work.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab is a young man of 19 who did not finish high school and has been working in the market selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. A year ago he managed to own his own kiosk, a well-known place in the market, where people come to buy their fresh fruits and vegetables.

Because there has been a lot of demand for the fruit that he sells, Ehab found that he need to buy a larger quantity than what he used to have so he can fulfill the customers' demand, and that’s why he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia bibi is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family: her husband, 9- and 5-year-old sons, and a daughter who is 7 years old. All of her children go to school to get an education.

Safia works as a seamstress at her home. Along with her main job, she is actively involves in her household works. Her husband operates a pesticide selling business. He mainly sells his products to the farmers, who buy pesticides from him for their lands. He has been running his business for many years.

Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan in buying pesticides in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the larger orders of his customers and increase his profits. Safia is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business and her family will use the increased income for their well being.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for resale.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Idalia cuenta con 30 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos la mayor se llama Estafany está cursando 2º de  secundaria, Daniel está cursando la primaria y Jonatán solo cuenta con 2 años de edad, su esposo se llama Daniel es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio cuenta con un negocio de tamales el cual ha sabido sacar adelante doña idalia dice que le gusta trabajar para a si ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos ya que quiere darles una buena educación para hacer de ellos unos grandes profesionistas, ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar los tamales, como son: masa, aceite, verdura, carne, etc.  También ella espera que su préstamo le ayude ya que le gustaría establecer una tienda de abarrotes.

Idalia pertenece al grupo las estrellas de san marcos el cual está integrado por 10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres a continuación serán mencionadas.
Santa Ana, Irma, Mara Itzel, leobarda, victoria, María Marcelina, Genoveva, leodegaria, Guadalupe. Todas ellas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de refrescos, pan, comida, pollos, venta de bolillos, productos de abarrotes, etc.
texts.en:
Idalia, age 30, is married and has three children.  Estefany, the oldest, is in her second year of high school.  Daniel is in elementary school, and Jonatán is only two years old.  Her husband, Daniel, is a farmer. 

She has a business selling tamales.  Idalia has known how to get ahead in the business.  She says that she likes to work in order to help her husband with the children’s expenses.  She wants to give them a good education so that they can become great professionals.

She will use the loan to buy supplies she uses to make the tamales.  She will buy things like dough, oil, vegetables, and meat, etc.  She also hopes that the loan will help her because she would like to establish a grocery store.

Idalia belongs to the “Las Estrellas de San Marcos” (The Stars of San Marcos) communal bank.  It is comprised of ten people, and all of them are women.  The members are:

Santa Ana, Irma, Mara Itzel, Leobarda, Victoria, María Marcelina, Genoveva, Leodegaria, and Guadalupe.

All of them are involved in commerce such as selling soft drinks, bread, food, chickens, bolillos, and grocery products, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies like dough, oil, vegetables, and meat, etc. to make tamales.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with seven children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been operating a goatmeat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a motor vehicle garage in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase goats for the sale of meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for the sale of meat.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a married woman who has two children. Mary Jane is 33 years old and resides at Poblacion 3, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mary Jane provides general repair services to local community members to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 30,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. Mary Jane has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Mary Jane wants to build a house and support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Juana, es una joven de 26 años de edad, nacida en la comunidad llamada La Rica localizada en Jinotega, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, ella es comerciante vende ropa y mercadería en General desde hace 5 años.  Su negocio o inicio con la iniciativa de independizarse y generar ingresos por ella misma al mismo tiempo sentir útil de apoyar en el hogar y sus hijos para que no les falte nada. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como ropa, zapatos, camisas, útiles escolares. Pues se acerca la temporada escolar y quiere tener surtida su tienda para ofrecer nuevos y mejores productos. Por lo pronto quiere mejorar las ventas, introducir nueva mercadería que le ayuden hacer crecer su negocio. Siempre buscando como mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 26-years old and was born in the community called La Rica, located in Jinotega.  She is married, has two children, and is a merchant who has sold clothes and general merchandise for the past five years.  Her business began with the goal of becoming independent and generating income for herself.  At the same time, she wanted to feel useful and support the home and her children, so they might want for nothing.

She requests this loan to buy merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, shirts, and school supplies.  The school year will begin shortly, and she wants to have her store stocked in order to offer new and better products.  For now, she wants to improve sales and introduce new merchandise that will help her business grow.  She is always looking for ways to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, shirts, and school supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and a farmer; she is married to Patrick who is a business man. They are blessed with two children aged 15 and 10 years respectively. She has been rearing poultry for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chicks

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines, where she is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.
Faith has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Faith hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.

loans.name: Shukuru Group

texts.fr: Nous avons commencé ces activités depuis le bas âge. Nous les avons entamé en 2004 à deux, chose que nous avons hérité de nos parents", tels sont les dires d'Amuri. Lors de l'expérience passée sur deux hectares cultivés, la récolte a été de sept tonnes de paddy pour deux mille dollars dont sept cent-cinquante de charges et mille deux cent-cinquante dollars de gain. Comme obstacle, il cite l'insuffisance de moyens financiers à injecter dans l'activité mais espère avec le temps produire une grande quantité afin d'améliorer sa situation familiale (construire une belle maison, acquérir d'autres parcelles,...). Il est accompagné sur la photo par sa sœur Chantal qui porte une blouse rouge.

loans.use: Sarclage, traçage, achat engrais et produits phytosanitaires, paiement de la main d'oeuvre

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Bread is one of the most consumed foods in Togo and particularly in Aného (Prefecture of the Lakes). Born in 1977, Mrs. Abla A. has has been making and selling bread for 7 years already. She is married and a mother of three (3) children. Her husband has been unemployed for the last few years also helps with the business. The growing business makes it possible for Mrs. A. to meet the family's needs. The exceptional quality of the bread she sells has brought her many loyal customers. Bread retailers come in great numbers for their own supplies. However, she cannot meet the market needs because she is limited in the production of the bread. She is thus looking to build a new oven and increase the daily production. Unfortunately, her income does not enable her to cover all the expenses of this undertaking. She is thus asking for a loan of $850 to build a second oven. This will, in turn, increase the family income and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Le pain est l’une des denrées alimentaires les plus consommées au Togo et particulièrement à Aného (Préfecture des Lacs). Née en 1977, Madame A. Abla exerce comme activité la fabrication et la vente du pain depuis 7 ans déjà. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Son époux qui est sans emploi depuis quelques années l’aide dans ses tâches. L’activité très florissante, permet à Madame A. de satisfaire dans une grande mesure les besoins de la famille. La qualité exceptionnelle du pain qu’elle vend sur le marché fait qu’elle a une clientèle abondante. Les revendeurs de pain viennent en grand nombre s’en approvisionner. Aujourd’hui, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire tout le monde car elle est limitée dans la production. Elle cherche à fabriquer un nouveau four en vue d’augmenter la production quotidienne du pain. Malheureusement, son économie ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les dépenses que cette restructuration nécessiterait. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour construire un second four. Ca permettra d’augmenter le revenu familial et améliorer les conditions de vie.

loans.use: Build a second oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
3 years ago, Mrs. N., 42  years old, opened her own shoe shop and  small, shoe factory.  She sells different kinds of women's shoes like sandles, closed shoes and others .Her monthly rent is Rs 5000($77). She began her business with a loan from BPW Patan. Now she is requesting her third loan to further expand her business for purchasing raw materials. Her economic condition is low so she needs a loan to further expand her business. With her increased income she plans to help her husband in the family's financial matters.
Her husband's name is Sobiyat Man N.. He is college teacher at the Patan Campus. Mrs. N. has two son,13 and 8 year old.The youngest daughter is in grade 6 and  the oldest daughter is in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoe making

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat S. is a 32 year old widow who has one child who is too young to attend school. Phat S. earns $9 a day selling fruit. This loan is to help her mother, who currently earns $4 a day selling dry fish, who would like to expand her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.use: for her mother to purchase more dry fish

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
