“I have a business in which I sell new clothes from my home that customers purchase in installments.  I would like to invest in additional merchandise since the cold season and my customers have begun to request warmers clothing.  I am requesting $1,200 to invest in my business.”
 Translated from Spanish by Christian García
, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio de ropa nueva en mi casa la cual vendo en abonos, pero me gustaría invertir en más mercancía ya que se acerca la temporada de frío y mis clientes me lo están solicitando”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertí en mi negocio.

loans.use:
Invest in my business
Invertir en mi negocio

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor de María belongs to the communal bank of Las Lumbreras, of Jr. Tupac Amaru of the AH New Sunrise District of Callería, Deparment of Ucayali. She is 49 years old ans is a mother of 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman, and henceforth with her first loan from Manuela Ramos decided to start her own general store.

She currently has a general store which she serves together with her children. She gets up very early to make breakfast for the children who are still going to school and later looks after her business.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for S. 1,200 (Aprox. $400 USD), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will expand the shop and will buy 2 boxes of milk, 1 sack of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of sodas, and 1 container of oil.

Flor de María is very happy to have her 6 children healthy and has the great challenge of keeping them in school and is always supportive of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Flor de María pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Lumbreras, del Jr. Tupac Amaru del Del A. H. Nuevo Amanecer Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es pescador, es así que Flor de María, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto de abarrotes. En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto de abarrotes, el mismo que atiende junto a sus hijos, se levantan muy temprano para hacer el desayuno para sus hijos que van a la escuela y después atiende su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200 (US$ 400.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 2 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 2 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite. Flor de María está muy contenta de tener a sus 6 hijos sanos y tiene el gran reto de mantenerlos en la escuela, y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchasing general products and expanding the shop / Compra de productos variados (abarrotes).  Ampliación del local.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
So how do you make bricks? Ask Safina, she will tell you. You bake them!

Actually, the first thing you do is find a plot of land where there is an adobe (a natural building material mixed from sand, clay, and straw) quality to the soil. Then you make a wooden mold in which you will wet the earth, making mud and slopping it into the molds. When the mold is dry enough to keep its form, you release the bricks from the mold. You let them dry enough to be stacked. Create a 2ft x 2ft hole at the bottom of the stack . This is where you will build your fire. For three days you will tend the fire, not too, just smoldering, until all the bricks have been baked. After baking you will cover with straw so the rains don’t erode away all your hard work. You will be able to sell each brick for about five cents.

Safina has been doing this for about 4 years. She will use her loan to pay for school fees and to pay her workers in her business.

loans.use: Safina plans to use her loan to pay school fees and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 35 years old, married, and has three children (ages 4, 5, and 13). Together with her husband, she also takes care of a 16- and a 17-year-old. Zainab owns a shop where she sells general items from 7 am to 9 pm daily. She started the business in 2000 and now makes a monthly profit of about US$280.

Zainab hopes to receive a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She is a member of the loan group Jikwamue 1.

loans.use: Increase the stock of a general store

loans.name: Ni Kadek Sulastri

texts.id:
Ni Kadek Sulastri has been skilled in making Canang Sari (Hindunese prayer aid). This skill was obtained from her parents who also sold Canang Saris. Besides making daily prayer supplies, Ni Kadek Sulastri also make larger scale prayer supplies, like for wedding and other major Hindu feasts. When she gets major order, she hires temporary workers to help. From her village's local group, Ni Kadek Sulasti applied for loan from DINARI foundation. This fund is needed to expand her business so she can increase her business capacity. Almost every day, Ni Kadek SUlastri purchases coconut leaves and flowers in the market for her business needs. Ni Kadek Sulastri has regular suppliers in "Negara" maret. She spends about $11 every day to purchase ingredients, and she earns about $16.5 in sales daily, so she earns $5.50 profit daily. This profit was used to pay for her family's daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Kadek Sulastri sejak kecil sudah terampil membuat Canang Sari ( sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ). Ketrampilan ini didapat dari orang tuanya yang juga adalah seorang penjual Canang Sari. Selain membuat untuk sarana sembahyangan sehari- hari, Ni Kadek Sulastri juga melayani untuk sarana sembahyangan dalam jumlah besar seperti perkawinan dan juga upacara adat Hindu yang lainnya. Jika Ni kadek sulastri mendapatkan pesanan yang banyak maka ia akan mencari tenaga kerja harian. Melalui kelompok yang ada didesanya Ni Kadek Sulastri mendapat Modal pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari. Modal ini sangat dibutuhkan untuk menunjang di dalam usahanya untuk memenuhi dan melengkapi bahan baku. Hampir setiap hari Ni Kadek Sulastri membeli beraneka macam bunga dan janur di pasar untuk keperluan usahanya. Ni Kadek Sulastri mempunyai pelanggan bunga tetap yang setiap hari menjual bunga di pasar Negara. Modal yang dihabiskan setiap hari dapat mencapai Rp.100.000,-. Pendapatan kotor dapat mencapai Rp.150.000,-.dengan keuntungan Rp.50.000,- setiap harinya. Dari keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, e.g. flowers and coconut leaves

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
The sale of cosmetics is the main source of income for Edith, a 23 year-old caring mother. Edith started this business 5 years ago when there was a lack of employment opportunities in her native city Juliaca. Every day Edith tirelessly traverses the streets for hours upon end with the objective of finding more customers. This way at the end of each month she generates more income so that she can care for her young son. This hard working mother together with her son looks to the future with optimism and hope. She would like to invest more money in her business with the end goal of generating more returns. She looks forward to receiving your selfless support.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La venta de cosméticos de belleza se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de Edith, madre joven y muy cariñosa de 23 años de edad. Ella incursionó en este negocio hace 5 años ante la carencia de oportunidades de empleo en su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Edith desde que se inició en este negocio, transita durante largas horas incansablemente por las calles de su ciudad con el fin de obtener mayor cantidad de pedidos y así cada fin de mes obtener mejores ingresos económicos para que su pequeño niño no pase limitaciones económicas.Esta emprendedora madre junto a su menor hijo ve su futuro con mucho optimismo y esperanza, es por ello que desea aumentar el monto de su capital para incrementar la cantidad de sus ingresos, con el objetivo de continuar con su proyecto recurre a tu solidario corazón con la esperanza de recibir tu apoyo desinteresado.

loans.use: To offer a wider variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Sarfraz's Group

texts.en: Sarfraz has been married for the last twenty years and has six children: two boys and four girls.  She lives in the big city of Lahore in Pakistan. None of her kids could attend school because of poor financial conditions. Her and her husband make wood and beaded curtains. These are very beautiful curtains that are used as decorative items in homes.  They need a loan to buy wood and beads in bulk.  Her group also includes the following women: Riffat B. (who wants to buy tires for her vehicle), Nabeela B. (who embellishes clothes with sequins and gems), Mubeena B. (who will buy a rickshaw) and Nargis B. (who wants to expand her family’s used items business).

loans.use: to expand a manufacturing business

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
Ni Ketut S.'s business nowadays are in Cake sales. Daily, she makes cakes, then sells it in Badung market or offers it around. Starting with buying cake ingredients in the morning, afterwards prepares and fries the cake for selling in the evening. Besides selling in Badung market, she also offers and consigns it to her food stall clients. Income is sufficient for daily household needs. She hopes to be given capital loan to expand this cake business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Ni Ketut S. sekarang ini adalah sebagai penjual kue. Sehari-harinya, dia membuat kue lalu menjualnya ke Pasar Badung atau dibawa berkeliling. Dimulai dengan berbelanja bahan membuat kue pada pagi hari, setelah itu dia menyiapkan dan menggoreng kue lalu menjualnya pada sore hari. Selain menjual ke Pasar Badung, dia juga berjalan dan menitipkan di warung-warung yang sudah menjadi langganannya. Penghasilannya cukup untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga sehari-hari. Dia berharap diberi pinjaman modal untuk bisa mengembangkan lagi usaha membuat kue ini.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Toshbolta.

texts.ru: Хасанов  Тошболта проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет 6 детей. Ему 45 лет и 10 лет он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , но теперь необходимо пристроить сарай, но на стройматериалы денег нет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и сделать  ремонт.  Это поможет улучшить условия ухода  и увеличить пространство. Погасить кредит Тошболта сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Пристройка сарая..

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana started her business to help her husband with the household expenses and to have an activity that would keep her busy, but also allow her to care for her children and maintain her house. She began her grocery store with her mother’s help since she was unable to work and she didn’t have anyone to care for her children for about three years. She hopes to succeed and put a lot of effort into her business to provide her customers with good service and earn good profits.

She needs a $200 loan, which she will repay in six months, to restock her merchandise and to buy new products for the store that customers have been requesting. With your help, San Juana will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

San Juana inició el negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de la familia y tener alguna actividad para mantenerse ocupada y al mismo tiempo cuidar a sus hijos y realizar las actividades de la casa. Comenzó su tienda de abarrotes con la ayuda de su mama debido a que ella ya no pudo trabajar porque tuvo hijos y no tenia quien se los cuidara hace aproximadamente 3 años. Ella desea salir adelante y echarle muchas ganas al negocio para dar un buen servicio al cliente y así mismo para obtener buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y para comprar nuevos productos en la tienda que le han estado solicitando. con tu ayuda San Juana saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and restock grocery store.

loans.name: Askarjon

texts.en: P. Askarjon is 25 years old, single and lives with his large family, which consists of six people, including his parents, younger brothers and sisters. Although quite young, he is already the main bread-winner at home and widely know as a very active and responsible fellow. For the last six years, he has made a living selling types of candy that are very popular in this area. Today, his stand is one of the best-known places in the entire food market. He is a very cheerful person, always glad to meet everyone who comes to his shop. All of his clients are satisfied with his service. Askarjon is trying to make his assortment of candies more competitive and attractive to his customers. He has applied for a $600 loan, which he will pay back in 12 months, to buy more candies and increase the range of items he has to sell. Your support will be of great assistance, and he and his family thank you sincerely for your support.

loans.use: To buy more candy to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em C. lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province and she is a vegetable farmer. Since her field is far from irrigation and she cannot generate water to support her field, Mrs. Em C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump for this purpose and she hopes to produce a better crop to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Sam Yorng, assists his wife in the field. Mrs. Em C. is 68 years old and the mother of three children who are all married and they usually give some money to support their parents because they are too old. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a pump to water her field

loans.name: Celia Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Celia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene 45 años de edad y su esposo es agente policial, le tiene tres hijos de 9,21 y 23 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian y el mayor trabaja. Doña Celia tiene una pulpería con cinco años de experiencias,  su negocio lo inicio con liquidación de su trabajo anterior pues trabajaba en la alcaldía de Managua, todo su capital lo invertio en la venta lo cual fue bueno ya que tiene algo propio negocio  de subsistir las ventas son buena y a veces pocas los repartidores de productos abecés le  dejan la mercadería al crédito para el día siguiente, que es cuando no tiene todo el capital para pagar al momento, con este negocio  también puede ver por su familia, estando en la casa. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de insumos diarios y productos variados para ofertar a sus clientes. A largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Y dar estudios a sus hijos
texts.en:
Celia lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación in the capital city of Managua. She is 45 years old, and her husband is a police agent. They have three children ages 9, 21 and 23. Two of her kids are still in school, while the oldest is now working. Celia has five years of experience running her grocery store, a business she started after losing her previous job at the Managua mayor’s office. All her capital was invested into the sale, which was good since now she has something of her own for support. Sales are good, and sometimes the persons who deliver her products let her have the merchandise on credit for the next day but she doesn’t have the capital at this time to pay. With this business, she can also see to caring for her family. Her request for this loan is to invest in her enterprise, buying a variety of daily use products to offer to her customers. Her long-term aim is to make improvements to the family’s home and provide an education for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es: La señorita Hazel Ivania el barrio Enrique Bermúdez 380, barrió que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene la edad de 22 años,  se encuentra soltera, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y útiles escolares, aparte de tener su negocio trabaja en atención al cliente en la empresa DHL, donde su negocio lo inicio con su novio ambos recogieron para establecerlo, también la señorita Hazel esta estudiando en la universidad y uno de sus planes de vida es poder  finalizar sus estudios y hacer mas grande su negocio, por eso que en estos últimos años ha trabajado con  créditos que Afodenic otorga para invertirlo en su negocio, solicitando actualmente un monto de C$ 9,000.00 aun plazo de 10 meses para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y poder de esta forma incrementar sus clientes, planes de futuro es poder ir diversificando sus productos y buscar nuevos segmentos de mercado.

loans.use: Comprar ropa para niños y adultos

loans.name: Morbb

texts.en: Mrs. Morbb Y. is 48 years old, and she lives in Krodas Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Phoung Hour, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. On this plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, which affects their crop. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Morbb Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to enable her field to make her crop more productive. She has three children -- one of whom is a palm juice collector, while another is a laborer who has been hired by a villager to plow a field, and the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La señora Grimanesa, socia del BC “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cecina y chorizo de cerdo, así como a la venta de carne fresca de cerdo, además tiene dos puestos de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  cerdos de diferentes tamaños para luego sacrificarlos y preparar sus productos y así poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, también quiere arreglar su casa y el ambiente donde prepara la cecina y chorizo que vende.

La señora Grimanesa  tiene 62 años de edad,  es madre de 07 hijos quienes ya son independientes, ahora vive con una de ellas quien la apoya en sus actividades y sobre todo la acompaña. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es arreglar bien su casa para poner su negocio.
texts.en:
Grimanesa, member of the Saint Ann Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She cooks and sells pork jerky and sausage, as well as sells fresh pork. She has two booths at the central market in the city. With this loan of $675, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy different size pigs to butcher and prepare for her products so that she will be able to meet her customers' orders. She also wants to fix up her house and the area where she prepares the jerky and sausage that she sells. Grimanesa is 62 years old. She is the mother of seven children who are already grown. She now lives with one of her daughters who helps her with her work and accompanies her with everything. She is grateful for the loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to fix up her home for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and fix up the area where she prepares jerky and sausage

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
German Antonio L. C. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don German tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 38 años y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 36 años también labora por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 32 años todos sus hijos están casados y trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida labora en la atención de una comideria en su casa de habitación, sus propósitos son de darle el mantenimiento adecuado a su camión por lo que sus clientes exigen lo mejor de sus servicios sus sueños son de establecer un billar para que este le genere mas ingresos para su familia además que este negocio es solicitado por lo jóvenes y obtendría afluencia de clientes además podría heredarle a su hijos este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan un respaldo para los ingresos sus sueños son de cambiar su unidad de transporte y que a la ves este sea moderno y grande para que sus clientes tengan una excelente comodidad en su unidad.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el transporte de personal de la zona rural a la ciudad y viceversa, la ubicación de su negocio en de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 40 años, Don German inicia su negocio en Managua con fondos propios ya que comercializaba con mercancías vendía productos como: cuadros de pintura, jarrones y electrodomésticos pero este tipo de negocio le fue difícil mantenerlo por que algunas veces no vendía toda la mercadería por lo que decide establecer otro negocio de auto lavado pero no tenia mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio  por lo que no duro mucho este tipo de negocio y decide establecer el negocio del transporte de personas de la zona rural a la ciudad por lo que necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajosa que necesita darle mejoras a su camión que es el que se encarga de trasladar a las personas y necesita comprar: llantas, frenos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
German Antonio L. C. is 58 years old, partnered, and has three sons (ages 38, 36, and 32) who are all married and self-employed. His partner runs a small restaurant in their home. German's goal is to provide proper maintenance for his truck to give his customers high-quality service. He would also like to upgrade to a larger and more modern vehicle so that his customers are more comfortable. His dream is to have a pool hall, which would generate greater income for his family. As a pool hall is in great demand from young people, he would have a large clientele and he would be able to pass on the business to his sons so they would have adequate support.

For forty years, German has offered transportation between the city and rural areas. He began his business in Managua, using his own money. Previously he had sold products such as picture frames, vases, and appliances. That business was difficult to maintain because he often was unable to sell all his merchandise. So, he decided to start a car wash, but he did not have enough experience to make that business a success. Finally, he began his transportation business.

German is requesting a loan for working capital in order to make repairs to his truck. He will purchase tires, brakes, and other parts.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
Mrs. Samai M., 38, and her husband, Mr. Leang Sok, 46, live in a small village suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They were married in 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are in school and another one stays at home. 

Samai has been an instant noodles factory worker for three years. Now she wants to quit her job and create her own business by make buddhist materials (see the photo) that people use for buddhism ceremonry for selling. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for over ten years. Her husband’s motorbike is very old, it has broken very often, and they lack enough money to change it for a new one. So, Samai is requesting her first loan of $300 to make the replacement and some part of the money to run her new business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and some part run her new business.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: K. Manzura first applied to MicroInvest in 2008, when she took a development loan for to stabilize her business in bijouterie selling. She brings it from China and sells it in the Panjshanbe bazaar. Manzura has worked with bijouterie for one year, and now she wants to widen her existing assortment and open a specialized trade outlet for sales. Manzura applied to Kiva for a business support loan of  3500 STJ to import Italian bijouterie because it’s the popular and modern good in Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import Italian bijouterie

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Khim Ou Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people living in Mkak village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sok Khim O. is the 22-year-old village bank president. She is a chicken middle-woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kuy Heng Long, is a farmer wH. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sok Khim O. has a child wH. is just two years old.

loans.use: Purchasing more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Macario

texts.es: Macario tiene 44 años de edad, es casado hace de 12 años, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales, uno de ellos vive fuera de casa. Desde su infancia estuvo dedicado a los cultivos agrícolas, ya que sus padres sembraban numerosas hectáreas de tubérculos como la papa y el olluco en terrenos de la comunidad. En esos terrenos que la comunidad les brindaba, a cambio, ellos retribuían en los trabajos para la  comunidad. Por ello que cuando formó familia lo primero que hizo fue inscribirse como comunero, para que de ese modo pueda seguir haciendo uso de los terrenos de cultivo, ya sean de regadío o temporales. Macario en todo este tiempo viene sembrando papas y alverjas, asimismo cría animales, y hace 2 años puso una bodega en su casa para que su esposa se dedicara a ella. Todos estos negocios, le causan gran satisfacción y complacencia, por ello pese a las dificultades de las plagas que acechan a sus cultivos sigue muy motivado de invertir y trabajar con mucho cariño en sus siembras, las cuales por muchos años le han brindado comodidad y bienestar a su hogar. Macario es el presidente de su banco comunal, donde conduce con mucha serenidad los diversos dilemas entre los integrantes. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y da ejemplo de puntualidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de insecticidas para controlar la plaga en sus cultivos de papa y habas.
texts.en:
Macario is 44 years old, has been married for 12 years and has 5 children, one of whom lives away from home. Since childhood he has worked in agriculture as his parents sowed tubers such as potatoes and ulluco on many hectares of community land. In areas where the community offered them land, they reciprocated by working for the community. As such, the first thing the family did was to register as commoners with joint tenure of the land so that they could continue cultivating it, whether irrigated or temporary. The whole time, Macario has been planting potatoes and peas, and at the same time rearing animals. Two years ago he put a grocery shop into his house so that his wife could run it. All of these businesses give him great joy and satisfaction so, despite the difficulties of pests threatening his crops, he remains highly motivated and dedicated, sowing his seeds with much care. For many years his crops have provided comfort and wellbeing for his family. Macario is the president of his community bank, where he promotes diplomacy during the various dilemmas amongst the members. This is his 7th loan with MFP and he is an example of punctual repayments. The money that he is asking for now is to buy insecticides to control the pests on his potato and broad bean crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric O. is a 46-year-old married man and father of three children, one of whom is a boy. According to him, all of his children are in school pursuing education at senior and junior high school levels. His wife is a hard-working woman. She is a trader. Eric lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Oda, a busy trading and farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Eric runs a grocery store by the roadside. He procures his stock of grocery from suppliers who come to distribute in vans. Eric has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his inventory. He is hopeful that he will be able to increase his working capital and help him improve his savings to support his family, especially, his kids education.

loans.use: To procure groceries.

loans.name: Nalongo's Group

texts.en: M. Nalongo is the leader of the Mabira group that has been together for 10 years. She is a hardworking and talented lady when it comes to sales and this is why her retail shop business is doing well. Her shop mainly sells soda, juice and mineral water in Najjembe, Mabira. She sells to customers in the stopping vehicles along the highway. You find that most of Nalongo’s customers show up once in a while but because there are so many cars on the highway, this does not matter so much to her, most especially now that she employs girls and boys to do the selling since they have speed. Nalongo is married with eight children, three of whom are still in school, while she cares for two dependants. She needs a loan partly for paying school fees as well as to buy more crates of soda and mineral water for her stock.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks like soda, mineral water and juice.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en la Provincia Rioja, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años, 04 hijos, el mayor ya independiente y los tres menores aun son estudiantes. 

Alejandrina, es una mujer muy jovial, alegre y optimista que se inicio vendiendo verduras en pequeñas cantidades que los comerciantes mayoristas lo daban a crédito confiados en su responsabilidad a la que ella no defraudó en ningún momento, poco a poco fue haciéndose D. su capital hasta que se instaló en un puesto D. ventas del mercado central D. la ciudad D. Nueva Cajamarca, cambiando el negocio D. la venta D. verduras por la D.  frutas.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar frutas D. la Región muy variados  y D. muy buena calidad para preparar jugos o para comerlos como postre, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos D. naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas, piñas  y plátanos verdes y guineos en racimos para así mantener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Alejandrina, sueña con tener un negocio D. venta D. ropa. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandrina belongs to the communal bank “Las Violetas II” (The Violets II). She lives in Nueva Cajamarca, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is married, 48 years old and has four children – the oldest of which lives independently. The three younger children are students. Alejandrina is a very jovial, happy and optimistic woman, who started selling vegetables in small quantities that wholesale merchants would give to her on credit. It was her responsibility not to defraud on her payments at any time. Little by little she was making capital that way, until she installed a stand at the central market in the city of Cajamarca, changing her business from the sale of vegetables to the sale of fruits. Now, she has faithful clientele who come to the Market daily to buy her varied, high-quality local fruit to make juices or to eat as desert. She always attends to her customers with a smile. With this loan of S/ 2,000.00, she wants to invest in buying sacks of oranges, tangerines, lemons, grapefruit, golden apples, pineapples, and bunches of green plantains and bananas in order to keep her business stocked and to give her clients what they need. Alejandrina dreams of having a clothing business. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her execute her business, and also to the many women that want her to grow personally and in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Eliana Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Eliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil Conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (2do grado),  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas al paso. 

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las charlas  y los encuentros de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Señora Eliana belongs to the communal bank, 'Flor Azangarina II," which is located in the district of Azangaro, in the province of Azangaro, in the deparment of Puno. She is 29, married, and has 3 children. She studied through her second year of secondary school and lives in the Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy supplies to make her meals she sells as a street vendor. Her biggest dream is to start a grocery store. She likes the savings, the chats, and the meetings she has at her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to make the meals she sells as a street vendor

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel V. y su esposo el señor Jesús Rodolfo Ávila, tiene una bonita familia de tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. 
En esté momento tiene un problema dos de sus hijos termina un ciclo escolar y tiene que liquidar las colegiaturas y pagar los gastos de la graduación, pero en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder liquidar estos pagos.
 Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así sus hijos puedan terminar la escuela y tener su graduación.
Ella trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de producción y El señor Jesús es empleado de una  fábrica en la elaboración de artículos electrónicos, estos son los ingresos que tiene para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel V. and her husband Jesus Rodolfo Avila have a nice family of three sons who are studying, two of them finished the school year and they need to pay the graduation fee and tuition cost. They do not have the money to pay the fees, so they are requesting a loan that will help her children to finish school and have their graduation.

She works in a factory in the production area and Mr. Jesus is a factory worker in the electronics department, and their income is what helps them to provide and offer the best they can to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay graduation fee and tuition for their kids

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tamasha is one of two members of the Tumaini borrower group of Msamvu in Morogoro. She is 35 years old and is married. She has four children, ages five, 10, 15, and 18.

Five years ago, Tamasha started her own cafe business, selling food. She works 12 hours a day and gains a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Tamasha's second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested a loan in the amount of 250,000 in order to buy more rice, wheat, and sugar.

With the profit she expects to get from the use of this loan, Tamasha hopes to pay school fees, save money, and expand her business.

Grace is the member of this borrower group. Like Tamasha, she has requested a loan in the amount of 250,000 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat, and sugar

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Tanglet Thai Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tanglet T. is a group leader of four who all live in Preak Thmei village in Kandal province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products for selling to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Vong Choeurn, is a hairdresser. Mrs. Tanglet T. is 54 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are workers while another is a hairdresser; one is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

One member in this group has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to earn more income.

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita is engaged in the vending business.  She sells vegetables, fish and dressed chicken in their village using her three wheeled bicycle as her service.  Through her business, she was able to send her children to school and finish their high school education.  It was not t easy for her to gain sufficient income for them to pursue their studies in college because she is the only one looking for money to support all of them. Levita wanted to expand her business and increase her products in order to gain more profit. Thus, she wanted to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 for the growth of rolling store business that very helpful in their daily living.

Levita is 52 years old and already a widow.  She have three children and they are living in Roxas Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 26, is widowed and has a young child. She lives in Battambong Province with her sister and her child.

K. is engaged in a business sewing Cambodian traditional clothes, earning an income of US$5 per day. Her daily expenses do not allow her to save enough income to improve her business. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a new sewing machine that is reliable enough to handle heavy work in the business. By doing so, she hopes her current business will be improved, and she is able to generate more income for household use.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph R. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 31 years old and married. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. His main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling gasoline and rice in the local community. Joseph has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of gasoline and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap C. is a villager in Kou Chen Leaeng village in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business. Her husband, Mr. Hong Sambo, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has five children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Khloak

texts.en:
Khloak D., 30, is a married woman and mother. She retails both new and used clothes that she orders in bulk from wherever they are sold at a reasonable price. She was busy selling her clothes at the market when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

Khloak D. is married to Koy Sarim, age 30, who is a motor taxi driver. They have two minor children who are not enrolled in school. 

Khloak D. conducts her investment very smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who need to buy her clothes because she is skilled in public relations and is very satisfied person.

Khloak D. faces a problem with transporting her clothes to the market because she has no vehicle. Because of that, she decided to request her second loan to purchase a new motorbike which she will use as transportation. With the remainder of the loan she will buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to transport her clothes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. Her customers are usually friends, neighbors and residents. Helen is married with a child and she is 32 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Humberto de 40 años y sus dos hijos; Edson de 18 y Yesica de 15, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Aunque sabe que la mecánica es un trabajo duro, no se amilana y trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio, el cual le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo Nelida ha logrado que su taller de mecánica se gane un buen nombre en su localidad, es por eso que es muy concurrido.
Lo que más le gusta es trabajar con los carros y ayudar a arreglarlos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados repuestos que necesita para arreglar los autos. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar el espacio de su taller y así poder atender a más clientes a la vez.

Este es el primer préstamo de Nelida con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más repuestos para autos, con lo cual desea brindar un mejor servicio para los carros de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelida is 34 years old and is a mother in a very happy and loving family. She lives in a house she owns along with her husband Humberto, 40, and their two children, Edson, 18, and Yesica, 15, who are the motive for all her efforts. Although she knows that being an auto mechanic is hard work, she does not shy away and works arduously to make headway for her business, which has provided the necessary income to support her family. With a lot of effort, Nelida has given her auto repair shop a good name in her area, and as a result it gets a lot of business. What she likes most about her job is working with cars and helping fix them, something she has been doing for six years. The thing she considers the most difficult is loading the heavy parts needed to make the repairs. In the future, she hopes to expand the size of her workshop so she can be able to serve more customers at a time. This is Nelida's first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she has to make all her payments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and is always active in the meetings. With the loan of 1,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more auto parts with the hope of providing a better service for her customers' cars.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Consorcia's Group

texts.en: Consorcia G.'s main source of income comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She is 47 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from Barangay Sto. Nino, Pagadian City. Consorcia has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Consorcia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Consorcia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Consorcia is the leader of a 4 member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a single parent with two children. She is 32 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this makes her happy. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 30,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita opened a small store to add to her family's income.  Primarily, she and her husband are rice farmers.  She said that sometimes they are really short on money because it costs a lot to support the education of their five children.  But still, she works hard to help provide for their needs.

Lucita applied to CEVI and requested a loan of Php6, 000.  She told CEVI that she would use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Litas

texts.en:
Litas E. is from the village of Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 45 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Litas owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Litas has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Litas joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Litas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Litas is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Litas from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her store's product offering.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind and her husband own a shoe store in Bethlehem city. They started working in this field 20 years ago. They have seven children who are all college or school students.

They sell women, men and kid's shoes in their store. Hind helps her husband run the store, especially in the high seasons, which are usually summer and feasts. This is not Hind's first loan from FATEN. She is one of the most committed borrowers. She is taking this loan to purchase, in cash, summer stock goods as they are expecting it to be a good season as usual.

Hind and her husband appear in their store in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase summer stock

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two boys who attend school. She has been selling eggs wholesale to shops for the past year and wants to use the loan to purchase more eggs. Once a week, she buys 300 trays from farmers, who deliver them for free, and then sells about 50 trays per day. The main challenge to her business is that she struggles to have capital to purchase stock to meet the demand.

She currently rents her home and has electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. She hopes to expand her business and open a shop in the future. Mariam describes herself as very hard working.

loans.use: To buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Madame AÏssatou N. est aide-comptable au niveau de l’hôpital depuis 6 ans. Avec sa carte professionnelle, elle est autorisée à vendre à certains des produits médicaux dentaires comme du genre claf 1g, ampi 1g, bresto (10) …. Etc.  C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un prêt de 250 000 FCFA pour s’approvisionner en produits dentaires pour développer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. AÏssatou N. has been an accountant's assistant at a hospital for six years. With her professional card, she is authorized to sell certain medical and dental products like claf 1g, ampi 1g, bresto (10), etc. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 250,000 FCFA to stock up on dental products to build up her business.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying dental products for resale

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en:
Madame Adzo A. is 33 years old and is married with one child. Her husband is a teacher. She runs a boutique selling cloth, ribbons, buttons, and other items with which to make clothes. She has had her store since 2006.

Madame Adzo requests a loan of 450,000 CFA to purchase more buttons, cloth, and other items for her store. This is her third loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and buttons and other items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 50 years old, married and the father of 11 children who range in age from 6 months to 20 years old. Nine of his children are currently in school.

He lives in Kitale town in Western Kenya, where he has practiced farming for 25 years and now has one employee. He also owns a mill and mini shop near his home, and sells maize, beans and milk to people who live nearby. His biggest challenges are marketing and fighting crop diseases. 

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 62,400 to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will use this cow to increase his milk production and, with it, his income so that he can better meet his family needs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline A. O. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 12 and 1, for whom she hopes to provide quality education. 

She hawks secondhand clothes in Kisumu. She has been in this business for the last three years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that during the rainy seasons she is not able to maximize sales as she moves from place to place. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more secondhand clothes to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open her own boutique. She also hopes to achieve a clientele base of about one thousand people. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga. She is 29 years-old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the selling of dry goods in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Marites joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Marites is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to provide additional capital for her business. This loan will be the eight loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is a married woman who lives in the village of Tapon in the municipality of Dalaguete in Cebu Province. She earns her living by operating two businesses: fishing and a food vending business. Her husband, Eduardo P., who is 30 years old, works as a bill collector to earn his living. They have two children; one child is 8 months old and the other is 8 years old.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosemarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP to add to her working capital in order for her to continue saving for the future education of her children and the acquisition of assets. Rosemarie P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional capital and to buy additional materials in fishing

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee es casada y tiene 2 hijos que ya terminaron la universidad y están en el proceso de titilarse en su carrera profesional. Aidee tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Aidee tiene un taller de confecciones, que se encuentra en el mismo lugar.
Aidee es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de cuadernos y gas.
Aidee sueña con tener un taller de confección mas grande y que sus hijos tengan una notaria.
texts.en:
Aidee is married and she has 2 children, they have both graduated from university and they are about to receive their degrees. Aidee has a store in a section of her house where she sells general grocery store items including vegetables and meats. She carries out her business every day with the help of her children. Aidee also has a supply store in the same locale. Aidee is a member of the community bank named Dignity. She requests a loan in the amount of 2000 soles to purchase notebooks and natural gas. Aidee dreams of having a larger supply store and to see her kids start a notary.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and natural gas.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been farming for over ten years and has employed two farmhands. Her main products are milk and eggs which she sells to the local market. She also runs a poshomill in the same area.

She has requested this loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more chickens and the proceeds will be used to pay school fees for her children. She says that her poshomill keeps breaking down and she has put a lot of money into repairs and spare parts. In the future, she would like to own a pick-up which will assist in supplying her produce to the market.

Josephine is 42 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 20. All the children attend school.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Sra. M. tiene 38 años. Esta casada con el Sr. Jacinto Calcena tienen una hija que esta en la Universidad.
Poseen casa propia en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora.
La Sra. Maria alquila un local en San Lorenzo hace 5 años donde trabaja en la confección y costuras de vestidos y ropas de todo tipo. 
El Sr. Jacinto tiene un carrito de venta de hamburguesas y panchos en la ciudad de San Lorenzo sobre una de las avenida mas transitadas de la ciudad.
 La Sra. Maria necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderías en cantidad a menor precio.
 En el futuro desean abrir una sucursal en la ciudad de Luque donde también hay mucho movimiento comercial.
texts.en:
M. is 38 years old. She is married to Mr. Jacinto Calcena and they have a daughter who is in college. They own their own home in the city of Fernando de la Mora. Maria has rented a locale in San Lorenzo for 5 years, where she works making and sewing dresses and clothing of all types. Jacinto has a cart from which he sells hamburgers and hotdogs in the city of San Lorenzo, on one of the busiest streets in the city. Maria needs this loan to adquire merchandise in bulk at a lower pirce. In the future, they want to open another locale in the city of Luque, where there is also a lot of commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, appliques, etc. to make clothing

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkan, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31  ans,  4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-coungo, sous préfecture de Fana,  région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce, d’habits, de lait et du haricot. Elles sont  quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                  
BATA D. du groupe Benkan compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habillements pour homme et femme et de tous âges.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises le plus généralement à Bamako avec les grossistes du marché et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Marka-coungo, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkan group are all married with four children, are 31 years old and live in large traditional families in the village of Marka-Counga, in the municipality of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through friends and family and sell clothes, milk and beans. They are on their fourth loan. Bata D. is a group member and aims to use the loan in order to buy clothes for men and women of all ages. She sources her goods from Bamako through wholesalers and sells her wares at the Marka-Coungo market for cash or credit to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to see to her family's everyday needs and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Guadalupe Antia

texts.es:
Guadalupe Antia tiene 36 anos. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. 
Ella es una persona muy responsable. Guadalupe tiene su negocio que es la venta de tortillas y comida donde vende arroz, fideos, pollos, carnes y jugos. Hace las compras de sus productos en el mercado en donde compra lo necesario y lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Solicita el crédito para aumentar en una gran variedad de platillos  que ofrece en su vivienda. Su sueño es tener una restaurante bien grande y estable, y que a todos sus hijos estudien. Su mayor desafío es que a veces la gente paga por crédito y nunca le pagan su dinero pero esto no la desanima pues buaca la forma de mejorar cada dia.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antia is 36 years old. She has two young children. She is a very responsible person. Guadalupe has a catering business where she makes and sells tortillas and sells food items such as rice, pastas, chicken, meats and fresh juices. She makes her purchases for everything that she needs in the market, making sure to acquire whatever her clients request. Her dream is to have a large and well-established restaurant, and she also dreams of seeing all of her children in school. She faces her greatest challenge when sales on credit are not honored, but she doesn’t get discouraged with this. Every day she looks for ways to improve.

loans.use: Workind capital.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena F. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Elena is married and has six children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elena wishes to have a better income for her family; that's why she works hard to achieve it.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng S. is a 28 year old married mother who currently lives in Kompong Tom province in Cambodia. She is married with two school-aged kids. To earn an income for living, Mrs. Cheng S. sells a few products such as perfume, fast food, plastic products in front of her home. Another source of family income comes from her husband who works as a building worker. Because selling is a profitable business for the family, Mrs. Cheng S. requested a loan to provide additional capital to purchase more items for selling.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Jerima

texts.en:
"Jerima C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 3, Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu . She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: Sari-sari (general) store and ready to wear - direct selling business. Her husband Jonathan C., who is 41 years old, works as carpenter for a living. They have 3 children, ages 11 to 18.

Jerima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jerima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 34000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20000, with which she intends to purchase more stock to sell, so she can continue to save for house renovations in future.

Jerima C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell
